Ge Ex Le Nu De Jos Jg Ru 1Sa 2Sa 1Ki 2Ki 1Ch 2Ch Ezr Ne Es Job Ps Pr Ec Son Isa Jer La Eze Da Ho Joe Am Ob Jon Mic Na Hab Zep Hag Zec Mal Mt Mr Lu Joh Ac Ro 1Co 2Co Ga Eph Php Col 1Th 2Th 1Ti 2Ti Tit Phm Heb Jas 1Pe 2Pe 1Jo 2Jo 3Jo Jud Re
Low Normal High

The Second Epistle of Paul to the

2 Corinthians

Summary"For momentary, light affliction is producing for us an eternal weight of glory far beyond all comparison, while we look not at the things which are seen, but at the things which are not seen; for the things which are seen are temporal, but the things which are not seen are eternal."

•    In chapters 8-9, He urges the Corinthians to give the offering to the believers in Judea, as they had promised. He taught that if they gave generously they would also “reap generously” (9:6).

•    Chapters 10-13 Paul defends his ministry and responds to attacks about his Apostleship. They had been questioning his authority and opposing him. Paul declares that if anyone preaches a different Gospel or a different Jesus, other than what Paul and the Apostles were preaching, they are false teachers and deceitful workers and should not be accepted.In chapter 12 7-10, Paul explains a theology of his own suffering. He asks God to remove a suffering from His life but God refuses. God responds to him, "My grace is sufficient for you, for power is perfected in weakness". Paul understood that God is sovereign and in control over even his sufferings. Therefore, Paul embraces his suffering because God allows them into his life for a purpose regardless of how difficult they may be. In times of calamity, he understood that these were times when he depended on God's strength and mercy the most. Paul responds, "Therefore I am well content with weaknesses, with insults, withdistresses, with persecutions, with difficulties, for Christ’s sake; for when I am weak, then I am strong”. Paul knew he was the strongest when he felt the weakest because he depended on God, the one who has infinite strength.The last thing Apostle Paul teaches in 2ndCorinthians is how to test yourself. If you want to know if you are a Christian, if you want to know if you are a believer and follower of Jesus Christ, than you must test yourself, “to see if you are in the faith”; examine yourself with Scripture (13:5).
    Outline
  2. 1. Paul Reconciles with the Corinthians  ( 1:1⁠–⁠7:16 )
  3. a. Introduction  ( 1:1⁠–⁠11 )
  4. i.   Paul Greets the Corinthians  ( 1:1⁠–⁠2 )
  5. ii.  The God of All Comfort  ( 1:3⁠–⁠11 )
  6. b. Paul’s Integrity  ( 1:12⁠–⁠2:11 )
  7. i.   Paul’s Changed Plans  ( 1:12⁠–⁠2:4 )
  8. ii.  Forgiveness for the Offender  ( 2:5⁠–⁠11 )
  9. c. Paul’s Ministry  ( 2:12⁠–⁠6:10 )
  10. i.   Triumph in Christ  ( 2:12⁠–⁠17 )
  11. ii.  Ministers of a New Covenant  ( 3:1⁠–⁠18 )
  12. iii. The Light of the Gospel  ( 4:1⁠–⁠6 )
  13. iv. Treasure in Jars of Clay  ( 4:7⁠–⁠18 )
  14. v.  Our Eternal Dwelling  ( 5:1⁠–⁠10 )
  15. vi. Ambassadors for Christ  ( 5:11⁠–⁠21 )
  16. vii. Hardships and God’s Grace  ( 6:1⁠–⁠10 )
  17. d. Paul’s Exhortation  ( 6:11⁠–⁠7:16 )
  18. i.   Open Your Hearts  ( 6:11⁠–⁠13 )
  19. ii.  Do Not Be Unequally Yoked with Unbelievers  ( 6:14⁠–⁠18 )
  20. iii. Paul’s Joy in the Corinthians  ( 7:1⁠–⁠16 )
  21. 2. The Collection for Jerusalem  ( 8:1⁠–⁠9:15 )
  22. a. Generosity Commended  ( 8:1⁠–⁠15 )
  23. b. Titus Commended  ( 8:16⁠–⁠24 )
  24. c. God Loves a Cheerful Giver  ( 9:1⁠–⁠15 )
  25. 3. Paul’s Final Challenge  ( 10:1⁠–⁠13:14 )
  26. a. Paul’s Apostolic Authority  ( 10:1⁠–⁠12:21 )
  27. i.   Let Him Who Boasts Boast in the Lord  ( 10:1⁠–⁠18 )
  28. ii.  Paul and the False Apostles  ( 11:1⁠–⁠15 )
  29. iii. Paul’s Suffering and Service  ( 11:16⁠–⁠33 )
  30. iv. Paul’s Revelation  ( 12:1⁠–⁠4 )
  31. v.  Paul’s Thorn and God’s Grace  ( 12:5⁠–⁠10 )
  32. vi. Concern for the Corinthians  ( 12:11⁠–⁠21 )
  33. b. Examine Yourselves  ( 13:1⁠–⁠10 )
  34. c. Benediction and Farewell  ( 13:11⁠–⁠14 )

1
Paul Reconciles with the Corinthians

Introduction

παυλος αποστολος ιησου χριστου δια θεληματος θεου και τιμοθεος ο αδελφος τη εκκλησια του θεου τη ουση εν κορινθω συν τοις αγιοις πασιν τοις ουσιν εν ολη τη αχαια
StrongsGreekEnglishMorphology
G3972ΠαῦλοςPaulos   (N-NMS)
G3972 Παῦλος Paûlos pow-los of Latin origin; (little; but remotely from a derivative of παύω, meaning the same); Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle:--Paul, Paulus. 		ΠαῦλοςPaulos Paul, N-NMS
G652ἀπόστολοςapostolos   (N-NMS)
G652 ἀπόστολος apóstolos ap-os-tol-os from ἀποστέλλω; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ (apostle) (with miraculous powers):--apostle, messenger, he that is sent. 		ἀπόστολοςapostolos apostle N-NMS
G5547ΧριστοῦChristou   (N-GMS)
G5547 Χριστός Christós khris-tos from χρίω; anointed, i.e. the Messiah, an epithet of Jesus:--Christ. 		ΧριστοῦChristou of Christ N-GMS
G2424ἸησοῦIēsou   (N-GMS)
G2424 Ἰησοῦς Iēsoûs ee-ay-sooce of Hebrew origin (יְהוֹשׁוּעַ); Jesus (i.e. Jehoshua), the name of our Lord and two (three) other Israelites:--Jesus. 		ἸησοῦIēsou Jesus N-GMS
G1223διὰdia   (Prep)
G1223 διά diá dee-ah a primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through (in very wide applications, local, causal, or occasional):--after, always, among, at, to avoid, because of (that), briefly, by, for (cause) … fore, from, in, by occasion of, of, by reason of, for sake, that, thereby, therefore, X though, through(-out), to, wherefore, with (-in). In composition it retains the same general importance. 		διὰdia by Prep

G882Ἀχαΐᾳ·Achaia   (N-DFS)
G882 Ἀχαΐα Achaḯa ach-ah-ee-ah of uncertain derivation; Achaia (i.e. Greece), a country of Europe:--Achaia. 		Ἀχαΐᾳ·Achaia Achaia. N-DFS
1 Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timothy our brother, to the church of God which is at Corinth, with all the saints which are in all Achaia:2 Corinthians 1:1
Stats
Counts: 166 characters, 29 words, 129 letters, 46 vowels, 83 consonants
Translation
Greek: παυλος αποστολος ιησου χριστου δια θεληματος θεου και τιμοθεος ο αδελφος τη εκκλησια του θεου τη ουση εν κορινθω συν τοις αγιοις πασιν τοις ουσιν εν ολη τη αχαια

Lit: Paul, apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, and Timothy, the brother, To the church of God being in Corinth, with the saints all being in all Achaia.

KJV: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timothy our brother, unto the church of God which is at Corinth, with all the saints which are in all Achaia:
References

"Paul"
Ro 1:1-5: Paul: a servant of Jesus Christ: called to be an apostle: separated to the gospel of God:
1Co 1:1: Paul: called to be an apostle of Jesus Christ through the will of God: and Sosthenes our brother:
1Ti 1:1: Paul: an apostle of Jesus Christ by the commandment of God our Saviour: and Lord Jesus Christ: which is our hope;
2Ti 1:1: Paul: an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God: according to the promise of life which is in Christ Jesus:

"Timothy"
Ac 16:1: Then came he to Derbe and Lystra: and: look: a certain disciple was there: named Timotheus: the son of a certain woman: which was a Jewess: and believed; but his father was a Greek:
Ro 16:21: Timotheus my workfellow: and Lucius: and Jason: and Sosipater: my kinsmen: greet you.
1Co 16:10: Now if Timotheus come: see that He may be with you without fear: for He works the work of the Lord: as I also do.
Php 1:1: Paul and Timotheus: the servants of Jesus Christ: to all the saints in Christ Jesus which are at Philippi: with the bishops and deacons:
Php 2:19-22: But I trust in the Lord Jesus to send Timotheus shortly to you: that I also may be of good comfort: when I know your state.
Col 1:1: 2: Paul: an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God: and Timotheus our brother:
1Th 1:1: Paul: and Silvanus: and Timotheus: to the church of the Thessalonians which is in God the Father and in the Lord Jesus Christ: Grace be to you: and peace: from God our Father: and the Lord Jesus Christ.
2Th 1:1: Paul: and Silvanus: and Timotheus: to the church of the Thessalonians in God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ:
Heb 13:23: Know you that our brother Timothy is set at liberty; with whom: if he come shortly: I will see you.

"the church"
Ac 18:1-11: After these things Paul departed from Athens: and came to Corinth;
1Co 1:2: To the church of God which is at Corinth: to them that are sanctified in Christ Jesus: called to be saints: with all that in every place call upon the name of Jesus Christ our Lord: both theirs and ours:

"all"
1Co 6:11: Such were some of you: but you are washed: but you are sanctified: but you are justified in the name of the Lord Jesus: and by the Spirit of our God.
Eph 1:1: Paul: an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God: to the saints which are at Ephesus: and to the faithful in Christ Jesus:

"Achaia"
2Co 9:2: For I know the forwardness of your mind: for which I boast of you to them of Macedonia: that Achaia was ready a year ago; and your zeal has provoked very many.
2Co 11:10: As the truth of Christ is in me: no man will stop me of this boasting in the regions of Achaia.
Ac 18:12: When Gallio was the deputy of Achaia: the Jews made insurrection with one accord against Paul: and brought him to the judgment seat:
Ro 15:26: For it has pleased them of Macedonia and Achaia to make a certain contribution for the poor saints which are at Jerusalem.
Ro 16:5: Likewise greet the church that is in their house. Greet my wellbeloved Epaenetus: who is the firstfruits of Achaia to Christ.
1Co 16:15: I beseech you: brothers: (you know the house of Stephanas: that it is the firstfruits of Achaia: and that they have addicted themselves to the ministry of the saints: )
1Th 1:7: 8: So that you were ensamples to all that believe in Macedonia and Achaia.

 χαρις υμιν και ειρηνη απο θεου πατρος ημων και κυριου ιησου χριστου

2 Grace be to you and peace from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.2 Corinthians 1:2
Stats
Rank: #249 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 80 characters, 13 words, 61 letters, 23 vowels, 38 consonants
Translation
Greek: χαρις υμιν και ειρηνη απο θεου πατρος ημων και κυριου ιησου χριστου

Lit: Grace to you and peace from God the Father of us and the Lord Jesus Christ.

KJV: Grace be to you and peace from God our Father, and [from] the Lord Jesus Christ.
References

"Grace be to you and peace from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ."
Ro 1:7: To all that be in Rome: beloved of God: called to be saints: Grace to you and peace from God our Father: and the Lord Jesus Christ.
2Sa 15:20: Whereas you came but yesterday: should I this day make you go up and down with us? seeing I go whither I may: return you: and take back your brothers: mercy and truth be with you.
1Ch 12:18: Then the spirit came upon Amasai: who was chief of the captains: and He said: Your are we: David: and on your side: you son of Jesse: peace: peace be to you: and peace be to your helpers; for your God helps you. Then David received them: and made them captains of the band.
Da 4:1: Nebuchadnezzar the king: to all people: nations: and languages: that dwell in all the earth; Peace be multiplied to you.
1Co 1:3: Grace be to you: and peace: from God our Father: and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
Ga 6:16: As many as walk according to this rule: peace be on them: and mercy: and upon the Israel of God.
Eph 6:23: Peace be to the brothers: and love with faith: from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
Php 1:2: Grace be to you: and peace: from God our Father: and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
Col 1:2: To the saints and faithful brothers in Christ which are at Colosse: Grace be to you: and peace: from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
1Th 1:1: Paul: and Silvanus: and Timotheus: to the church of the Thessalonians which is in God the Father and in the Lord Jesus Christ: Grace be to you: and peace: from God our Father: and the Lord Jesus Christ.
2Th 1:2: Grace to you: and peace: from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
Phm 1:3: Grace to you: and peace: from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

The God of All Comfort

ευλογητος ο θεος και πατηρ του κυριου ημων ιησου χριστου ο πατηρ των οικτιρμων και θεος πασης παρακλησεως

G2532καὶkai   (Conj)
G2532 καί kaí kahee apparently, a primary particle, having a copulative and sometimes also a cumulative force; and, also, even, so then, too, etc.; often used in connection (or composition) with other particles or small words:--and, also, both, but, even, for, if, or, so, that, then, therefore, when, yet. 		καὶkai and Conj

3 Blessed be God, even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies, and the God of all comfort;2 Corinthians 1:3
Stats
Rank: #680 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 108 characters, 18 words, 84 letters, 30 vowels, 54 consonants
Translation
Greek: ευλογητος ο θεος και πατηρ του κυριου ημων ιησου χριστου ο πατηρ των οικτιρμων και θεος πασης παρακλησεως

Lit: Blessed be the God and Father of the Lord of us Jesus Christ, the Father of compassions, and God of all comfort,

KJV: Blessed be God, even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies, and the God of all comfort;
References

"Blessed"
Ge 14:20: Blessed be the most high God: which has delivered your enemies into your hand. And He gave Him tithes of all.
1Ch 29:10: For what reason David blessed the LORD before all the congregation: and David said: Blessed be you: LORD God of Israel our father: for ever and ever.
Ne 9:5: Then the Levites: Jeshua: and Kadmiel: Bani: Hashabniah: Sherebiah: Hodijah: Shebaniah: and Pethahiah: said: Stand up and bless the LORD your God for ever and ever: and blessed be your glorious name: which is exalted above all blessing and praise.
Job 1:21: Said: Naked came I out of my mother's womb: and naked will I return there: the LORD gave: and the LORD has taken away; blessed be the name of the LORD.
Ps 18:46: The LORD lives; and blessed be my rock; and let the God of my salvation be exalted.
Ps 72:19: Blessed be his glorious name for ever: and let the whole earth be filled with his glory; Amen: and Amen.
Da 4:34: At the end of the days I Nebuchadnezzar lifted up my eyes to heaven: and my understanding returned to me: and I blessed the most High: and I praised and honoured him that lives for ever: whose dominion is an everlasting dominion: and his kingdom is from generation to generation:
Eph 1:3: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ: who has blessed us with all spiritual blessings in heavenly places in Christ:
1Pe 1:3: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ: which according to His abundant mercy has begotten us again to a lively hope by the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead:

"the Father of our"
2Co 11:31: The God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ: which is blessed for evermore: knows that I not lie.
Joh 5:22: 23: For the Father judges no man: but has committed all judgment to the Son:
Joh 10:30: I and my Father are one.
Joh 20:17: Jesus says to her: Touch not me; for I not am yet ascended to my Father: but go to my brothers: and say to them: I ascend to my Father: and your Father; and to my God: and your God.
Ro 15:6: That you may with one mind and one mouth glorify God: even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.
Eph 1:3: 17: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ: who has blessed us with all spiritual blessings in heavenly places in Christ:
Php 2:11: that every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ is Lord: to the glory of God the Father.
2Jo 1:4: 9: I rejoiced greatly that I found of your children walking in truth: as we have received a commandment from the Father.

"the Father of mercies"

Da 9:9: To the Lord our God belong mercies and forgivenesses: though we have rebelled against Him;
Mic 7:18: Who is a God like to you: that pardons iniquity: and passs by the transgression of the remnant of His heritage? He retains not His anger for ever: because He delights in mercy.

"the God"

G1909ἐπὶepi   (Prep)
G1909 ἐπί epí ep-ee a primary preposition; properly, meaning superimposition (of time, place, order, etc.), as a relation of distribution (with the genitive case), i.e. over, upon, etc.; of rest (with the dative case) at, on, etc.; of direction (with the accusative case) towards, upon, etc.:--about (the times), above, after, against, among, as long as (touching), at, beside, X have charge of, (be-, (where-))fore, in (a place, as much as, the time of, -to), (because) of, (up-)on (behalf of), over, (by, for) the space of, through(-out), (un-)to(-ward), with. In compounds it retains essentially the same import, at, upon, etc. (literally or figuratively). 		ἐπὶepi in Prep

G1519 εἰς eis ice a primary preposition; to or into (indicating the point reached or entered), of place, time, or (figuratively) purpose (result, etc.); also in adverbial phrases:--(abundant-)ly, against, among, as, at, (back-)ward, before, by, concerning, + continual, + far more exceeding, for (intent, purpose), fore, + forth, in (among, at, unto, -so much that, -to), to the intent that, + of one mind, + never, of, (up-)on, + perish, + set at one again, (so) that, therefore(-unto), throughout, til, to (be, the end, -ward), (here-)until(-to), …ward, (where-)fore, with. G5259ὑπὸhypo   (Prep)
G5259 ὑπό hypó hoop-o a primary preposition; under, i.e. (with the genitive case) of place (beneath), or with verbs (the agency or means, through); (with the accusative case) of place (whither (underneath) or where (below) or time (when (at)):--among, by, from, in, of, under, with. In the comparative, it retains the same general applications, especially of inferior position or condition, and specially, covertly or moderately. 		ὑπὸhypo by Prep

4 Who comforts us in all our tribulation, that we may be able to comfort them which are in any trouble, by the comfort wherewith we ourselves are comforted of God.2 Corinthians 1:4
Stats
Counts: 163 characters, 28 words, 131 letters, 50 vowels, 81 consonants
Translation
Greek: ο παρακαλων ημας επι παση τη θλιψει ημων εις το δυνασθαι ημας παρακαλειν τους εν παση θλιψει δια της παρακλησεως ης παρακαλουμεθα αυτοι υπο του θεου

Lit: the One comforting us in all the tribulation of us, for to be able us to comfort those in every tribulation through the comfort with which we are comforted ourselves by God,

KJV: Who comforteth us in all our tribulation, that we may be able to comfort them which are in any trouble, by the comfort wherewith we ourselves are comforted of God.
References

"comforteth"
2Co 7:6: 7: Nevertheless God: that comforts those that are cast down: comforted us by the coming of Titus;
Ps 86:17: Show me a token for good; that they which hate me may see it: and be ashamed: because you: LORD: have holpen me: and comforted me.
Isa 12:1: In that day you will say: O LORD: I will praise you: though you were angry with me: your anger is turned away: and you comfortedst me.
Isa 49:10: They will not hunger nor thirst; neither will the heat nor sun smite them: for he who has mercy on them will lead them: even by the springs of water will he guide them.
Isa 51:3: 12: For the LORD will comfort Zion: He will comfort all her waste places; and He will make her wilderness like Eden: and her desert like the garden of the LORD; joy and gladness will be found therein: thanksgiving: and the voice of melody.
Isa 52:9: Break forth into joy: sing together: you waste places of Jerusalem: for the LORD has comforted His people: He has redeemed Jerusalem.
Isa 66:12: 13: For thus says the LORD: Look: I will extend peace to her like a river: and the glory of the Gentiles like a flowing stream: then will you suck: you will be borne upon her sides: and be dandled upon her knees.
Joh 14:16: I will pray the Father: and He will give you another Comforter: that He may abide with you for ever;
Joh 14:18: 26: I not will leave you comfortless: I will come to you.
2Th 2:16: 17: Now our Lord Jesus Christ Himself: and God: even our Father: which has loved us: and has given us everlasting consolation and good hope through grace:

"that"
2Co 1:5: 6: For as the sufferings of Christ abound in us: so our consolation also abounds by Christ.
Ps 32:5: 7: I acknowledged my sin to you: and my iniquity have not I hid. I said: I will confess my transgressions to the LORD; and you forgave the iniquity of my sin. Selah.
Ps 34:2-6: My soul will make her boast in the LORD: the humble will hear thereof: and be glad.
Ps 66:16: Come and hear: all you that fear God: and I will declare what He has done for my soul.
Isa 40:1: Comfort you: comfort you my people: says your God.
Isa 66:14: When you see this: your heart will rejoice: and your bones will flourish like an herb: and the hand of the LORD will be known toward His servants: and His indignation toward His enemies.
Php 1:14: Many of the brothers in the Lord: waxing confident by my bonds: are much more bold to speak the word without fear.
1Th 4:18: For what reason comfort one another with these words.
1Th 5:11: For what reason comfort yourselves together: and edify one another: even as also you do.
Heb 12:12: For what reason lift up the hands which hang down: and the feeble knees;

Translation
Greek: οτι καθως περισσευει τα παθηματα του χριστου εις ημας ουτως δια χριστου περισσευει και η παρακλησις ημων

Lit: because as abound the sufferings of the Christ toward us, thus so through Christ abounds also the comfort of us.

KJV: For as the sufferings of Christ abound in us, so our consolation also aboundeth by Christ.
References

"as"
2Co 4:10: 11: Always bearing about in the body the dying of the Lord Jesus: that the life also of Jesus might be made manifest in our body.
2Co 11:23-30: Are they ministers of Christ? (I speak as a fool) I am more; in labours more abundant: in stripes above measure: in prisons more frequent: in deaths often.
Ac 9:4: He fell to the earth: and heard a voice saying to him: Saul: Saul: why persecute you me?
1Co 4:10-13: We are fools for Christ's sake: but you are wise in Christ; we are weak: but you are strong; you are honourable: but we are despised.
Php 1:20: According to my ear expectation and my hope: that not inhing I will be ashamed: but that with all boldness: as always: so now also Christ will be magnified in my body: whether it be by life: or by death.
Php 3:10: That I may know him: and the power of his resurrection: and the fellowship of his sufferings: being made conformable to his death;
Col 1:24: Who now rejoice in my sufferings for you: and fill up that which is behind of the afflictions of Christ in my flesh for His body's sake: which is the church:

"so"
Lu 2:25: And: look: there was a man in Jerusalem: whose name was Simeon; and the same man was just and devout: waiting for the consolation of Israel: and the Holy Ghost was upon Him.
Php 2:1: If there be therefore any consolation in Christ: if any comfort of love: if any fellowship of the Spirit: if any bowels and mercies:
2Th 2:16: 17: Now our Lord Jesus Christ Himself: and God: even our Father: which has loved us: and has given us everlasting consolation and good hope through grace:

ειτε δε θλιβομεθα υπερ της υμων παρακλησεως και σωτηριας της ενεργουμενης εν υπομονη των αυτων παθηματων ων και ημεις πασχομεν ειτε παρακαλουμεθα υπερ της υμων παρακλησεως και σωτηριας και η ελπις ημων βεβαια υπερ υμων

G5228ὑπὲρhyper   (Prep)
G5228 ὑπέρ hypér hoop-er a primary preposition; over, i.e. (with the genitive case) of place, above, beyond, across, or causal, for the sake of, instead, regarding; with the accusative case superior to, more than:--(+ exceeding, abundantly) above, in (on) behalf of, beyond, by, + very chiefest, concerning, exceeding (above, -ly), for, + very highly, more (than), of, over, on the part of, for sake of, in stead, than, to(-ward), very. 6 Whether we be afflicted, it is for your consolation and salvation, which is effectual in the enduring of the same sufferings which we also suffer: or whether we be comforted, it is for your consolation and salvation.2 Corinthians 1:6
Stats
Rank: #3141 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 222 characters, 33 words, 178 letters, 70 vowels, 108 consonants
Translation
Greek: ειτε δε θλιβομεθα υπερ της υμων παρακλησεως και σωτηριας της ενεργουμενης εν υπομονη των αυτων παθηματων ων και ημεις πασχομεν ειτε παρακαλουμεθα υπερ της υμων παρακλησεως και σωτηριας και η ελπις ημων βεβαια υπερ υμων

Lit: If however we are constricted, it is for your comfort and salvation; if we are encouraged, it is for your comfort, operating in the endurance of the same sufferings that also we suffer.

KJV: And whether we be afflicted, it is for your consolation and salvation, which is effectual in the enduring of the same sufferings which we also suffer: or whether we be comforted, [it is] for your consolation and salvation.
References

"whether"
2Co 1:4: Who comforts us in all our tribulation: that we may be able to comfort them which are in any trouble: by the comfort wherewith we ourselves are comforted of God.
2Co 4:15-18: For all things are for your sakes: that the abundant grace might through the thanksgiving of many redound to the glory of God.
1Co 3:21-23: Therefore let no man glory in men. For all things are yours;
2Ti 2:10: Therefore I endure all things for the elect's sakes: that they may also obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory.

"it is"
Ac 21:5: When we had accomplished those days: we departed and went our way; and they all brought us on our way: with wives and children: till we were out of the city: and we kneeled down on the shore: and prayed.

"effectual"
2Co 4:17: For our light affliction: which is but for a moment: works for us a far more exceeding and eternal weight of glory;
2Co 5:5: Now He that'>He who has wrought us for the selfsame thing is God: who also has given to us the ear of the Spirit.
Ro 5:3-5: not And only so: but we glory in tribulations also: knowing that tribulation works patience;
Ro 8:28: We know that all things work together for good to them that love God: to them who are the called according to His purpose.
Php 1:19: For I know that this will turn to my salvation through your prayer: and the supply of the Spirit of Jesus Christ:
Heb 12:10: 11: For they truly for a few days chastened us after their own pleasure; but he for our profit: that we might be partakers of his holiness.

7 Our hope of you is stedfast, knowing, that as you are partakers of the sufferings, so will you be also of the consolation.2 Corinthians 1:7
Stats
Rank: #3080 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 127 characters, 19 words, 98 letters, 39 vowels, 59 consonants
Translation
Greek: ειδοτες οτι ωσπερ κοινωνοι εστε των παθηματων ουτως και της παρακλησεως

Lit: And the hope of us is steadfast for you, knowing that as partners you are of the sufferings, so also of the comfort.

KJV: And our hope of you is stedfast, knowing, that as ye are partakers of the sufferings, so [shall ye be] also of the consolation.
References

"our"
2Co 1:14: As also you have acknowledged us in part: that we are your rejoicing: even as you also are ours in the day of the Lord Jesus.
2Co 7:9: Now I rejoice: not that you were made sorry: but that you sorrowed to repentance: for you were made sorry after a godly manner: that you might receive damage by us not inhing.
2Co 12:20: For I fear: lest'>lest: when I come: I will not find you such as I would: and that I will be found to you such as you not would: lest'>lest there be debates: envyings: wraths: strifes: backbitings: whisperings: swellings: tumults:
Php 1:6: 7: Being confident of this very thing: that He which has begun a good work in you will perform it until the day of Jesus Christ:
1Th 1:3: 4: Remembering without ceasing your work of faith: and labour of love: and patience of hope in our Lord Jesus Christ: in the sight of God and our Father;

"as ye"
Mt 5:11: 12: Blessed are you: when men will revile you: and persecute you: and will say all manner of evil against you falsely: for my sake.
Lu 22:28-30: You are they which have continued with me in my temptations.
Ro 8:17: 18: If children: then heirs; heirs of God: and joint-heirs with Christ; if so be that we suffer with Him: that we may be also glorified together.
1Co 10:13: There has no temptation taken you but such as is common to man: but God is faithful: who not will suffer you to be tempted above that you are able; but will with the temptation also make a way to escape: that you may be able to bear it.
2Th 1:4-7: So that we ourselves glory in you in the churches of God for your patience and faith in all your persecutions and tribulations that you endure:
2Ti 2:12: If we suffer: we will also reign with him: if we deny him: he also will deny us:
Jas 1:2-4: 12: My brothers: count it all joy when you fall into divers temptations;

 ου γαρ θελομεν υμας αγνοειν αδελφοι υπερ της θλιψεως ημων της γενομενης ημιν εν τη ασια οτι καθ υπερβολην εβαρηθημεν υπερ δυναμιν ωστε εξαπορηθηναι ημας και του ζην

G2309 θέλω thélō eth-el-eh-o apparently strengthened from the alternate form of αἱρέομαι; to determine (as an active option from subjective impulse; whereas βούλομαι properly denotes rather a passive acquiescence in objective considerations), i.e. choose or prefer (literally or figuratively); by implication, to wish, i.e. be inclined to (sometimes adverbially, gladly); impersonally for the future tense, to be about to; by Hebraism, to delight in:--desire, be disposed (forward), intend, list, love, mean, please, have rather, (be) will (have, -ling, - ling(-ly)). 		θέλομενthelomen do we want V-PIA-1P

8 For we not would, brothers, have you ignorant of our trouble which came to us in Asia, that we were pressed out of measure, above strength, insomuch that we despaired even of life:2 Corinthians 1:8
Stats
Counts: 180 characters, 28 words, 142 letters, 60 vowels, 82 consonants
Translation
Greek: ου γαρ θελομεν υμας αγνοειν αδελφοι υπερ της θλιψεως ημων της γενομενης ημιν εν τη ασια οτι καθ υπερβολην εβαρηθημεν υπερ δυναμιν ωστε εξαπορηθηναι ημας και του ζην

Lit: Not for do we want you to be ignorant brothers, as to the affliction of us having happened in Asia, that against excessively beyond our power, we were weighed, so as to despair for us even to live.

KJV: For we would not, brethren, have you ignorant of our trouble which came to us in Asia, that we were pressed out of measure, above strength, insomuch that we despaired even of life:
References

"of our"
2Co 4:7-12: But we have this treasure in earthen vessels: that the excellency of the power may be of God: not and of us.
Ac 19:23-35: The same time there arose no small stir about that way.
1Co 15:32: If after the manner of men I have fought with beasts at Ephesus: what advantages it me: if the dead not rise? let us eat and drink; for to morrow we die.
1Co 16:9: For a great door and effectual is opened to me: and there are many adversaries.

"insomuch"
1Co 4:8: Now you are full: now you are rich: you have reigned as kings without us: and I would to God you did reign: that we also might reign with you.
1Sa 20:3: David sware moreover: and said: Your father certainly knows that I have found grace in your eyes; and He says: not Let Jonathan know this: lest He be grieved: but truly as the LORD lives'>lives: and as your soul lives'>lives: there is but a step between me and death.
1Sa 27:1: David said in his heart: I will now perish one day by the hand of Saul: there is nothing better for me than that I should speedily escape into the land of the Philistines; and Saul will despair of me: to seek me any more in any coast of Israel: so will I escape out of his hand.

9 But we had the sentence of death in ourselves, that we not should trust in ourselves, but in God which raises the dead:2 Corinthians 1:9
Stats
Rank: #3888 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 120 characters, 21 words, 95 letters, 36 vowels, 59 consonants
Translation
Greek: αλλα αυτοι εν εαυτοις το αποκριμα του θανατου εσχηκαμεν ινα μη πεποιθοτες ωμεν εφ εαυτοις αλλ επι τω θεω τω εγειροντι τους νεκρους

Lit: But we in ourselves, the sentence of death had, in order that not trusting we should be in ourselves, but in God, the One raising the dead,

KJV: But we had the sentence of death in ourselves, that we should not trust in ourselves, but in God which raiseth the dead:
References

"that"
2Co 3:5: Not that we are sufficient of ourselves to think any thing as of ourselves; but our sufficiency is of God;
2Co 4:7: But we have this treasure in earthen vessels: that the excellency of the power may be of God: not and of us.
2Co 12:7-10: lest'>lest I should be exalted above measure through the abundance of the revelations: there was given to me a thorn in the flesh: the messenger of Satan to buffet me: lest'>lest I should be exalted above measure.
Job 40:14: Then will I also confess to you that your own right hand can save you.
Ps 22:29: All they that be fat upon earth will eat and worship: all they that go down to the dust will bow before him: and none can keep alive his own soul.
Ps 44:5-7: Through you will we push down our enemies: through your name will we tread them under that rise up against us.
Pr 28:26: He who trusts in his own heart is a fool: but whoever walks wisely: he will be delivered.
Jer 9:23: 24: Thus says the LORD: not Let the wise man glory in His wisdom: neither let the mighty man glory in His might: not let the rich man glory in His riches:
Jer 17:5-7: Thus says the LORD; Cursed be the man that trusts in man: and makes flesh His arm: and whose heart departs from the LORD.
Eze 33:13: When I will say to the righteous: that he will surely live; if he trust to his own righteousness: and commit iniquity: all his righteousnesses will not be remembered; but for his iniquity that he has committed: he will die for it.
Lu 18:9: He spoke this parable to certain which trusted in themselves that they were righteous: and despised others:

"in God"

Heb 11:19: Accounting that God was able to raise Him up: even from the dead; from where also He received Him in a figure.

G2089 ἔτι éti et-ee perhaps akin to ἔτος; yet 		ἔτιeti still Adv
G4506ῥύσεται,rhysetai   (V-FIM-3S)
G4506 ῥύομαι rhýomai rhoo-om-ahee middle voice of an obsolete verb, akin to ῥέω (through the idea of a current; compare ῥύσις); to rush or draw (for oneself), i.e. rescue:--deliver(-er). 		ῥύσεται,rhysetai He will deliver us, V-FIM-3S
10 Who delivered us from so great a death, and does deliver: in whom we trust that he will yet deliver us;2 Corinthians 1:10
Stats
Rank: #3576 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 103 characters, 19 words, 80 letters, 30 vowels, 50 consonants
Translation
Greek: ος εκ τηλικουτου θανατου ερρυσατο ημας και ρυεται εις ον ηλπικαμεν οτι και ετι ρυσεται

Lit: who from such a great a death has delivered us, and will deliver us, in whom we have hope that also still He will deliver us,

KJV: Who delivered us from so great a death, and doth deliver: in whom we trust that he will yet deliver us;
References

"Who delivered us from so great a death, and doth deliver: in whom we trust that he will yet deliver us;"

Ac 26:21: For these causes the Jews caught me in the temple: and went about to kill me.
2Ti 4:17: Notwithstanding the Lord stood with me: and strengthened me; that by me the preaching might be fully known: and that all the Gentiles might hear: and I was delivered out of the mouth of the lion.
2Pe 2:9: The Lord knows how to deliver the godly out of temptations: and to reserve the unjust to the day of judgment to be punished:

G5228 ὑπέρ hypér hoop-er a primary preposition; over, i.e. (with the genitive case) of place, above, beyond, across, or causal, for the sake of, instead, regarding; with the accusative case superior to, more than:--(+ exceeding, abundantly) above, in (on) behalf of, beyond, by, + very chiefest, concerning, exceeding (above, -ly), for, + very highly, more (than), of, over, on the part of, for sake of, in stead, than, to(-ward), very. 11 You also helping together by prayer for us, that for the gift bestowed upon us by the means of many persons thanks may be given by many on our behalf.2 Corinthians 1:11
Stats
Rank: #3445 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 149 characters, 29 words, 118 letters, 40 vowels, 78 consonants
Translation
Greek: συνυπουργουντων και υμων υπερ ημων τη δεησει ινα εκ πολλων προσωπων το εις ημας χαρισμα δια πολλων ευχαριστηθη υπερ ημων

Lit: joining together also of you for us by supplication, so that by many persons, for the toward us grace bestowed, through many, thanks may be given for us.

KJV: Ye also helping together by prayer for us, that for the gift bestowed upon us by the means of many persons thanks may be given by many on our behalf.
References

"helping"
2Co 9:14: By their prayer for you: which long after you for the exceeding grace of God in you.
Isa 37:4: It may be the LORD your God will hear the words of Rabshakeh: whom the king of Assyria His master has sent to reproach the living God: and will reprove the words which the LORD your God has heard: for what reason lift up your prayer for the remnant that is left.
Isa 62:6: 7: I have set watchmen upon your walls: O Jerusalem: which will never hold their peace day nor night: you that make mention of the LORD: not keep silence:
Ac 12:5: Peter therefore was kept in prison: but prayer was made without ceasing of the church to God for Him.
Ro 15:30-32: Now I beseech you: brothers: for the Lord Jesus Christ's sake: and for the love of the Spirit: that you strive together with me in your prayers to God for me;
Eph 6:18: 19: Praying always with all prayer and supplication in the Spirit: and watching thereunto with all perseverance and supplication for all saints;
Php 1:19: For I know that this will turn to my salvation through your prayer: and the supply of the Spirit of Jesus Christ:
Col 4:3: Withal praying also for us: that God would open to us a door of utterance: to speak the mystery of Christ: for which I am also in bonds:
1Th 5:25: Brothers: pray for us.
2Th 3:1: Finally: brothers: pray for us: that the word of the Lord may have free course: and be glorified: even as it is with you:
Phm 1:22: But withal prepare me also a lodging: for I trust that through your prayers I will be given to you.
Heb 13:18: Pray for us: for we trust we have a good conscience: in all things willing to live honestly.
Jas 5:16-18: Confess your faults one to another: and pray one for another: that you may be healed. The effectual fervent prayer of a righteous man availeth much.

"that"
2Co 4:15: For all things are for your sakes: that the abundant grace might through the thanksgiving of many redound to the glory of God.
2Co 9:11: 12: Being enriched in every thing to all bountifulness: which causes through us thanksgiving to God.

Paul’s Integrity

η γαρ καυχησις ημων αυτη εστιν το μαρτυριον της συνειδησεως ημων οτι εν απλοτητι και ειλικρινεια θεου ουκ εν σοφια σαρκικη αλλ εν χαριτι θεου ανεστραφημεν εν τω κοσμω περισσοτερως δε προς υμας

G4314πρὸςpros   (Prep)
G4314 πρός prós pros a strengthened form of πρό; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. toward (with the genitive case, the side of, i.e. pertaining to; with the dative case, by the side of, i.e. near to; usually with the accusative case, the place, time, occasion, or respect, which is the destination of the relation, i.e. whither or for which it is predicated):--about, according to , against, among, at, because of, before, between, (where-)by, for, X at thy house, in, for intent, nigh unto, of, which pertain to, that, to (the end that), X together, to (you) -ward, unto, with(-in). In the comparative case, it denotes essentially the same applications, namely, motion towards, accession to, or nearness at. 		πρὸςpros toward Prep

12 For our rejoicing is this, the testimony of our conscience, that in simplicity and godly sincerity, not with fleshly wisdom, but by the grace of God, we have had our conversation in the world, and more abundantly to you-ward.2 Corinthians 1:12

Counts: 225 characters, 33 words, 179 letters, 65 vowels, 114 consonants
Translation
Greek: η γαρ καυχησις ημων αυτη εστιν το μαρτυριον της συνειδησεως ημων οτι εν απλοτητι και ειλικρινεια θεου ουκ εν σοφια σαρκικη αλλ εν χαριτι θεου ανεστραφημεν εν τω κοσμω περισσοτερως δε προς υμας

Lit: For the boasting of us this is, the testimony of the conscience of us, that in the holiness and sincerity of God, and not in wisdom fleshly, but in the grace of God, we have conducted ourselves in the world, more abundantly now toward you.

KJV: For our rejoicing is this, the testimony of our conscience, that in simplicity and godly sincerity, not with fleshly wisdom, but by the grace of God, we have had our conversation in the world, and more abundantly to you-ward.
References

"our rejoicing"
Job 13:15: Though he kill me: yet will I trust in him: but I will maintain my own ways before him.
Job 23:10-12: But he knows the way that I take: when he has tried me: I will come forth as gold.
Job 27:5: 6: God forbid that I should justify you: till I die I not will remove my integrity from me.
Job 31:1-40: I made a covenant with my eyes; why then should I think upon a maid?
Ps 7:3-5: O LORD my God: if I have done this; if there be iniquity in my hands;
Ps 44:17-21: All this is come upon us; yet have not we forgotten you: neither have we dealt falsely in your covenant.
Isa 38:3: Said: Remember now: O LORD: I beseech you: how I have walked before you in truth and with a perfect heart: and have done that which is good in your sight. And Hezekiah wept sore.
Ac 24:16: Herein do I exercise myself: to have always a conscience void of offence toward God: and toward men.
Ro 9:1: I say the truth in Christ: I not lie: my conscience also bearing me witness in the Holy Ghost:
1Co 4:4: For I not knowhing by myself; yet am not I hereby justified: but He that'>He who judges me is the Lord.
Ga 6:4: But let every man prove his own work: and then will he have rejoicing in himself alone: not and in another.
1Ti 1:5: 19: 20: Now the end of the commandment is charity out of a pure heart: and of a good conscience: and of faith unfeigned:
Heb 13:18: Pray for us: for we trust we have a good conscience: in all things willing to live honestly.
1Pe 3:16: 21: Having a good conscience; that: whereas they speak evil of you: as of evildoers: they may be ashamed that falsely accuse your good conversation in Christ.
1Jo 3:19-22: Hereby we know that we are of the truth: and will assure our hearts before him.

"simplicity"
2Co 11:3: But I fear: lest by any means: as the serpent beguiled Eve through His subtilty: so your minds should be corrupted from the simplicity that is in Christ.
Ro 16:18: 19: For they that are such not serve our Lord Jesus Christ: but their own belly; and by good words and fair speeches deceive the hearts of the simple.

"godly"
2Co 2:17: For we not are as many: which corrupt the word of God: but as of sincerity: but as of God: in the sight of God speak we in Christ.
2Co 8:8: I not speak by commandment: but by occasion of the forwardness of others: and to prove the sincerity of your love.
Jos 24:14: Now therefore fear the LORD: and serve Him in sincerity and in truth: and put away the gods which your fathers served on the other side of the flood: and in Egypt; and serve you the LORD.
1Co 5:8: Therefore let us keep the feast: not with old leaven: neither with the leaven of malice and wickedness; but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth.
Eph 6:14: Stand therefore: having your loins girt about with truth: and having on the breastplate of righteousness;
Php 1:10: That you may approve things that are excellent; that you may be sincere and without offence till the day of Christ;
Tit 2:7: In all things shewing yourself a pattern of good works: in doctrine shewing uncorruptness: gravity: sincerity:

"not"
2Co 1:17: When I therefore was thus minded: did I use lightness? or the things that I purpose: do I purpose according to the flesh: that with me there should be yes yes: and no no?
2Co 4:2: But have renounced the hidden things of dishonesty: not walking in craftiness: nor handling the word of God deceitfully; but by manifestation of the truth commending ourselves to every man's conscience in the sight of God.
2Co 10:2-4: But I beseech you: that I not may be bold when I am present with that confidence: wherewith I think to be bold against some: which think of us as if we walked according to the flesh.
2Co 12:15-19: I will very gladly spend and be spent for you; though the more abundantly I love you: the less I be loved.
1Co 2:4: 5: 13: My speech and my preaching was not with enticing words of man's wisdom: but in demonstration of the Spirit and of power:
1Co 15:10: But by the grace of God I am what I am: and His grace which was bestowed upon me not was in vain; but I laboured more abundantly than they all: not yet I: but the grace of God which was with me.
Jas 3:13-18: Who is a wise man and endued with knowledge among you? let him show out of a good conversation his works with meekness of wisdom.
Jas 4:6: But He gives'>gives more grace. For what reason He says: God resists the proud: but gives'>gives grace to the humble.

13 For we write none other things to you, than what you read or acknowledge; and I trust you will acknowledge even to the end;2 Corinthians 1:13
Stats
Rank: #3655 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 124 characters, 22 words, 98 letters, 37 vowels, 61 consonants
Translation
Greek: ου γαρ αλλα γραφομεν υμιν αλλ η α αναγινωσκετε η και επιγινωσκετε ελπιζω δε οτι και εως τελους επιγνωσεσθε

Lit: No for other things we write to you, other than what you read or even understand; I hope now that to the end you will understand,

KJV: For we write none other things unto you, than what ye read or acknowledge; and I trust ye shall acknowledge even to the end;
References

"than"
2Co 4:2: But have renounced the hidden things of dishonesty: not walking in craftiness: nor handling the word of God deceitfully; but by manifestation of the truth commending ourselves to every man's conscience in the sight of God.
2Co 5:11: Knowing therefore the terror of the Lord: we persuade men; but we are made manifest'>manifest to God; and I trust also are made manifest'>manifest in your consciences.
2Co 13:6: But I trust that you will know that we not are reprobates.
Phm 1:6: That the communication of your faith may become effectual by the acknowledging of every good thing which is in you in Christ Jesus.

G2250ἡμέρᾳhēmera   (N-DFS)
G2250 ἡμέρα hēméra hay-mer-ah feminine (with ὥρα implied) of a derivative of (to sit; akin to the base of ἑδραῖος) meaning tame, i.e. gentle; day, i.e. (literally) the time space between dawn and dark, or the whole 24 hours (but several days were usually reckoned by the Jews as inclusive of the parts of both extremes); figuratively, a period (always defined more or less clearly by the context):--age, + alway, (mid-)day (by day, (-ly)), + for ever, judgment, (day) time, while, years. 		ἡμέρᾳhēmera day N-DFS

14 As also you have acknowledged us in part, that we are your rejoicing, even as you also are ours in the day of the Lord Jesus.2 Corinthians 1:14
Stats
Rank: #4149 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 123 characters, 24 words, 95 letters, 41 vowels, 54 consonants
Translation
Greek: καθως και επεγνωτε ημας απο μερους οτι καυχημα υμων εσμεν καθαπερ και υμεις ημων εν τη ημερα του κυριου ιησου

Lit: as also you have understood us in part, so that boasting of you we are, even as also you are ours, in the day of the Lord of us Jesus.

KJV: As also ye have acknowledged us in part, that we are your rejoicing, even as ye also are ours in the day of the Lord Jesus.
References

"in part"
2Co 2:5: But if any have caused grief: he has not grieved me: but in part: that I not may overcharge you all.
Ro 11:25: For I not would: brothers: that you should be ignorant of this mystery: lest you should be wise in your own conceits; that blindness in part is happened to Israel: until the fulness of the Gentiles be come in.
1Co 11:18: For first of all: when you come together in the church: I hear that there be divisions among you; and I partly believe it.

"that"
2Co 5:12: For we not commend ourselves again to you: but give you occasion to glory on our behalf: that you may have somewhat to answer them which glory in appearance: not and in heart.
1Co 3:21-23: Therefore let no man glory in men. For all things are yours;
Php 1:26: That your rejoicing may be more abundant in Jesus Christ for me by my coming to you again.

"even"
2Co 9:2: For I know the forwardness of your mind: for which I boast of you to them of Macedonia: that Achaia was ready a year ago; and your zeal has provoked very many.
1Co 15:31: I protest by your rejoicing which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord: I die daily.
Php 2:16: Holding forth the word of life; that I may rejoice in the day of Christ: that I not have run in vain: neither laboured in vain.
Php 4:1: Therefore: my brothers dearly beloved and longed for: my joy and crown: so stand fast in the Lord: my dearly beloved.
1Th 2:19: 20: For what is our hope: or joy: or crown of rejoicing? Are not even you in the presence of our Lord Jesus Christ at His coming?

"in the"
1Co 1:8: Who will also confirm you to the end: that you may be blameless in the day of our Lord Jesus Christ.
Php 1:6: 10: Being confident of this very thing: that He which has begun a good work in you will perform it until the day of Jesus Christ:
1Th 3:13: To the end He may stablish your hearts unblameable in holiness before God: even our Father: at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ with all His saints.
1Th 5:23: The very God of peace sanctify you wholly; and I pray God your whole spirit and soul and body be preserved blameless to the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.

G4314πρὸςpros   (Prep)
G4314 πρός prós pros a strengthened form of πρό; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. toward (with the genitive case, the side of, i.e. pertaining to; with the dative case, by the side of, i.e. near to; usually with the accusative case, the place, time, occasion, or respect, which is the destination of the relation, i.e. whither or for which it is predicated):--about, according to , against, among, at, because of, before, between, (where-)by, for, X at thy house, in, for intent, nigh unto, of, which pertain to, that, to (the end that), X together, to (you) -ward, unto, with(-in). In the comparative case, it denotes essentially the same applications, namely, motion towards, accession to, or nearness at. 		πρὸςpros to Prep

G2064 ἔρχομαι érchomai el-tho middle voice of a primary verb (used only in the present and imperfect tenses, the others being supplied by a kindred (middle voice) , or (active) , which do not otherwise occur); to come or go (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively):--accompany, appear, bring, come, enter, fall out, go, grow, X light, X next, pass, resort, be set. 		ἐλθεῖνelthein to come, V-ANA

17 When I therefore was thus minded, did I use lightness? or the things that I purpose, do I purpose according to the flesh, that with me there should be yes yes, and no no?2 Corinthians 1:17
Stats
Rank: #4464 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 172 characters, 29 words, 133 letters, 50 vowels, 83 consonants
Translation
Greek: τουτο ουν βουλευομενος μη τι αρα τη ελαφρια εχρησαμην η α βουλευομαι κατα σαρκα βουλευομαι ινα η παρ εμοι το ναι ναι και το ου ου

Lit: Thus therefore purposing, not then lightness did I use? Or what I purpose, according to flesh do I purpose, so that there should be with me Yes, yes, and No, no?

KJV: When I therefore was thus minded, did I use lightness? or the things that I purpose, do I purpose according to the flesh, that with me there should be yea yea, and nay nay?
References

"lightness"
Jg 9:4: They gave him threescore and 10 pieces of silver out of the house of Baalberith: wherewith Abimelech hired vain and light persons: which followed him.
Jer 23:32: Look: I am against them that prophesy false dreams: says the LORD: and do tell them: and cause my people to err by their lies: and by their lightness; yet I sent not them: nor commanded them: therefore they will not profit this people at all: says the LORD.
Zep 3:4: Her prophets are light and treacherous persons: her priests have polluted the sanctuary: they have done violence to the law.

"according"
2Co 1:12: For our rejoicing is this: the testimony of our conscience: that in simplicity and godly sincerity: not with fleshly wisdom: but by the grace of God: we have had our conversation in the world: and more abundantly to you-ward.
2Co 10:2: 3: But I beseech you: that I not may be bold when I am present with that confidence: wherewith I think to be bold against some: which think of us as if we walked according to the flesh.
Joh 8:15: You judge after the flesh; I judge no man.
Ga 1:16: To reveal His Son in me: that I might preach Him among the heathen; immediately I not conferred with flesh and blood:
Ga 2:2: I went up by revelation: and communicated to them that gospel which I preach among the Gentiles: but privately to them which were of reputation: lest by any means I should run: or had run: in vain.
1Th 2:18: For what reason we would have come to you: even I Paul: once and again; but Satan hindered us.

"yea"
2Co 1:18-20: But as God is true: our word toward you not was yes and no.
Mt 5:37: But let your communication be: Yes: yes; No: no: for whatever is more than these comes of evil.
Jas 5:12: But above all things: my brothers: not swear: neither by heaven: neither by the earth: neither by any other oath: but let your yes be yes; and your no: no; lest you fall into condemnation.

G3056 λόγος lógos log-os from λέγω; something said (including the thought); by implication, a topic (subject of discourse), also reasoning (the mental faculty) or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, (with the article in John) the Divine Expression (i.e. Christ):--account, cause, communication, X concerning, doctrine, fame, X have to do, intent, matter, mouth, preaching, question, reason, + reckon, remove, say(-ing), shew, X speaker, speech, talk, thing, + none of these things move me, tidings, treatise, utterance, word, work. 		λόγοςlogos word N-NMS

G1473 ἐγώ egṓ eg-o a primary pronoun of the first person I (only expressed when emphatic):--I, me. For the other cases and the plural see ἐμέ, ἐμοί, ἐμοῦ, ἡμᾶς, ἡμεῖς, ἡμῖν, ἡμῶν, etc., 		ἡμῶνhēmōn of us PPro-G1P
G4314πρὸςpros   (Prep)
G4314 πρός prós pros a strengthened form of πρό; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. toward (with the genitive case, the side of, i.e. pertaining to; with the dative case, by the side of, i.e. near to; usually with the accusative case, the place, time, occasion, or respect, which is the destination of the relation, i.e. whither or for which it is predicated):--about, according to , against, among, at, because of, before, between, (where-)by, for, X at thy house, in, for intent, nigh unto, of, which pertain to, that, to (the end that), X together, to (you) -ward, unto, with(-in). In the comparative case, it denotes essentially the same applications, namely, motion towards, accession to, or nearness at. 		πρὸςpros to Prep

18 But as God is true, our word toward you not was yes and no.2 Corinthians 1:18
Stats
Rank: #3943 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 62 characters, 11 words, 45 letters, 19 vowels, 26 consonants
Translation
Greek: πιστος δε ο θεος οτι ο λογος ημων ο προς υμας ουκ εγενετο ναι και ου

Lit: Faithful however God is, that the word of us to you not was Yes” and No.”

KJV: But as God [is] true, our word toward you was not yea and nay.

19 For the Son of God, Jesus Christ, who was preached among you by us, even by me and Silvanus and Timotheus, not was yes and no, but in Him was yes.2 Corinthians 1:19
Stats
Rank: #4780 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 147 characters, 26 words, 111 letters, 42 vowels, 69 consonants
Translation
Greek: ο γαρ του θεου υιος ιησους χριστος ο εν υμιν δι ημων κηρυχθεις δι εμου και σιλουανου και τιμοθεου ουκ εγενετο ναι και ου αλλα ναι εν αυτω γεγονεν

Lit: The of God for Son, Christ Jesus, the One among you by us having been proclaimed by me and Silvanus and Timothy, not was Yes and No, but Yes in Him it has always been.

KJV: For the Son of God, Jesus Christ, who was preached among you by us, even by me and Silvanus and Timotheus, was not yea and nay, but in him was yea.

"the Son"

Mt 26:63: 64: But Jesus held His peace. And the high priest answered and said to Him: I adjure you by the living God: that you tell us whether you be the Christ: the Son of God.

Joh 1:34: 49: I saw: and bare record that this is the Son of God.
Joh 3:16: 35: 36: For God so loved the world: that He gave His only begotten Son: that whoever believes in Him not should perish: but have everlasting life.

G4314πρὸςpros   (Prep)
G4314 πρός prós pros a strengthened form of πρό; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. toward (with the genitive case, the side of, i.e. pertaining to; with the dative case, by the side of, i.e. near to; usually with the accusative case, the place, time, occasion, or respect, which is the destination of the relation, i.e. whither or for which it is predicated):--about, according to , against, among, at, because of, before, between, (where-)by, for, X at thy house, in, for intent, nigh unto, of, which pertain to, that, to (the end that), X together, to (you) -ward, unto, with(-in). In the comparative case, it denotes essentially the same applications, namely, motion towards, accession to, or nearness at. 		πρὸςpros is for Prep
G1391δόξανdoxan   (N-AFS)
G1391 δόξα dóxa dox-ah from the base of δοκέω; glory (as very apparent), in a wide application (literal or figurative, objective or subjective):--dignity, glory(-ious), honour, praise, worship. 		δόξανdoxan glory N-AFS
G1223δι’di’   (Prep)
G1223 διά diá dee-ah a primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through (in very wide applications, local, causal, or occasional):--after, always, among, at, to avoid, because of (that), briefly, by, for (cause) … fore, from, in, by occasion of, of, by reason of, for sake, that, thereby, therefore, X though, through(-out), to, wherefore, with (-in). In composition it retains the same general importance. 		δι’di’ by Prep
G1473ἡμῶν.hēmōn   (PPro-G1P)
G1473 ἐγώ egṓ eg-o a primary pronoun of the first person I (only expressed when emphatic):--I, me. For the other cases and the plural see ἐμέ, ἐμοί, ἐμοῦ, ἡμᾶς, ἡμεῖς, ἡμῖν, ἡμῶν, etc., 		ἡμῶν.hēmōn us. PPro-G1P
20 For all the promises of God in Him are yes, and in Him Amen, to the glory of God by us.2 Corinthians 1:20
Stats
Counts: 89 characters, 19 words, 66 letters, 26 vowels, 40 consonants
Translation
Greek: οσαι γαρ επαγγελιαι θεου εν αυτω το ναι και εν αυτω το αμην τω θεω προς δοξαν δι ημων

Lit: As many as for promises of God there are, in Him is the Yes. Therefore also in Him the Amen to God is for glory by us.

KJV: For all the promises of God in him are yea, and in him Amen, unto the glory of God by us.
References

"all"

Ge 49:10: The sceptre will not depart from Judah: nor a lawgiver from between his feet: until Shiloh come; and to him will the gathering of the people be.
Ps 72:17: His name will endure for ever: his name will be continued as long as the sun: and men will be blessed in him: all nations will call him blessed.

"unto"

1Pe 1:12: To whom it was revealed: not that to themselves: but to us they did minister the things: which are now reported to you by them that have preached the gospel to you with the Holy Ghost sent down from heaven; which things the angels desire to look into.
Re 7:12: Saying: Amen: Blessing: and glory: and wisdom: and thanksgiving: and honour: and power: and might: be to our God for ever and ever. Amen.

22 Who has also sealed us, and given the ear of the Spirit in our hearts.2 Corinthians 1:22
Stats
Rank: #4347 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 75 characters, 14 words, 59 letters, 24 vowels, 35 consonants
Translation
Greek: ο και σφραγισαμενος ημας και δους τον αρραβωνα του πνευματος εν ταις καρδιαις ημων

Lit: the One also having sealed us, and having given the pledge of the Spirit in the hearts of us.

KJV: Who hath also sealed us, and given the earnest of the Spirit in our hearts.
References

"sealed"

Ro 4:11: He received the sign of circumcision: a seal of the righteousness of the faith which he had yet being uncircumcised: that he might be the father of all them that believe: though they not be circumcised; that righteousness might be imputed to them also:
Eph 1:13: 14: In whom you also trusted: after that you heard the word of truth: the gospel of your salvation: in whom also after that you believed: you were sealed with that holy Spirit of promise:
Eph 4:30: not grieve the holy Spirit of God: whereby you are sealed to the day of redemption.
2Ti 2:19: Nevertheless the foundation of God stands sure: having this seal: The Lord knows them that are His. And: Let every one that names the name of Christ depart from iniquity.
Re 2:17: He who has an ear: let Him hear what the Spirit says to the churches; To Him that overcomes will I give to eat of the hidden manna: and will give Him a white stone: and in the stone a new name written: which no man knows saving He that'>He who receives it.
Re 7:3: Saying: not Hurt the earth: neither the sea: nor the trees: till we have sealed the servants of our God in their foreheads.
Re 9:4: It was commanded them that they not should hurt the grass of the earth: neither any green thing: neither any tree; but only those men which not have the seal of God in their foreheads.

"the earnest"

Eph 1:14: Which is the ear of our inheritance until the redemption of the purchased possession: to the praise of his glory.

G1909ἐπὶepi   (Prep)
G1909 ἐπί epí ep-ee a primary preposition; properly, meaning superimposition (of time, place, order, etc.), as a relation of distribution (with the genitive case), i.e. over, upon, etc.; of rest (with the dative case) at, on, etc.; of direction (with the accusative case) towards, upon, etc.:--about (the times), above, after, against, among, as long as (touching), at, beside, X have charge of, (be-, (where-))fore, in (a place, as much as, the time of, -to), (because) of, (up-)on (behalf of), over, (by, for) the space of, through(-out), (un-)to(-ward), with. In compounds it retains essentially the same import, at, upon, etc. (literally or figuratively). 		ἐπὶepi upon Prep

G5590ψυχήν,psychēn   (N-AFS)
G5590 ψυχή psychḗ psoo-khay from ψύχω; breath, i.e. (by implication) spirit, abstractly or concretely (the animal sentient principle only; thus distinguished on the one hand from πνεῦμα, which is the rational and immortal soul; and on the other from ζωή, which is mere vitality, even of plants: these terms thus exactly correspond respectively to the Hebrew נֶפֶשׁ, רוּחַ and חַי):--heart (+ -ily), life, mind, soul, + us, + you. 		ψυχήν,psychēn soul, N-AFS
G3754ὅτιhoti   (Conj)

G1519εἰςeis   (Prep)

23 Moreover I call God for a record upon my soul, that to spare you I not came as yet to Corinth.2 Corinthians 1:23
Stats
Rank: #4681 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 96 characters, 20 words, 74 letters, 31 vowels, 43 consonants
Translation
Greek: εγω δε μαρτυρα τον θεον επικαλουμαι επι την εμην ψυχην οτι φειδομενος υμων ουκετι ηλθον εις κορινθον

Lit: I however, as witness God call upon my soul, that sparing you, not yet have I come to Corinth.

KJV: Moreover I call God for a record upon my soul, that to spare you I came not as yet unto Corinth.
References

"I call"
2Co 1:18: But as God is true: our word toward you not was yes and no.
2Co 11:11: 31: For what reason? because I love you not? God knows.
Ro 1:9: For God is my witness: whom I serve with my spirit in the gospel of His Son: that without ceasing I make mention of you always in my prayers;
Ro 9:1: I say the truth in Christ: I not lie: my conscience also bearing me witness in the Holy Ghost:
Ga 1:20: Now the things which I write to you: look: before God: I not lie.
Php 1:8: For God is my record: how greatly I long after you all in the bowels of Jesus Christ.
1Th 2:5: For neither at any time used we flattering words: as you know: nor a cloke of covetousness; God is witness:

"that"
2Co 2:1-3: But I determined this with myself: that I not would come again to you in heaviness.
2Co 10:2: 6-11: But I beseech you: that I not may be bold when I am present with that confidence: wherewith I think to be bold against some: which think of us as if we walked according to the flesh.
2Co 12:20: For I fear: lest'>lest: when I come: I will not find you such as I would: and that I will be found to you such as you not would: lest'>lest there be debates: envyings: wraths: strifes: backbitings: whisperings: swellings: tumults:
2Co 13:2: 10: I told you before: and foretell you: as if I were present: the second time; and being absent now I write to them which heretofore have sinned: and to all other: that: if I come again: I not will spare:
1Co 4:21: What will you? will I come to you with a rod: or in love: and in the spirit of meekness?
1Co 5:5: To deliver such an one to Satan for the destruction of the flesh: that the spirit may be saved in the day of the Lord Jesus.
1Ti 1:20: Of whom is Hymenaeus and Alexander; whom I have delivered to Satan: that they may not learn to blaspheme.

Translation

Lit: Not that we lord it over your faith, but fellow workers are of the joy with you; in the for faith you stand firm.

KJV: Not for that we have dominion over your faith, but are helpers of your joy: for by faith ye stand.

"that"

"for"

1Pe 5:8: 9: Be sober: be vigilant; because your adversary the devil: as a roaring lion: walks about: seeking whom he may devour:

G4314πρὸςpros   (Prep)
G4314 πρός prós pros a strengthened form of πρό; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. toward (with the genitive case, the side of, i.e. pertaining to; with the dative case, by the side of, i.e. near to; usually with the accusative case, the place, time, occasion, or respect, which is the destination of the relation, i.e. whither or for which it is predicated):--about, according to , against, among, at, because of, before, between, (where-)by, for, X at thy house, in, for intent, nigh unto, of, which pertain to, that, to (the end that), X together, to (you) -ward, unto, with(-in). 1 But I determined this with myself, that I not would come again to you in heaviness.2 Corinthians 2:1
Stats
Rank: #9964 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 83 characters, 15 words, 66 letters, 27 vowels, 39 consonants
Translation
Greek: εκρινα δε εμαυτω τουτο το μη παλιν ελθειν εν λυπη προς υμας

Lit: I judged for within myself this, not again in grief to you to come.

KJV: But I determined this with myself, that I would not come again to you in heaviness.
References

"I determined"
2Co 1:15-17: In this confidence I was minded to come to you before: that you might have a second benefit;
Ac 11:29: Then the disciples: every man according to his ability: determined to send relief to the brothers which dwelt in Judaea:
Ac 15:2: 37: When therefore Paul and Barnabas had no small dissension and disputation with them: they determined that Paul and Barnabas: and certain other of them: should go up to Jerusalem to the apostles and elders about this question.
1Co 2:2: For I not determined to know any thing among you: save Jesus Christ: and Him crucified.
1Co 5:3: For I truly: as absent in body: but present in spirit: have judged already: as though I were present: concerning him that has so done this deed:
Tit 3:12: When I will send Artemas to you: or Tychicus: be diligent to come to me to Nicopolis: for I have determined there to winter.

"that"

2Co 1:23: Moreover I call God for a record upon my soul: that to spare you I not came as yet to Corinth.
2Co 7:5-8: For: when we were come into Macedonia: our flesh had no rest: but we were troubled on every side; without were fightings: within were fears.

1Co 4:21: What will you? will I come to you with a rod: or in love: and in the spirit of meekness?

2 For if I make you sorry, who is he then that makes me glad, but the same which is made sorry by me?2 Corinthians 2:2
Stats
Counts: 100 characters, 21 words, 75 letters, 27 vowels, 48 consonants
Translation
Greek: ει γαρ εγω λυπω υμας και τις εστιν ο ευφραινων με ει μη ο λυπουμενος εξ εμου

Lit: If for I grieve you again, who is gladdening me, if not the one being grieved by me?

KJV: For if I make you sorry, who is he then that maketh me glad, but the same which is made sorry by me?
References

"For if I make you sorry, who is he then that maketh me glad, but the same which is made sorry by me?"
2Co 1:14: As also you have acknowledged us in part: that we are your rejoicing: even as you also are ours in the day of the Lord Jesus.
2Co 11:29: Who is weak: and I not am weak? who is offended: and I not burn?
Ro 12:15: Rejoice with them that do rejoice: and weep with them that weep.
1Co 12:26: Whether one member suffer: all the members suffer with it; or one member be honoured: all the members rejoice with it.

3 I wrote this same to you, lest, when I came, I should have sorrow from them of whom I ought to rejoice; having confidence in you all, that my joy is the joy of you all.2 Corinthians 2:3
Stats
Rank: #935 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 174 characters, 32 words, 132 letters, 54 vowels, 78 consonants
Translation
Greek: και εγραψα υμιν τουτο αυτο ινα μη ελθων λυπην εχω αφ ων εδει με χαιρειν πεποιθως επι παντας υμας οτι η εμη χαρα παντων υμων εστιν

Lit: And I wrote this same thing, so that not, having come, grief I might have from those of whom it behooves me to rejoice, trusting in all you, that my joy of all of you is.

KJV: And I wrote this same unto you, lest, when I came, I should have sorrow from them of whom I ought to rejoice; having confidence in you all, that my joy is the joy of you all.
References

"I wrote"
1Co 4:21: What will you? will I come to you with a rod: or in love: and in the spirit of meekness?
1Co 5:1-13: It is reported commonly that there is fornication among you: and such fornication as not is so much as named among the Gentiles: that one should have his father's wife.

"lest"
2Co 12:21: And lest: when I come again: my God will humble me among you: and that I will bewail many which have sinned already: and not have repented of the uncleanness and fornication and lasciviousness which they have committed.
2Co 13:1: 2: This is the third time I am coming to you. In the mouth of two or 3 witnesses will every word be established.

"I ought"
2Co 12:11: I am become a fool in glorying; you have compelled me: for I ought to have been commended of you: for not inhing am I behind the very chief apostles: though I not behing.

"having"
2Co 1:15: In this confidence I was minded to come to you before: that you might have a second benefit;
2Co 7:6: Nevertheless God: that comforts those that are cast down: comforted us by the coming of Titus;
2Co 8:22: We have sent with them our brother: whom we have oftentimes proved diligent in many things: but now much more diligent: upon the great confidence which I have in you.
Ga 5:10: I have confidence in you through the Lord: that you will be none otherwise minded: but He that'>He who troubles you will bear His judgment: whoever He be.
Phm 1:21: Having confidence in your obedience I wrote to you: knowing that you will also do more than I say.

4 For out of much affliction and anguish of heart I wrote to you with many tears; not that you should be grieved, but that you might know the love which I have more abundantly to you.2 Corinthians 2:4
Stats
Rank: #4258 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 183 characters, 34 words, 145 letters, 57 vowels, 88 consonants
Translation
Greek: εκ γαρ πολλης θλιψεως και συνοχης καρδιας εγραψα υμιν δια πολλων δακρυων ουχ ινα λυπηθητε αλλα την αγαπην ινα γνωτε ην εχω περισσοτερως εις υμας

Lit: Out of for much affliction and anguish of heart I wrote to you through many tears, not that you might be grieved, but the love that you might know that I have more abundantly toward you.

KJV: For out of much affliction and anguish of heart I wrote unto you with many tears; not that ye should be grieved, but that ye might know the love which I have more abundantly unto you.
References

"out"
Le 19:17: 18: You will not hate your brother in your heart: you will in any wise rebuke your neighbour: not and suffer sin upon him.
Ps 119:136: Rivers of waters run down my eyes: because they not keep your law.
Pr 27:5: 6: Open rebuke is better than secret love.
Jer 13:15-17: Hear you: and give ear; not be proud: for the LORD has spoken.
Lu 19:41-44: When he was come near: he beheld the city: and wept over it:
Ro 9:2: 3: That I have great heaviness and continual sorrow in my heart.
Php 3:18: (For many walk: of whom I have told you often: and now tell you even weeping: that they are the enemies of the cross of Christ:

"not"
2Co 7:8: 9: 12: For though I made you sorry with a letter: I not do repent: though I did repent: for I perceive that the same epistle has made you sorry: though it were but for a season.
2Co 12:15: I will very gladly spend and be spent for you; though the more abundantly I love you: the less I be loved.

"that you might"
2Co 11:2: For I am jealous over you with godly jealousy: for I have espoused you to one husband: that I may present you as a chaste virgin to Christ.

G1487ΕἰEi   (Conj)
G1487 εἰ ei i a primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.:--forasmuch as, if, that, (al-)though, whether. Often used in connection or composition with other particles, especially as in εἴγε, εἰ δὲ μή(γε), εἰ καί, εἰ μή, εἰ μή τι, εἴ περ, εἴ πως, εἴ τις, ἐκ. See also ἐάν. 		ΕἰEi If Conj

5 But if any have caused grief, he has not grieved me, but in part: that I not may overcharge you all.2 Corinthians 2:5
Stats
Rank: #5007 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 101 characters, 18 words, 77 letters, 31 vowels, 46 consonants
Translation
Greek: ει δε τις λελυπηκεν ουκ εμε λελυπηκεν αλλ απο μερους ινα μη επιβαρω παντας υμας

Lit: If however anyone has caused grief, not me has he grieved, but in part— that not I might put it too severely— all you.

KJV: But if any have caused grief, he hath not grieved me, but in part: that I may not overcharge you all.

"any"

Ga 5:10: I have confidence in you through the Lord: that you will be none otherwise minded: but He that'>He who troubles you will bear His judgment: whoever He be.

"grieved"
Ga 4:12: Brothers: I beseech you: be as I am; for I am as you are: you not have injured me at all.

7 So that contrariwise you ought rather to forgive him, and comfort him, lest perhaps such a one should be swallowed up with overmuch sorrow.2 Corinthians 2:7
Stats
Rank: #9917 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 142 characters, 20 words, 112 letters, 41 vowels, 71 consonants
Translation
Greek: ωστε τουναντιον μαλλον υμας χαρισασθαι και παρακαλεσαι μηπως τη περισσοτερα λυπη καταποθη ο τοιουτος

Lit: so that on the contrary rather for you to forgive and to comfort him, lest perhaps by more abundant sorrow should be overwhelmed such a one.

KJV: So that contrariwise ye ought rather to forgive [him], and comfort [him], lest perhaps such a one should be swallowed up with overmuch sorrow.
References

"ye"
Ga 6:1: 2: Brothers: if a man be overtaken in a fault: you which are spiritual: restore such an one in the spirit of meekness; considering yourself: lest you also be tempted.
Eph 4:32: Be you kind one to another: tenderhearted: forgiving one another: even as God for Christ's sake has forgiven you.
Col 3:13: Forbearing one another: and forgiving one another: if any man have a quarrel against any: even as Christ forgave you: so also do you.
2Th 3:6: 14: 15: Now we command you: brothers: in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ: that you withdraw yourselves from every brother that walks disorderly: not and after the tradition which He received of us.
Heb 12:12-15: For what reason lift up the hands which hang down: and the feeble knees;

"swallowed"
2Co 5:4: For we that are in this tabernacle do groan: being burdened: not for that we would be unclothed: but clothed upon: that mortality might be swallowed up of life.
2Sa 20:19: 20: I am one of them that are peaceable and faithful in Israel: you seek to destroy a city and a mother in Israel: why will you swallow up the inheritance of the LORD?
Ps 21:9: You will make them as a fiery oven in the time of your anger: the LORD will swallow them up in His wrath: and the fire will devour them.
Ps 56:1: 2: Michtam of David: when the Philistines took Him in Gath.>> Be merciful to me: O God: for man would swallow me up; He fighting daily oppresss me.
Ps 57:3: He will send from heaven: and save me from the reproach of Him that would swallow me up. Selah. God will send forth His mercy and His truth.
Ps 124:3: Then they had swallowed us up quick: when their wrath was kindled against us:
Pr 1:12: Let us swallow them up alive as the grave; and whole: as those that go down into the pit:
Isa 28:7: But they also have erred through wine: and through strong drink are out of the way; the priest and the prophet have erred through strong drink: they are swallowed up of wine: they are out of the way through strong drink; they err in vision: they stumble in judgment.
1Co 15:54: So when this corruptible will have put on incorruption: and this mortal will have put on immortality: then will be brought to pass the saying that is written: Death is swallowed up in victory.

"overmuch"
2Co 7:10: For godly sorrow works'>works repentance to not salvation to be repented of: but the sorrow of the world works'>works death.
Pr 17:22: A merry heart does good like a medicine: but a broken spirit dries the bones.
Php 2:27: For indeed He was sick nigh to death: but God had mercy on Him; not and on Him only: but on me also: lest I should have sorrow upon sorrow.
1Th 4:13: But I not would have you to be ignorant: brothers: concerning them which are asleep: that you not sorrow: even as others which have no hope.
