18 But we all, with open face beholding as in a glass the glory of the Lord, are changed into the same image from glory to glory, even as by the Spirit of the Lord.2 Corinthians 3:18
Stats
Rank: #622 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 161 characters, 31 words, 124 letters, 45 vowels, 79 consonants
Translation
Greek: ημεις δε παντες ανακεκαλυμμενω προσωπω την δοξαν κυριου κατοπτριζομενοι την αυτην εικονα μεταμορφουμεθα απο δοξης εις δοξαν καθαπερ απο κυριου πνευματος

Lit: We now all, having been unveiled in face, the glory of the Lord beholding as in a mirror, the same image are being transformed into, from glory to glory, even as from the Lord, the Spirit.

KJV: But we all, with open face beholding as in a glass the glory of the Lord, are changed into the same image from glory to glory, even as by the Spirit of the Lord.
References

"as in"
1Co 13:12: For now we see through a glass: darkly; but then face to face: now I know in part; but then will I know even as also I am known.
Jas 1:23: For if any be a hearer of the word: not and a doer: he is like to a man beholding his natural face in a glass:

"the glory"
2Co 4:4: 6: In whom the god of this world has blinded the minds of them which not believe: lest the light of the glorious gospel of Christ: who is the image of God: should shine to them.
Joh 1:14: The Word was made flesh: and dwelt among us: (and we beheld His glory: the glory as of the only begotten of the Father: ) full of grace and truth.
Joh 12:41: These things said Isaiah: when he saw his glory: and spoke of him.
1Ti 1:11: According to the glorious gospel of the blessed God: which was committed to my trust.

"are"
2Co 5:17: Therefore if any man be in Christ: He is a new creature: old things are passed away; look: all things are become new.
Ro 8:29: For whom He did foreknow: He also did predestinate to be conformed to the image of His Son: that He might be the firstborn among many brothers.
Ro 12:2: not be conformed to this world: but be you transformed by the renewing of your mind: that you may prove what is that good: and acceptable: and perfect: will of God.
Ro 13:14: But put you on the Lord Jesus Christ: and not make provision for the flesh: to fulfil the lusts thereof.
1Co 15:49: As we have borne the image of the earthy: we will also bear the image of the heavenly.
Ga 6:15: For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision availeth any thing: nor uncircumcision: but a new creature.
Eph 4:22-24: That you put off concerning the former conversation the old man: which is corrupt according to the deceitful lusts;
Col 3:10: Have put on the new man: which is renewed in knowledge after the image of him that created him:
Tit 3:5: Not by works of righteousness which we have done: but according to His mercy He saved us: by the washing of regeneration: and renewing of the Holy Ghost;
2Pe 1:5-9: Beside this: giving all diligence: add to your faith virtue; and to virtue knowledge;

"from"
Ro 8:4: 7: That the righteousness of the law might be fulfilled in us: who not walk after the flesh: but after the Spirit.

4
The Light of the Gospel

δια τουτο εχοντες την διακονιαν ταυτην καθως ηλεηθημεν ουκ εκκακουμεν

G1223ΔιὰDia   (Prep)

1 Therefore seeing we have this ministry, as we have received mercy, we not faint;2 Corinthians 4:1
Stats
Rank: #3079 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 80 characters, 12 words, 64 letters, 26 vowels, 38 consonants
Translation
Greek: δια τουτο εχοντες την διακονιαν ταυτην καθως ηλεηθημεν ουκ εκκακουμεν

Lit: Because of this, having the ministry this, as we received mercy, not we lose heart.

KJV: Therefore seeing we have this ministry, as we have received mercy, we faint not;
References

"seeing"
2Co 3:6: 12: Who also has made us able ministers of the new testament; not of the letter: but of the spirit: for the letter kills: but the spirit gives life.
2Co 5:18: All things are of God: who has reconciled us to Himself by Jesus Christ: and has given to us the ministry of reconciliation;
Eph 3:7: 8: Whereof I was made a minister: according to the gift of the grace of God given to me by the effectual working of His power.

"as"
1Co 7:25: Now concerning virgins I have no commandment of the Lord: yet I give my judgment: as one that has obtained mercy of the Lord to be faithful.
1Ti 1:13: Who was before a blasphemer: and a persecutor: and injurious: but I obtained mercy: because I did it ignorantly in unbelief.
1Pe 2:10: Which in time past were not a people: but are now the people of God: which not had obtained mercy: but now have obtained mercy.

"we faint not"
2Co 4:16: For which cause we not faint; but though our outward man perish: yet the inward man is renewed day by day.
Isa 40:30: Even the youths will faint and be weary: and the young men will utterly fall:
Ga 6:9: Let not us be weary in well doing: for in due season we will reap: if we not faint.
Eph 3:13: For what reason I desire that you not faint at my tribulations for you: which is your glory.
Php 4:13: I can do all things through Christ which strengthens me.
2Th 3:13: But you: brothers: not be weary in well doing.
Heb 12:3: For consider him that endured such contradiction of sinners against himself: lest you be wearied and faint in your minds.
Re 2:3: have borne: and have patience: and for my name's sake have laboured: and have not fainted.

2 But have renounced the hidden things of dishonesty, not walking in craftiness, nor handling the word of God deceitfully; but by manifestation of the truth commending ourselves to every man's conscience in the sight of God.2 Corinthians 4:2
Stats
Counts: 222 characters, 33 words, 182 letters, 63 vowels, 119 consonants
Translation
Greek: αλλ απειπαμεθα τα κρυπτα της αισχυνης μη περιπατουντες εν πανουργια μηδε δολουντες τον λογον του θεου αλλα τη φανερωσει της αληθειας συνιστωντες εαυτους προς πασαν συνειδησιν ανθρωπων ενωπιον του θεου

Lit: But we have renounced the hidden things of shame, not walking in craftiness nor falsifying the word of God, but by manifestation of the truth commending ourselves to every conscience of men before God.

KJV: But have renounced the hidden things of dishonesty, not walking in craftiness, nor handling the word of God deceitfully; but by manifestation of the truth commending ourselves to every man's conscience in the sight of God.
References

"renounced"
1Co 4:5: Therefore not judgehing before the time: until the Lord come: who both will bring to light the hidden things of darkness: and will make manifest the counsels of the hearts: and then will every man have praise of God.

"dishonesty"
Ro 1:16: For I not am ashamed of the gospel of Christ: for it is the power of God to salvation to every one that believes; to the Jew first: and also to the Greek.
Ro 6:21: What fruit had you then in those things whereof you are now ashamed? for the end of those things is death.
Eph 5:12: For it is a shame even to speak of those things which are done of them in secret.

"not"
2Co 1:12: For our rejoicing is this: the testimony of our conscience: that in simplicity and godly sincerity: not with fleshly wisdom: but by the grace of God: we have had our conversation in the world: and more abundantly to you-ward.
2Co 2:17: For we not are as many: which corrupt the word of God: but as of sincerity: but as of God: in the sight of God speak we in Christ.
2Co 11:3: 6: 13-15: But I fear: lest by any means: as the serpent beguiled Eve through His subtilty: so your minds should be corrupted from the simplicity that is in Christ.
Eph 4:14: That we henceforth be no more children: tossed to and fro: and carried about with every wind of doctrine: by the sleight of men: and cunning craftiness: whereby they lie in wait to deceive;
1Th 2:3-5: For our exhortation was not of deceit: nor of uncleanness: nor in guile:

"by"
2Co 5:11: Knowing therefore the terror of the Lord: we persuade men; but we are made manifest'>manifest to God; and I trust also are made manifest'>manifest in your consciences.
2Co 6:4-7: But in all things approving ourselves as the ministers of God: in much patience: in afflictions: in necessities: in distresses:
2Co 7:14: For if I have boasted any thing to him of you: I not am ashamed; but as we spoke all things to you in truth: even so our boasting: which I made before Titus: is found a truth.

3 But if our gospel be hid, it is hid to them that are lost:2 Corinthians 4:3
Stats
Rank: #2813 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 58 characters, 13 words, 43 letters, 17 vowels, 26 consonants
Translation
Greek: ει δε και εστιν κεκαλυμμενον το ευαγγελιον ημων εν τοις απολλυμενοις εστιν κεκαλυμμενον

Lit: If however indeed is concealed the gospel of us, to those who are perishing it is concealed,

KJV: But if our gospel be hid, it is hid to them that are lost:
References

"our"
Ro 2:16: In the day when God will judge the secrets of men by Jesus Christ according to my gospel.
1Th 1:5: For our gospel not came to you in word only: but also in power: and in the Holy Ghost: and in much assurance; as you know what manner of men we were among you for your sake.
1Ti 1:11: According to the glorious gospel of the blessed God: which was committed to my trust.

"it is"
2Co 4:4: In whom the god of this world has blinded the minds of them which not believe: lest the light of the glorious gospel of Christ: who is the image of God: should shine to them.
2Co 2:15: 16: For we are to God a sweet savour of Christ: in them that are saved: and in them that perish:
2Co 3:14: But their minds were blinded: for until this day remains the same vail untaken away in the reading of the old testament; which vail is done away in Christ.
Mt 11:25: At that time Jesus answered and said: I thank you: O Father: Lord of heaven and earth: because you have hid these things from the wise and prudent: and have revealed them to babes.
1Co 1:18: For the preaching of the cross is to them that perish foolishness; but to us which are saved it is the power of God.
2Th 2:9-11: Even him: whose coming is after the working of Satan with all power and signs and lying wonders:

εν οις ο θεος του αιωνος τουτου ετυφλωσεν τα νοηματα των απιστων εις το μη αυγασαι αυτοις τον φωτισμον του ευαγγελιου της δοξης του χριστου ος εστιν εικων του θεου

G3361 μή mḗ may a primary particle of qualified negation (whereas οὐ expresses an absolute denial); (adverb) not, (conjunction) lest; also (as an interrogative implying a negative answer (whereas οὐ expects an affirmative one)) whether:--any but (that), X forbear, + God forbid, + lack, lest, neither, never, no (X wise in), none, nor, (can-)not, nothing, that not, un(-taken), without. 4 In whom the god of this world has blinded the minds of them which not believe, lest the light of the glorious gospel of Christ, who is the image of God, should shine to them.2 Corinthians 4:4
Stats
Rank: #600 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 177 characters, 32 words, 139 letters, 48 vowels, 91 consonants
Translation
Greek: εν οις ο θεος του αιωνος τουτου ετυφλωσεν τα νοηματα των απιστων εις το μη αυγασαι αυτοις τον φωτισμον του ευαγγελιου της δοξης του χριστου ος εστιν εικων του θεου

Lit: in whom the god of the age this has blinded the minds of the unbelieving, so as for not to beam forth the illumination of the gospel of the glory of Christ, who is the image of God.

KJV: In whom the god of this world hath blinded the minds of them which believe not, lest the light of the glorious gospel of Christ, who is the image of God, should shine unto them.
References

"the god"
Mt 4:8: 9: Again: the devil takes him up into an exceeding high mountain: and shews him all the kingdoms of the world: and the glory of them;
Joh 12:31: 40: Now is the judgment of this world: now will the prince of this world be cast out.
Joh 14:30: Hereafter I not will talk much with you: for the prince of this world comes: and has nothing in me.
Joh 16:11: Of judgment: because the prince of this world is judged.
1Co 10:20: But I say: that the things which the Gentiles sacrifice: they sacrifice to devils: not and to God: and I not would that you should have fellowship with devils.
Eph 2:2: Wherein in time past you walked according to the course of this world: according to the prince of the power of the air: the spirit that now works in the children of disobedience:
Eph 6:12: For we not wrestle against flesh and blood: but against principalities: against powers: against the rulers of the darkness of this world: against spiritual wickedness in high places.
1Jo 5:19: And we know that we are of God: and the whole world lies in wickedness.
Re 20:2: 3: He laid hold on the dragon: that old serpent: which is the Devil: and Satan: and bound him a000 years:

"blinded"
2Co 3:14: But their minds were blinded: for until this day remains the same vail untaken away in the reading of the old testament; which vail is done away in Christ.
1Ki 22:22: The LORD said to Him: Wherewith? And He said: I will go forth: and I will be a lying spirit in the mouth of all His prophets. And He said: You will persuade Him: and prevail also: go forth: and do so.

Joh 12:40: He has blinded their eyes: and hardened their heart; that they not should see with their eyes: nor understand with their heart: and be converted: and I should heal them.

Col 1:15: Who is the image of the invisible God: the firstborn of every creature:
Heb 1:3: Who being the brightness of his glory: and the express image of his person: and upholding all things by the word of his power: when he had by himself purged our sins: sat down on the right hand of the Majesty on high;

1Jo 2:8: Again: a new commandment I write to you: which thing is true in him and in you: because the darkness is past: and the true light now shines.

5 For we not preach ourselves, but Christ Jesus the Lord; and ourselves your servants for Jesus' sake.2 Corinthians 4:5
Stats
Counts: 100 characters, 14 words, 80 letters, 29 vowels, 51 consonants
Translation
Greek: ου γαρ εαυτους κηρυσσομεν αλλα χριστον ιησουν κυριον εαυτους δε δουλους υμων δια ιησουν

Lit: Not for ourselves do we proclaim, but Christ Jesus Lord; ourselves now, servants of you, for the sake of Jesus.

KJV: For we preach not ourselves, but Christ Jesus the Lord; and ourselves your servants for Jesus' sake.

"we"

Joh 1:21-23: They asked him: What then? Are you Elias? And he says: I not am. Are you that prophet? And he answered: No.

Ac 10:25: 26: As Peter was coming in: Cornelius met him: and fell down at his feet: and worshipped him.

"and"

2Co 5:14: 15: For the love of Christ constrains us; because we thus judge: that if one died for all: then were all dead:

Joh 13:14: 15: If I then: your Lord and Master: have washed your feet; you also ought to wash one another's feet.
Ro 15:1: 2: We then that are strong ought to bear the infirmities of the weak: not and to please ourselves.
1Co 9:19-23: For though I be free from all men: yet have I made myself servant to all: that I might gain the more.

2Ti 2:10: Therefore I endure all things for the elect's sakes: that they may also obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory.

G4314πρὸςpros   (Prep)
G4314 πρός prós pros a strengthened form of πρό; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. toward (with the genitive case, the side of, i.e. pertaining to; with the dative case, by the side of, i.e. near to; usually with the accusative case, the place, time, occasion, or respect, which is the destination of the relation, i.e. whither or for which it is predicated):--about, according to , against, among, at, because of, before, between, (where-)by, for, X at thy house, in, for intent, nigh unto, of, which pertain to, that, to (the end that), X together, to (you) -ward, unto, with(-in). 6 For God, who commanded the light to shine out of darkness, has shined in our hearts, to give the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.2 Corinthians 4:6
Stats
Rank: #1930 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 169 characters, 31 words, 132 letters, 47 vowels, 85 consonants
Translation
Greek: οτι ο θεος ο ειπων εκ σκοτους φως λαμψαι ος ελαμψεν εν ταις καρδιαις ημων προς φωτισμον της γνωσεως της δοξης του θεου εν προσωπω ιησου χριστου

Lit: For it is God, having said, Out of darkness light shall shine,” who shone in the hearts of us for the radiance of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.

KJV: For God, who commanded the light to shine out of darkness, hath shined in our hearts, to give the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.
References

"who"
Ge 1:3: 14: 15: God said: Let there be light: and there was light.
Ps 74:16: The day is your: the night also is your: you have prepared the light and the sun.
Ps 136:7-9: To him that made great lights: for his mercy endureth for ever:
Isa 45:7: I form the light: and create darkness: I make peace: and create evil: I the LORD do all these things.

"shined"
Eph 1:17: That the God of our Lord Jesus Christ: the Father of glory: may give to you the spirit of wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of Him:
Eph 5:8: For you were sometimes darkness: but now are you light in the Lord: walk as children of light:
2Pe 1:19: We have also a more sure word of prophecy; to what you do well that you take heed: as to a light that shines in a dark place: until the day dawn: and the day star arise in your hearts:

"the light"
2Co 4:4: In whom the god of this world has blinded the minds of them which not believe: lest the light of the glorious gospel of Christ: who is the image of God: should shine to them.
2Co 3:18: But we all: with open face beholding as in a glass the glory of the Lord: are changed into the same image from glory to glory: even as by the Spirit of the Lord.
Ex 33:18-23: He said: I beseech you: show me your glory.
Ex 34:5-7: The LORD descended in the cloud: and stood with Him there: and proclaimed the name of the LORD.
Ps 63:2: To see your power and your glory: so as I have seen you in the sanctuary.
Ps 90:16: Let your work appear to your servants: and your glory to their children.
Isa 6:1-3: In the year that king Uzziah died I saw also the Lord sitting upon a throne: high and lifted up: and His train filled the temple.
Isa 35:2: It will blossom abundantly: and rejoice even with joy and singing: the glory of Lebanon will be given to it: the excellency of Carmel and Sharon: they will see the glory of the LORD: and the excellency of our God.
Isa 40:5: The glory of the LORD will be revealed: and all flesh will see it together: for the mouth of the LORD has spoken it.
Isa 60:2: For: look: the darkness will cover the earth: and gross darkness the people: but the LORD will arise upon you: and His glory will be seen upon you.
Joh 11:40: Jesus says to her: Said not I to you: that: if you would believe: you should see the glory of God?
Ac 7:55: 56: But He: being full of the Holy Ghost: looked up stedfastly into heaven: and saw the glory of God: and Jesus standing on the right hand of God:
1Pe 2:9: But you are a chosen generation: a royal priesthood: an holy nation: a peculiar people; that you should show forth the praises of him who has called you out of darkness into his marvellous light:

"in the"

Joh 14:9: 10: Jesus says to Him: Have I been so long time with you: and yet have you not known me: Philip? He that'>He who has seen me has seen the Father; and how say you then: Show us the Father?
Php 2:6: Who: being in the form of God: thought not it robbery to be equal with God:
Col 1:15: Who is the image of the invisible God: the firstborn of every creature:
Heb 1:3: Who being the brightness of his glory: and the express image of his person: and upholding all things by the word of his power: when he had by himself purged our sins: sat down on the right hand of the Majesty on high;
1Pe 1:12: To whom it was revealed: not that to themselves: but to us they did minister the things: which are now reported to you by them that have preached the gospel to you with the Holy Ghost sent down from heaven; which things the angels desire to look into.

Stats

Translation
Greek: εχομεν δε τον θησαυρον τουτον εν οστρακινοις σκευεσιν ινα η υπερβολη της δυναμεως η του θεου και μη εξ ημων

Lit: We have now the treasure this in earthen vessels, that the surpassingness of the power may be from God, and not from us,

KJV: But we have this treasure in earthen vessels, that the excellency of the power may be of God, and not of us.
References

"this"

2Co 6:10: As sorrowful: yet alway rejoicing; as poor: yet making many rich; as not havinghing: and yet possessing all things.
Mt 13:44: 52: Again: the kingdom of heaven is like to treasure hid in a field; the which when a man has found: he hides: and for joy thereof goes and sells all that he has: and buys that field.
Eph 3:8: To me: who am less than the least of all saints: is this grace given: that I should preach among the Gentiles the unsearchable riches of Christ;

Col 2:3: In whom are hid all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge.

"in"

2Co 10:10: For his letters: say they: are weighty and powerful; but his bodily presence is weak: and his speech contemptible.
Jg 7:13: 14: 16-20: When Gideon was come: look: there was a man that told a dream to his fellow: and said: Look: I dreamed a dream: and: indeed: a cake of barley bread tumbled into the host of Midian: and came to a tent: and smote it that it fell: and overturned it: that the tent lay along.
La 4:2: The precious sons of Zion: comparable to fine gold: how are they esteemed as earthen pitchers: the work of the hands of the potter!
1Co 1:28: Base things of the world: and things which are despised: has God chosen: yes: and things which not are: to bring to nought things that are:

Ga 4:13: 14: You know how through infirmity of the flesh I preached the gospel to you at the first.
2Ti 2:20: But in a great house there not are only vessels of gold and of silver: but also of wood and of earth; and some to honour: and some to dishonour.

"that"

Eph 1:19: 20: What is the exceeding greatness of his power to us-ward who believe: according to the working of his mighty power:

Col 2:12: Buried with Him in baptism: wherein also you are risen with Him through the faith of the operation of God: who has raised Him from the dead.
1Th 1:5: For our gospel not came to you in word only: but also in power: and in the Holy Ghost: and in much assurance; as you know what manner of men we were among you for your sake.

G235 ἀλλά allá al-lah neuter plural of ἄλλος; properly, other things, i.e. (adverbially) contrariwise (in many relations):--and, but (even), howbeit, indeed, nay, nevertheless, no, notwithstanding, save, therefore, yea, yet. 		ἀλλ’all’ but Conj
G3756οὐκouk   (Adv)
G3756 οὐ ou ookh a primary word; the absolute negative (compare μή) adverb; no or not:--+ long, nay, neither, never, no (X man), none, (can-)not, + nothing, + special, un(-worthy), when, + without, + yet but. See also οὐ μή, μῆκος., 		οὐκouk not Adv
G1820ἐξαπορούμενοι,exaporoumenoi   (V-PPM/P-NMP)
G1820 ἐξαπορέομαι exaporéomai ex-ap-or-eh-om-ahee middle voice from ἐκ and ἀπορέω; to be utterly at a loss, i.e. despond:--(in) despair. 		ἐξαπορούμενοι,exaporoumenoi despairing; V-PPM/P-NMP
8 We are troubled on every side, not yet distressed; we are perplexed, not but in despair;2 Corinthians 4:8
Stats
Counts: 90 characters, 12 words, 69 letters, 28 vowels, 41 consonants
Translation
Greek: εν παντι θλιβομενοι αλλ ου στενοχωρουμενοι απορουμενοι αλλ ουκ εξαπορουμενοι

Lit: in every way being hard pressed, but not being crushed; being perplexed, but not despairing;

KJV: We are troubled on every side, yet not distressed; [we are] perplexed, but not in despair;
References

"troubled"
2Co 1:8-10: For we not would: brothers: have you ignorant of our trouble which came to us in Asia: that we were pressed out of measure: above strength: insomuch that we despaired even of life:
2Co 6:4: But in all things approving ourselves as the ministers of God: in much patience: in afflictions: in necessities: in distresses:
2Co 7:5: For: when we were come into Macedonia: our flesh had no rest: but we were troubled on every side; without were fightings: within were fears.
2Co 11:23-30: Are they ministers of Christ? (I speak as a fool) I am more; in labours more abundant: in stripes above measure: in prisons more frequent: in deaths often.

"yet"
2Co 4:16: 17: For which cause we not faint; but though our outward man perish: yet the inward man is renewed day by day.
2Co 12:10: Therefore I take pleasure in infirmities: in reproaches: in necessities: in persecutions: in distresses for Christ's sake: for when I am weak: then am I strong.
1Sa 28:15: Samuel said to Saul: Why have you disquieted me: to bring me up? And Saul answered: I am sore distressed; for the Philistines make war against me: and God is departed from me: and answers me no more: neither by prophets: nor by dreams: therefore I have called you: that you may make known to me what I will do.
1Sa 30:6: David was greatly distressed; for the people spoke of stoning Him: because the soul of all the people was grieved: every man for His sons and for His daughters: but David encouraged Himself in the LORD His God.
Ps 56:2: 3: My enemies would daily swallow me up: for they be many that fight against me: O you most High.
Pr 14:26: In the fear of the LORD is strong confidence: and His children will have a place of refuge.
Pr 18:10: The name of the LORD is a strong tower: the righteous runs into it: and is safe.
Ro 5:3-5: not And only so: but we glory in tribulations also: knowing that tribulation works patience;
Ro 8:35-37: Who will separate us from the love of Christ? will tribulation: or distress: or persecution: or famine: or nakedness: or peril: or sword?
Jas 1:2-4: My brothers: count it all joy when you fall into divers temptations;
1Pe 1:6: 7: Wherein you greatly rejoice: though now for a season: if need be: you are in heaviness through manifold temptations:
1Pe 4:12-14: Beloved: think not it strange concerning the fiery trial which is to try you: as though some strange thing happened to you:

"not in despair"
1Sa 31:4: Then said Saul to his armourbearer: Draw your sword: and thrust me through therewith; lest these uncircumcised come and thrust me through: and abuse me. But his armourbearer not would; for he was sore afraid. Therefore Saul took a sword: and fell upon it.
Job 2:9: 10: Then said His wife to Him: Do you still retain your integrity? curse God: and die.
Ps 37:33: The LORD not will leave Him in His hand: nor condemn Him when He is judged.
Joh 14:18: I not will leave you comfortless: I will come to you.
1Co 10:13: There has no temptation taken you but such as is common to man: but God is faithful: who not will suffer you to be tempted above that you are able; but will with the temptation also make a way to escape: that you may be able to bear it.

9 Persecuted, not but forsaken; cast down, not but destroyed;2 Corinthians 4:9
Stats
Rank: #4769 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 59 characters, 6 words, 47 letters, 16 vowels, 31 consonants
Translation
Greek: διωκομενοι αλλ ουκ εγκαταλειπομενοι καταβαλλομενοι αλλ ουκ απολλυμενοι

Lit: being persecuted, but not being forsaken; being struck down, but not being destroyed;

KJV: Persecuted, but not forsaken; cast down, but not destroyed;
References

"but"
Ps 9:10: They that know your name will put their trust in you: for you: LORD: have not forsaken them that seek you.
Ps 22:1: Aijeleth Shahar: A Psalm of David.>> My God: my God: why have you forsaken me? why are you so far from helping me: and from the words of my roaring?
Ps 37:25: 28: I have been young: and now am old; yet have not I seen the righteous forsaken: nor his seed begging bread.
Isa 62:4: You will no more be termed Forsaken; neither will your land any more be termed Desolate: but you will be called Hephzibah: and your land Beulah: for the LORD delights in you: and your land will be married.
Heb 13:5: Let your conversation be without covetousness; and be content with such things as you have: for he has said: I will never leave you: nor forsake you.

"cast"
2Co 7:6: Nevertheless God: that comforts those that are cast down: comforted us by the coming of Titus;
Job 5:17-19: Look: happy is the man whom God corrects: therefore not despise you the chastening of the Almighty:
Job 22:29: When men are cast down: then you will say: There is lifting up; and he will save the humble person.
Ps 37:24: Though He fall: He will not be utterly cast down: for the LORD upholds Him with His hand.
Ps 42:5: 11: Why are you cast down: O my soul? and why are you disquieted in me? hope you in God: for I will yet praise Him for the help of His face.
Isa 43:2: When you pass through the waters: I will be with you; and through the rivers: they will not overflow you: when you walk through the fire: you will not be burned; neither will the flame kindle upon you.

10 Always bearing about in the body the dying of the Lord Jesus, that the life also of Jesus might be made manifest in our body.2 Corinthians 4:10
Stats
Rank: #4745 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 125 characters, 24 words, 99 letters, 38 vowels, 61 consonants
Translation
Greek: παντοτε την νεκρωσιν του κυριου ιησου εν τω σωματι περιφεροντες ινα και η ζωη του ιησου εν τω σωματι ημων φανερωθη

Lit: always the death of Jesus in our body carrying around, so that also the life of Jesus in the body of us should be manifested;

KJV: Always bearing about in the body the dying of the Lord Jesus, that the life also of Jesus might be made manifest in our body.
References

"bearing"
2Co 1:5: 9: For as the sufferings of Christ abound in us: so our consolation also abounds by Christ.
Ro 8:17: 18: If children: then heirs; heirs of God: and joint-heirs with Christ; if so be that we suffer with Him: that we may be also glorified together.
Ga 6:17: From henceforth let no man trouble me: for I bear in my body the marks of the Lord Jesus.
Php 3:10: 11: That I may know him: and the power of his resurrection: and the fellowship of his sufferings: being made conformable to his death;
Col 1:24: Who now rejoice in my sufferings for you: and fill up that which is behind of the afflictions of Christ in my flesh for His body's sake: which is the church:

"that"
2Co 13:4: For though He was crucified through weakness: yet He lives by the power of God. For we also are weak in Him: but we will live with Him by the power of God toward you.
Joh 14:19: Yet a little while: and the world sees me no more; but you see me: because I live: you will live also.
Ac 18:9: 10: Then spoke the Lord to Paul in the night by a vision: not Be afraid: but speak: and not hold your peace:
Ro 8:17: If children: then heirs; heirs of God: and joint-heirs with Christ; if so be that we suffer with Him: that we may be also glorified together.
2Ti 2:11: It is a faithful saying: For if we be dead with him: we will also live with him:
1Pe 4:13: But rejoice: inasmuch as you are partakers of Christ's sufferings; that: when His glory will be revealed: you may be glad also with exceeding joy.
Re 1:17: When I saw him: I fell at his feet as dead. And he laid his right hand upon me: saying to me: not Fear; I am the first and the last:

G4561σαρκὶsarki   (N-DFS)
G4561 σάρξ sárx sarx probably from the base of σαρόω; flesh (as stripped of the skin), i.e. (strictly) the meat of an animal (as food), or (by extension) the body (as opposed to the soul (or spirit), or as the symbol of what is external, or as the means of kindred), or (by implication) human nature (with its frailties (physically or morally) and passions), or (specially), a human being (as such):--carnal(-ly, + -ly minded), flesh(-ly). 		σαρκὶsarki flesh N-DFS

11 For we which live are alway delivered to death for Jesus' sake, that the life also of Jesus might be made manifest in our mortal flesh.2 Corinthians 4:11
Stats
Rank: #5775 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 137 characters, 24 words, 109 letters, 44 vowels, 65 consonants
Translation
Greek: αει γαρ ημεις οι ζωντες εις θανατον παραδιδομεθα δια ιησουν ινα και η ζωη του ιησου φανερωθη εν τη θνητη σαρκι ημων

Lit: always for we the living to death are being delivered on account of Jesus, so that also the life of Jesus may be manifested in the mortal flesh of us.

KJV: For we which live are alway delivered unto death for Jesus' sake, that the life also of Jesus might be made manifest in our mortal flesh.
References

"are alway"
Ps 44:22: Yes: for your sake are we killed all the day long; we are counted as sheep for the slaughter.
Ps 141:7: Our bones are scattered at the grave's mouth: as when one cuts and cleaves wood upon the earth.

"our"

Stats

Translation
Greek: ωστε ο μεν θανατος εν ημιν ενεργειται η δε ζωη εν υμιν

Lit: So then, death in us works, but life in you.

KJV: So then death worketh in us, but life in you.

"death"

1Co 4:10: We are fools for Christ's sake: but you are wise in Christ; we are weak: but you are strong; you are honourable: but we are despised.
Php 2:17: 30: Yes: and if I be offered upon the sacrifice and service of your faith: I joy: and rejoice with you all.
1Jo 3:16: Hereby perceive we the love of God: because He laid down His life for us: and we ought to lay down our lives for the brothers.

13 We having the same spirit of faith, according as it is written,
I believed, and therefore have I spoken; we also believe, and therefore speak;
2 Corinthians 4:13
Stats
Counts: 142 characters, 20 words, 112 letters, 48 vowels, 64 consonants
Translation
Greek: εχοντες δε το αυτο πνευμα της πιστεως κατα το γεγραμμενον επιστευσα διο ελαλησα και ημεις πιστευομεν διο και λαλουμεν

Lit: Having however the same spirit of faith, according to that having been written: I believed, therefore I have spoken,” also we believe, therefore also speak,

KJV: We having the same spirit of faith, according as it is written, I believed, and therefore have I spoken; we also believe, and therefore speak;

"the same"

Heb 11:1-40: Now faith is the substance of things hoped for: the evidence of not things seen.

"I believed"
Ps 116:10: I believed: therefore have I spoken: I was greatly afflicted:

"we also"
2Co 3:12: Seeing then that we have such hope: we use great plainness of speech:
Pr 21:28: A false witness will perish: but the man that hears speaks constantly.

14 Knowing that He which raised up the Lord Jesus will raise up us also by Jesus, and will present us with you.2 Corinthians 4:14
Stats
Rank: #7925 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 110 characters, 21 words, 87 letters, 31 vowels, 56 consonants
Translation
Greek: ειδοτες οτι ο εγειρας τον κυριον ιησουν και ημας δια ιησου εγερει και παραστησει συν υμιν

Lit: knowing that the One having raised up the Lord Jesus, also us through Jesus will raise up and will present us with you.

KJV: Knowing that he which raised up the Lord Jesus shall raise up us also by Jesus, and shall present us with you.
References

"that"
2Co 5:1-4: For we know that if our earthly house of this tabernacle were dissolved: we have a building of God: an not house made with hands: eternal in the heavens.
Isa 26:19: Your dead men will live: together with my dead body will they arise. Awake and sing: you that dwell in dust: for your dew is as the dew of herbs: and the earth will cast out the dead.
Joh 11:25: 26: Jesus said to her: I am the resurrection: and the life: He that'>He who believes in me: though He were dead: yet will He live:
Ro 8:11: But if the Spirit of Him that raised up Jesus from the dead dwell in you: He that'>He who raised up Christ from the dead will also quicken your mortal bodies by His Spirit that dwells in you.
1Co 6:14: God has both raised up the Lord: and will also raise up us by His own power.
1Co 15:20-22: But now is Christ risen from the dead: and become the firstfruits of them that slept.
1Th 4:14: For if we believe that Jesus died and rose again: even so them also which sleep in Jesus will God bring with Him.

"shall present"
2Co 11:2: For I am jealous over you with godly jealousy: for I have espoused you to one husband: that I may present you as a chaste virgin to Christ.
Eph 5:27: That he might present it to himself a glorious church: not having spot: or wrinkle: or any such thing; but that it should be holy and without blemish.
Col 1:22: 28: In the body of his flesh through death: to present you holy and unblameable and unreproveable in his sight:
Jude 1:24: Now to him that is able to keep you from falling: and to present you faultless before the presence of his glory with exceeding joy:

15 For all things are for your sakes, that the abundant grace might through the thanksgiving of many redound to the glory of God.2 Corinthians 4:15
Stats
Rank: #9661 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 126 characters, 22 words, 102 letters, 34 vowels, 68 consonants
Translation
Greek: τα γαρ παντα δι υμας ινα η χαρις πλεονασασα δια των πλειονων την ευχαριστιαν περισσευση εις την δοξαν του θεου

Lit: For all things are for the sake of you, so that the grace having abounded through more and more the thanksgiving may increase to the glory of God.

KJV: For all things are for your sakes, that the abundant grace might through the thanksgiving of many redound to the glory of God.
References

"all"
2Co 1:4-6: Who comforts us in all our tribulation: that we may be able to comfort them which are in any trouble: by the comfort wherewith we ourselves are comforted of God.
Ro 8:28: We know that all things work together for good to them that love God: to them who are the called according to His purpose.
1Co 3:21-23: Therefore let no man glory in men. For all things are yours;
Col 1:24: Who now rejoice in my sufferings for you: and fill up that which is behind of the afflictions of Christ in my flesh for His body's sake: which is the church:
2Ti 2:10: Therefore I endure all things for the elect's sakes: that they may also obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory.

"the abundant"
2Co 1:11: You also helping together by prayer for us: that for the gift bestowed upon us by the means of many persons thanks may be given by many on our behalf.
2Co 8:19: not And that only: but who was also chosen of the churches to travel with us with this grace: which is administered by us to the glory of the same Lord: and declaration of your ready mind:
2Co 9:11: 12: Being enriched in every thing to all bountifulness: which causes through us thanksgiving to God.
Ps 50:14: 23: Offer to God thanksgiving; and pay your vows to the most High:
Ga 1:24: They glorified God in me.
Eph 3:20: 21: Now to him that is able to do exceeding abundantly above all that we ask or think: according to the power that works in us:
Col 3:16: 17: Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly in all wisdom; teaching and admonishing one another in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs: singing with grace in your hearts to the Lord.
Heb 13:15: 16: By Him therefore let us offer the sacrifice of praise to God continually: that is: the fruit of our lips giving thanks to His name.
1Pe 2:9: But you are a chosen generation: a royal priesthood: an holy nation: a peculiar people; that you should show forth the praises of him who has called you out of darkness into his marvellous light:
1Pe 4:11: If any man speak: let Him speak as the oracles of God; if any man minister: let Him do it as of the ability which God gives: that God in all things may be glorified through Jesus Christ: to whom be praise and dominion for ever and ever. Amen.
Re 4:8-11: The 4 beasts had each of them 6 wings about Him; and they were full of eyes within: and they rest not day and night: saying: Holy: holy: holy: Lord God Almighty: which was: and is: and is to come.
Re 5:8-14: When he had taken the book: the 4 beasts and 4 and 20 elders fell down before the Lamb: having every one of them harps: and golden vials full of odours: which are the prayers of saints.
Re 19:4-6: The 24 elders and the 4 beasts fell down and worshipped God that sat on the throne: saying: Amen; Alleluia.

G2250 ἡμέρα hēméra hay-mer-ah feminine (with ὥρα implied) of a derivative of (to sit; akin to the base of ἑδραῖος) meaning tame, i.e. gentle; day, i.e. (literally) the time space between dawn and dark, or the whole 24 hours (but several days were usually reckoned by the Jews as inclusive of the parts of both extremes); figuratively, a period (always defined more or less clearly by the context):--age, + alway, (mid-)day (by day, (-ly)), + for ever, judgment, (day) time, while, years. 		ἡμέρᾳhēmera day N-DFS

16 For which cause we not faint; but though our outward man perish, yet the inward man is renewed day by day.2 Corinthians 4:16
Stats
Rank: #1196 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 106 characters, 19 words, 83 letters, 31 vowels, 52 consonants
Translation
Greek: διο ουκ εκκακουμεν αλλ ει και ο εξω ημων ανθρωπος διαφθειρεται αλλ ο εσωθεν ανακαινουται ημερα και ημερα

Lit: Therefore not we lose heart; but if indeed the outward of us man is being brought to decay, yet the inner of us is being renewed day and day.

KJV: For which cause we faint not; but though our outward man perish, yet the inward man is renewed day by day.
References

"we"
2Co 4:1: Therefore seeing we have this ministry: as we have received mercy: we not faint;
Ps 27:13: I had fainted: unless I had believed to see the goodness of the LORD in the land of the living.
Ps 119:81: CAPH. My soul faints for your salvation: but I hope in your word.
Isa 40:29: He gives power to the faint; and to them that have no might he increases strength.
1Co 15:58: Therefore: my beloved brothers: be you stedfast: unmoveable: always abounding in the work of the Lord: forasmuch as you know that your labour not is in vain in the Lord.

"though"
2Co 12:15: I will very gladly spend and be spent for you; though the more abundantly I love you: the less I be loved.
Job 19:26: 27: though after my skin worms destroy this body: yet in my flesh will I see God:
Ps 73:26: My flesh and my heart fails: but God is the strength of my heart: and my portion for ever.
Isa 57:1: 2: The righteous perishes: and no man lays it to heart: and merciful men are taken away: none considering that the righteous is taken away from the evil to come.
Mt 5:29: 30: If your right eye offend you: pluck it out: and cast it from you: for it is profitable for you that one of your members should perish: not and that your whole body should be cast into hell.

"the"
Ro 7:22: For I delight in the law of God after the inward man:
Eph 3:16: That He would grant you: according to the riches of His glory: to be strengthened with might by His Spirit in the inner man;
1Pe 3:4: But let it be the hidden man of the heart: in that which not is corruptible: even the ornament of a meek and quiet spirit: which is in the sight of God of great price.

"is"
Ps 51:10: Create in me a clean heart: O God; and renew a right spirit within me.
Isa 40:31: But they that wait upon the LORD will renew their strength; they will mount up with wings as eagles; they will run: not and be weary; and they will walk: not and faint.
Ro 12:2: not be conformed to this world: but be you transformed by the renewing of your mind: that you may prove what is that good: and acceptable: and perfect: will of God.
Eph 4:23: Be renewed in the spirit of your mind;
Col 3:10: Have put on the new man: which is renewed in knowledge after the image of him that created him:
Tit 3:5: Not by works of righteousness which we have done: but according to His mercy He saved us: by the washing of regeneration: and renewing of the Holy Ghost;

"day by"
Lu 11:3: Give us day by day our daily bread.

17 For our light affliction, which is but for a moment, works for us a far more exceeding and eternal weight of glory;2 Corinthians 4:17
Stats
Rank: #3229 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 117 characters, 20 words, 93 letters, 35 vowels, 58 consonants
Translation
Greek: το γαρ παραυτικα ελαφρον της θλιψεως ημων καθ υπερβολην εις υπερβολην αιωνιον βαρος δοξης κατεργαζεται ημιν

Lit: The for momentary lightness affliction of us, far surpassing to excessiveness an eternal weight of glory is producing for us,

KJV: For our light affliction, which is but for a moment, worketh for us a far more exceeding and eternal weight of glory;
References

"our"
2Co 11:23-28: Are they ministers of Christ? (I speak as a fool) I am more; in labours more abundant: in stripes above measure: in prisons more frequent: in deaths often.
Ps 30:5: For his anger endureth but a moment; in his favour is life: weeping may endure for a night: but joy cometh in the morning.
Isa 54:8: In a little wrath I hid my face from you for a moment; but with everlasting kindness will I have mercy on you: says the LORD your Redeemer.
Ac 20:23: Save that the Holy Ghost witnesss in every city: saying that bonds and afflictions abide me.
Ro 8:18: 34: 37: For I reckon that the sufferings of this present time are not worthy to be compared with the glory which will be revealed in us.
1Pe 1:6: Wherein you greatly rejoice: though now for a season: if need be: you are in heaviness through manifold temptations:
1Pe 4:7: But the end of all things is at hand: be you therefore sober: and watch to prayer.
1Pe 5:10: But the God of all grace: who has called us to His eternal glory by Christ Jesus: after that you have suffered a while: make you perfect: stablish: strengthen: settle you.

"worketh"
Ps 119:67: 71: Before I was afflicted I went astray: but now have I kept your word.
Mt 5:12: Rejoice: and be exceeding glad: for great is your reward in heaven: for so persecuted they the prophets which were before you.
Ro 5:3-5: not And only so: but we glory in tribulations also: knowing that tribulation works patience;
Php 1:19: For I know that this will turn to my salvation through your prayer: and the supply of the Spirit of Jesus Christ:
2Th 1:4: 6: So that we ourselves glory in you in the churches of God for your patience and faith in all your persecutions and tribulations that you endure:
Heb 12:10: 11: For they truly for a few days chastened us after their own pleasure; but he for our profit: that we might be partakers of his holiness.
Jas 1:3: 4: 12: Knowing this: that the trying of your faith works patience.

"far"
2Co 3:18: But we all: with open face beholding as in a glass the glory of the Lord: are changed into the same image from glory to glory: even as by the Spirit of the Lord.
Ge 15:1: After these things the word of the LORD came to Abram in a vision: saying: not Fear: Abram: I am your shield: and your exceeding great reward.
Ps 31:19: Oh how great is your goodness: which you have laid up for them that fear you; which you have wrought for them that trust in you before the sons of men!
Ps 73:24: You will guide me with your counsel: and afterward receive me to glory.
Isa 64:4: For since the beginning of the world men not have heard: nor perceived by the ear: neither has the eye seen: O God: beside you: what He has prepared for Him that waits for Him.
Lu 6:23: Rejoice you in that day: and leap for joy: for: look: your reward is great in heaven: for in the like manner did their fathers to the prophets.
Ro 2:7: To them who by patient continuance in well doing seek for glory and honour and immortality: eternal life:
1Co 2:9: But as it is written: Eye has not seen: nor ear heard: neither have entered into the heart of man: the things which God has prepared for them that love Him.
1Pe 1:7: 8: That the trial of your faith: being much more precious than of gold that perishes: though it be tried with fire: might be found to praise and honour and glory at the appearing of Jesus Christ:
1Pe 5:10: But the God of all grace: who has called us to His eternal glory by Christ Jesus: after that you have suffered a while: make you perfect: stablish: strengthen: settle you.
1Jo 3:2: Beloved: now are we the sons of God: and it does not yet appear what we will be: but we know that: when He will appear: we will be like Him; for we will see Him as He is.
Jude 1:24: Now to him that is able to keep you from falling: and to present you faultless before the presence of his glory with exceeding joy:

μη σκοπουντων ημων τα βλεπομενα αλλα τα μη βλεπομενα τα γαρ βλεπομενα προσκαιρα τα δε μη βλεπομενα αιωνια
StrongsGreekEnglishMorphology
G3361μὴmē   (Adv)
G3361 μή mḗ may a primary particle of qualified negation (whereas οὐ expresses an absolute denial); (adverb) not, (conjunction) lest; also (as an interrogative implying a negative answer (whereas οὐ expects an affirmative one)) whether:--any but (that), X forbear, + God forbid, + lack, lest, neither, never, no (X wise in), none, nor, (can-)not, nothing, that not, un(-taken), without. Often used in compounds in substantially the same relations. See also ἐὰν μή, ἵνα μή, οὐ μή, μῆκος, μηκύνω, μήν, μὴ οὐκ., 		μὴmē not Adv
G4648σκοπούντωνskopountōn   (V-PPA-GMP)
G4648 σκοπέω skopéō skop-eh-o from σκοπός; to take aim at (spy), i.e. (figuratively) regard:--consider, take heed, look at (on), mark. Compare ὀπτάνομαι. 		σκοπούντωνskopountōn are looking at V-PPA-GMP
G1473ἡμῶνhēmōn   (PPro-G1P)
G1473 ἐγώ egṓ eg-o a primary pronoun of the first person I (only expressed when emphatic):--I, me. For the other cases and the plural see ἐμέ, ἐμοί, ἐμοῦ, ἡμᾶς, ἡμεῖς, ἡμῖν, ἡμῶν, etc., 		ἡμῶνhēmōn we PPro-G1P

18 While we not look at the things which are seen, but at the things which not are seen: for the things which are seen are temporal; but the things which not are seen are eternal.2 Corinthians 4:18
Stats
Rank: #2346 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 178 characters, 30 words, 138 letters, 51 vowels, 87 consonants
Translation
Greek: μη σκοπουντων ημων τα βλεπομενα αλλα τα μη βλεπομενα τα γαρ βλεπομενα προσκαιρα τα δε μη βλεπομενα αιωνια

Lit: not are looking at we the things being seen, but the things not being seen. The things for being seen are temporary; the things however not being seen are eternal.

KJV: While we look not at the things which are seen, but at the things which are not seen: for the things which are seen are temporal; but the things which are not seen [are] eternal.
References

"we"
2Co 5:7: (For we walk by faith: not by sight:)
Ro 8:24: 25: For we are saved by hope: but hope that is seen not is hope: for what a man sees: why does he yet hope for?
Heb 11:1: 25-27: Now faith is the substance of things hoped for: the evidence of not things seen.
Heb 12:2: 3: Looking to Jesus the author and finisher of our faith; who for the joy that was set before Him endured the cross: despising the shame: and is set down at the right hand of the throne of God.

"for"
Mt 25:46: These will go away into everlasting punishment: but the righteous into life eternal.
Le 16:25: 26: The fat of the sin offering will he burn upon the altar.
2Th 2:16: Now our Lord Jesus Christ Himself: and God: even our Father: which has loved us: and has given us everlasting consolation and good hope through grace:
1Jo 2:16: 17: 25: For all that is in the world: the lust of the flesh: and the lust of the eyes: and the pride of life: not is of the Father: but is of the world.

5
Our Eternal Dwelling

οιδαμεν γαρ οτι εαν η επιγειος ημων οικια του σκηνους καταλυθη οικοδομην εκ θεου εχομεν οικιαν αχειροποιητον αιωνιον εν τοις ουρανοις

StrongsGreekEnglishMorphology
G1492Οἴδαμενoidamen   (V-RIA-1P)
G1492 εἴδω eídō i-do a primary verb; used only in certain past tenses, the others being borrowed from the equivalent ὀπτάνομαι and ὁράω; properly, to see (literally or figuratively); by implication, (in the perfect tense only) to know:--be aware, behold, X can (+ not tell), consider, (have) know(-ledge), look (on), perceive, see, be sure, tell, understand, wish, wot. Compare ὀπτάνομαι. 		Οἴδαμενoidamen We know V-RIA-1P
G1063γὰρgar   (Conj)
G1063 γάρ gár gar a primary particle; properly, assigning a reason (used in argument, explanation or intensification; often with other particles):--and, as, because (that), but, even, for, indeed, no doubt, seeing, then, therefore, verily, what, why, yet. 		γὰρgar for Conj

G3754 ὅτι hóti hot-ee neuter of ὅστις as conjunction; demonstrative, that (sometimes redundant); causative, because:--as concerning that, as though, because (that), for (that), how (that), (in) that, though, why. 		ὅτιhoti that Conj

G3772οὐρανοῖς.ouranois   (N-DMP)
G3772 οὐρανός ouranós oo-ran-os perhaps from the same as ὄρος (through the idea of elevation); the sky; by extension, heaven (as the abode of God); by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel (Christianity):--air, heaven(-ly), sky. 		οὐρανοῖς.ouranois heavens. N-DMP
1 For we know that if our earthly house of this tabernacle were dissolved, we have a building of God, an not house made with hands, eternal in the heavens.2 Corinthians 5:1
Stats
Rank: #1496 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 153 characters, 26 words, 121 letters, 49 vowels, 72 consonants
Translation
Greek: οιδαμεν γαρ οτι εαν η επιγειος ημων οικια του σκηνους καταλυθη οικοδομην εκ θεου εχομεν οικιαν αχειροποιητον αιωνιον εν τοις ουρανοις

Lit: We know for that if earthly of us house, the tent, should be destroyed, a building from God we have, a house not made with hands, eternal in the heavens.

KJV: For we know that if our earthly house of this tabernacle were dissolved, we have a building of God, an house not made with hands, eternal in the heavens.
References

"we know"
Job 19:25: 26: For I know that my redeemer lives: and that he will stand at the latter day upon the earth:
Ps 56:9: When I cry to you: then will my enemies turn back: this I know; for God is for me.
2Ti 1:12: For the which cause I also suffer these things: nevertheless I not am ashamed: for I know whom I have believed: and am persuaded that he is able to keep that which I have committed to him against that day.
1Jo 3:2: 14: 19: Beloved: now are we the sons of God: and it does not yet appear what we will be: but we know that: when He will appear: we will be like Him; for we will see Him as He is.
1Jo 5:19: 20: And we know that we are of God: and the whole world lies in wickedness.

"our"
2Co 5:4: For we that are in this tabernacle do groan: being burdened: not for that we would be unclothed: but clothed upon: that mortality might be swallowed up of life.
2Co 4:7: But we have this treasure in earthen vessels: that the excellency of the power may be of God: not and of us.
Ge 3:19: In the sweat of your face will you eat bread: till you return to the ground; for out of it were you taken: for dust you are: and to dust will you return.
Job 4:19: How much less in them that dwell in houses of clay: whose foundation is in the dust: which are crushed before the moth?
1Co 15:46-48: Howbeit that was not first which is spiritual: but that which is natural; and afterward that which is spiritual.
2Pe 1:13: 14: Yes: I think it meet: as long as I am in this tabernacle: to stir you up by putting you in remembrance;

"dissolved"
Job 30:22: You lift me up to the wind; you cause me to ride upon it: and dissolve my substance.
2Pe 3:11: Seeing then that all these things will be dissolved: what manner of persons ought you to be in all holy conversation and godliness:

"a building"
Joh 14:2: 3: In my Father's house are many mansions: if it were not so: I would have told you. I go to prepare a place for you.
1Co 3:9: For we are labourers together with God: you are God's husbandry: you are God's building.
Heb 11:10: For He looked for a city which has foundations: whose builder and maker is God.

"an"
Col 2:11: In whom also you are circumcised with the circumcision made without hands: in putting off the body of the sins of the flesh by the circumcision of Christ:
Heb 9:11: 24: But Christ being come an high priest of good things to come: by a greater and more perfect tabernacle: not made with hands: that is to say: not of this building;
1Pe 1:4: To an inheritance incorruptible: and undefiled: and that fades not away: reserved in heaven for you:

2 For in this we groan, earnestly desiring to be clothed upon with our house which is from heaven:2 Corinthians 5:2
Stats
Rank: #6036 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 96 characters, 17 words, 77 letters, 30 vowels, 47 consonants
Translation
Greek: και γαρ εν τουτω στεναζομεν το οικητηριον ημων το εξ ουρανου επενδυσασθαι επιποθουντες

Lit: And indeed, in this we groan, the dwelling of us which is from heaven to be clothed with longing.

KJV: For in this we groan, earnestly desiring to be clothed upon with our house which is from heaven:
References

"we"
2Co 5:4: For we that are in this tabernacle do groan: being burdened: not for that we would be unclothed: but clothed upon: that mortality might be swallowed up of life.
Ro 7:24: O wretched man that I am! who will deliver me from the body of this death?
Ro 8:23: not And only they: but ourselves also: which have the firstfruits of the Spirit: even we ourselves groan within ourselves: waiting for the adoption: to wit: the redemption of our body.
1Pe 1:6: 7: Wherein you greatly rejoice: though now for a season: if need be: you are in heaviness through manifold temptations:

"earnestly"
Php 1:23: For I am in a strait betwixt two: having a desire to depart: and to be with Christ; which is far better:

"clothed"
2Co 5:3: 4: If so be that being clothed we will not be found naked.
1Co 15:53: 54: For this corruptible must put on incorruption: and this mortal must put on immortality.

G1487εἴei   (Conj)
G1487 εἰ ei i a primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.:--forasmuch as, if, that, (al-)though, whether. Often used in connection or composition with other particles, especially as in εἴγε, εἰ δὲ μή(γε), εἰ καί, εἰ μή, εἰ μή τι, εἴ περ, εἴ πως, εἴ τις, ἐκ. See also ἐάν. 		εἴei If Conj
G1065γεge   (Prtcl)
G1065 γέ gé gheh a primary particle of emphasis or qualification (often used with other particles prefixed):--and besides, doubtless, at least, yet., 		γεge indeed Prtcl
G2532καὶkai   (Conj)
G2532 καί kaí kahee apparently, a primary particle, having a copulative and sometimes also a cumulative force; and, also, even, so then, too, etc.; often used in connection (or composition) with other particles or small words:--and, also, both, but, even, for, if, or, so, that, then, therefore, when, yet. 		καὶkai also Conj

3 If so be that being clothed we will not be found naked.2 Corinthians 5:3
Stats
Rank: #7728 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 56 characters, 12 words, 44 letters, 16 vowels, 28 consonants
Translation
Greek: ειγε και ενδυσαμενοι ου γυμνοι ευρεθησομεθα

Lit: If indeed also having been clothed, not naked we will be found.

KJV: If so be that being clothed we shall not be found naked.

"being"

Re 3:18: I counsel you to buy of me gold tried in the fire: that you may'>may'>may be rich; and white clothing: that you may'>may'>may be clothed: and that the shame of your nakedness not do appear; and anoint your eyes with eyesalve: that you may'>may'>may see.

4 For we that are in this tabernacle do groan, being burdened: not for that we would be unclothed, but clothed upon, that mortality might be swallowed up of life.2 Corinthians 5:4
Stats
Rank: #7001 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 160 characters, 25 words, 127 letters, 47 vowels, 80 consonants
Translation
Greek: και γαρ οι οντες εν τω σκηνει στεναζομεν βαρουμενοι {VAR1: επειδη } {VAR2: εφ ω } ου θελομεν εκδυσασθαι αλλ επενδυσασθαι ινα καταποθη το θνητον υπο της ζωης

Lit: And for, being in the tent, we groan, being burdened, because that not we do wish to be unclothed but to be clothed, that may be swallowed up the mortal by life.

KJV: For we that are in this tabernacle do groan, being burdened: not for that we would be unclothed, but clothed upon, that mortality might be swallowed up of life.

1Co 15:53: 54: For this corruptible must put on incorruption: and this mortal must put on immortality.

5 Now He that'>He who has wrought us for the selfsame thing is God, who also has given to us the ear of the Spirit.2 Corinthians 5:5
Stats
Rank: #6935 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 113 characters, 22 words, 89 letters, 32 vowels, 57 consonants
Translation
Greek: ο δε κατεργασαμενος ημας εις αυτο τουτο θεος ο και δους ημιν τον αρραβωνα του πνευματος

Lit: The One now having prepared us for very this is God, having given to us the pledge of the Spirit,

KJV: Now he that hath wrought us for the selfsame thing is God, who also hath given unto us the earnest of the Spirit.
References

"wrought"
2Co 4:17: For our light affliction: which is but for a moment: works for us a far more exceeding and eternal weight of glory;
Isa 29:23: But when He sees His children: the work of my hands: in the middle of Him: they will sanctify my name: and sanctify the Holy one of Jacob: and will fear the God of Israel.
Isa 60:21: Your people also will be all righteous: they will inherit the land for ever: the branch of my planting: the work of my hands: that I may be glorified.
Isa 61:3: To appoint to them that mourn in Zion: to give to them beauty for ashes: the oil of joy for mourning: the garment of praise for the spirit of heaviness; that they might be called trees of righteousness: the planting of the LORD: that He might be glorified.
Eph 2:10: For we are His workmanship: created in Christ Jesus to good works: which God has before ordained that we should walk in them.

"the earnest"
2Co 1:22: Who has also sealed us: and given the ear of the Spirit in our hearts.
Nu 13:23-27: They came to the brook of Eshcol: and cut down from there a branch with one cluster of grapes: and they bare it between two upon a staff; and they brought of the pomegranates: and of the figs.
Ro 8:23: not And only they: but ourselves also: which have the firstfruits of the Spirit: even we ourselves groan within ourselves: waiting for the adoption: to wit: the redemption of our body.
Eph 1:13: 14: In whom you also trusted: after that you heard the word of truth: the gospel of your salvation: in whom also after that you believed: you were sealed with that holy Spirit of promise:
Eph 4:30: not grieve the holy Spirit of God: whereby you are sealed to the day of redemption.
1Jo 3:24: He that'>He who keeps His commandments dwells in Him: and He in Him. And hereby we know that He abides in us: by the Spirit which He has given us.

6 Therefore we are always confident, knowing that, whilst we are at home in the body, we are absent from the Lord:2 Corinthians 5:6
Stats
Counts: 112 characters, 18 words, 88 letters, 33 vowels, 55 consonants
Translation
Greek: θαρρουντες ουν παντοτε και ειδοτες οτι ενδημουντες εν τω σωματι εκδημουμεν απο του κυριου

Lit: being confident therefore always and knowing that, being at home in the body, we are absent from the Lord;

KJV: Therefore we are always confident, knowing that, whilst we are at home in the body, we are absent from the Lord:
References

"we are always"
2Co 5:8: We are confident: I say: and willing rather to be absent from the body: and to be present with the Lord.
Ps 27:3: 4: Though an host should encamp against me: my heart will not fear: though war should rise against me: in this will I be confident.
Pr 14:26: In the fear of the LORD is strong confidence: and His children will have a place of refuge.
Isa 30:15: For thus says the Lord GOD: the Holy one of Israel; In returning and rest will you be saved; in quietness and in confidence will be your strength: and you not would.
Isa 36:4: Rabshakeh said to them: Say you now to Hezekiah: Thus says the great king: the king of Assyria: What confidence is this wherein you trustest?
Heb 10:35: not Cast away therefore your confidence: which has great recompence of reward.
1Pe 5:1: The elders which are among you I exhort: who am also an elder: and a witness of the sufferings of Christ: and also a partaker of the glory that will be revealed:
Re 1:9: I John: who also am your brother: and companion in tribulation: and in the kingdom and patience of Jesus Christ: was in the isle that is called Patmos: for the word of God: and for the testimony of Jesus Christ.

"whilst"
2Co 5:1: For we know that if our earthly house of this tabernacle were dissolved: we have a building of God: an not house made with hands: eternal in the heavens.
1Ch 29:15: For we are strangers before you: and sojourners: as were all our fathers: our days on the earth are as a shadow: and there is none abiding.
Ps 39:12: Hear my prayer: O LORD: and give ear to my cry; not hold your peace at my tears: for I am a stranger with you: and a sojourner: as all my fathers were.
Ps 119:19: I am a stranger in the earth: not hide your commandments from me.
Php 3:20: 21: For our conversation is in heaven; from where also we look for the Saviour: the Lord Jesus Christ:
Heb 11:13: These all died in faith: not having received the promises: but having seen them afar off: and were persuaded of them: and embraced them: and confessed that they were strangers and pilgrims on the earth.
Heb 13:14: For here have we no continuing city: but we seek one to come.

StrongsGreekEnglishMorphology
G1223διὰdia   (Prep)
G1223 διά diá dee-ah a primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through (in very wide applications, local, causal, or occasional):--after, always, among, at, to avoid, because of (that), briefly, by, for (cause) … fore, from, in, by occasion of, of, by reason of, for sake, that, thereby, therefore, X though, through(-out), to, wherefore, with (-in). In composition it retains the same general importance. 		διὰdia by Prep
G4102πίστεωςpisteōs   (N-GFS)
G4102 πίστις pístis pis-tis from πείθω; persuasion, i.e. credence; moral conviction (of religious truth, or the truthfulness of God or a religious teacher), especially reliance upon Christ for salvation; abstractly, constancy in such profession; by extension, the system of religious (Gospel) truth itself:--assurance, belief, believe, faith, fidelity. 		πίστεωςpisteōs faith N-GFS

7 (For we walk by faith, not by sight:)2 Corinthians 5:7
Stats
Rank: #1598 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 37 characters, 7 words, 26 letters, 7 vowels, 19 consonants
Translation
Greek: δια πιστεως γαρ περιπατουμεν ου δια ειδους

Lit: by faith for we walk, not by sight.

KJV: (For we walk by faith, not by sight:)
References

"(For we walk by faith, not by sight:)"
2Co 1:24: Not for that we have dominion over your faith: but are helpers of your joy: for by faith you stand.
2Co 4:18: While we not look at the things which are seen: but at the things which not are seen: for the things which are seen are temporal; but the things which not are seen are eternal.
De 12:9: For you not are as yet come to the rest and to the inheritance: which the LORD your God gives you.
Ro 8:24: 25: For we are saved by hope: but hope that is seen not is hope: for what a man sees: why does he yet hope for?
1Co 13:12: For now we see through a glass: darkly; but then face to face: now I know in part; but then will I know even as also I am known.
Ga 2:20: I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; not yet I: but Christ lives in me: and the life which I now live in the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God: who loved me: and gave Himself for me.
Heb 10:38: Now the just will live by faith: but if any man draw back: my soul will have no pleasure in him.
Heb 11:1-26: 27: Now faith is the substance of things hoped for: the evidence of not things seen.
1Pe 1:8: Whom not having seen: you love; in whom: though now you see him not: yet believing: you rejoice with joy unspeakable and full of glory:
1Pe 5:9: Whom resist stedfast in the faith: knowing that the same afflictions are accomplished in your brothers that are in the world.

G4314 πρός prós pros a strengthened form of πρό; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. toward (with the genitive case, the side of, i.e. pertaining to; with the dative case, by the side of, i.e. near to; usually with the accusative case, the place, time, occasion, or respect, which is the destination of the relation, i.e. whither or for which it is predicated):--about, according to , against, among, at, because of, before, between, (where-)by, for, X at thy house, in, for intent, nigh unto, of, which pertain to, that, to (the end that), X together, to (you) -ward, unto, with(-in). 8 We are confident, I say, and willing rather to be absent from the body, and to be present with the Lord.2 Corinthians 5:8
Stats
Rank: #2670 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 104 characters, 18 words, 80 letters, 28 vowels, 52 consonants
Translation
Greek: θαρρουμεν δε και ευδοκουμεν μαλλον εκδημησαι εκ του σωματος και ενδημησαι προς τον κυριον

Lit: We are confident now, and are pleased, rather to be absent out of the body, and to be at home with the Lord.

KJV: We are confident, I say, and willing rather to be absent from the body, and to be present with the Lord.
References

"and willing"
2Co 5:6: Therefore we are always confident: knowing that: whilst we are at home in the body: we are absent from the Lord:
2Co 12:2: 3: I knew a man in Christ above 14 years ago: (whether in the body: I cannot tell; or whether out of the body: I cannot tell: God knows;) such an one caught up to the third heaven.
Lu 2:29: Lord: now let you your servant depart in peace: according to your word:
Ac 21:13: Then Paul answered: What mean you to weep and to break my heart? for I am not ready to be bound only: but also to die at Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus.
Php 1:20-24: According to my ear expectation and my hope: that not inhing I will be ashamed: but that with all boldness: as always: so now also Christ will be magnified in my body: whether it be by life: or by death.
2Ti 4:7: 8: I have fought a good fight: I have finished my course: I have kept the faith:
2Pe 1:14: 15: Knowing that shortly I must put off this my tabernacle: even as our Lord Jesus Christ has showed me.
2Pe 3:11: 12: Seeing then that all these things will be dissolved: what manner of persons ought you to be in all holy conversation and godliness:

"present"
2Co 5:9: For what reason we labour: that: whether present or absent: we may be accepted of him.
Ps 16:11: You will show me the path of life: in your presence is fulness of joy; at your right hand there are pleasures for evermore.
Ps 17:15: As for me: I will look your face in righteousness: I will be satisfied: when I awake: with your likeness.
Ps 73:23-26: Nevertheless I am continually with you: you have holden me by my right hand.
Mt 25:21: 23: His lord said to him: Well done: you good and faithful servant: you have been faithful over a few things: I will make you ruler over many things: enter you into the joy of your lord.
Joh 14:3: If I go and prepare a place for you: I will come again: and receive you to myself; that where I am: there you may be also.
Joh 17:24: Father: I will that they also: whom you have given me: be with me where I am; that they may look my glory: which you have given me: for you lovedst me before the foundation of the world.
1Th 4:17: 18: Then we which are alive and remain will be caught up together with them in the clouds: to meet the Lord in the air: and so will we ever be with the Lord.
1Jo 3:2: Beloved: now are we the sons of God: and it does not yet appear what we will be: but we know that: when He will appear: we will be like Him; for we will see Him as He is.
Re 7:14-17: I said to him: Sir: you know. And he said to me: These are they which came out of great tribulation: and have washed their robes: and made them white in the blood of the Lamb.
Re 22:3: There will be no more curse: but the throne of God and of the Lamb will be in it; and His servants will serve Him:

9 For what reason we labour, that, whether present or absent, we may be accepted of him.2 Corinthians 5:9
Stats
Counts: 80 characters, 11 words, 63 letters, 24 vowels, 39 consonants
Translation
Greek: διο και φιλοτιμουμεθα ειτε ενδημουντες ειτε εκδημουντες ευαρεστοι αυτω ειναι

Lit: Therefore also we are ambitious, whether being at home or being away, well-pleasing to Him to be.

KJV: Wherefore we labour, that, whether present or absent, we may be accepted of him.
References

"we labour"
Joh 6:27: not Labour for the meat which perishes: but for that meat which endures to everlasting life: which the Son of man will give to you: for Him has God the Father sealed.
Ro 15:20: Yes: so have I strived to preach the gospel: nowhere Christ was named: lest I should build upon another man's foundation:
1Co 9:26: 27: I therefore so run: not as uncertainly; so fight I: not as one that beats the air:
1Co 15:58: Therefore: my beloved brothers: be you stedfast: unmoveable: always abounding in the work of the Lord: forasmuch as you know that your labour not is in vain in the Lord.
Col 1:29: To what I also labour: striving according to his working: which works in me mightily.
1Th 4:11: That you study to be quiet: and to do your own business: and to work with your own hands: as we commanded you;
1Ti 4:10: For therefore we both labour and suffer reproach: because we trust in the living God: who is the Saviour of all men: specially of those that believe.
Heb 4:11: Let us labour therefore to enter into that rest: lest any man fall after the same example of unbelief.
2Pe 1:10: 11: For what reason the rather: brothers: give diligence to make your calling and election sure: for if you do these things: you will never fall:
2Pe 3:14: For what reason: beloved: seeing that you look for such things: be diligent that you may be found of him in peace: without spot: and blameless.

"whether"
2Co 5:6: 8: Therefore we are always confident: knowing that: whilst we are at home in the body: we are absent from the Lord:
Ro 14:8: For whether we live: we live to the Lord; and whether we die: we die to the Lord: whether we live therefore: or die: we are the Lord's.

"accepted"
Ge 4:7: If you do well: will you not be accepted? and if you do not well: sin lies at the door. And to you will be his desire: and you will rule over him.
Isa 56:7: Even them will I bring to my holy mountain: and make them joyful in my house of prayer: their burnt offerings and their sacrifices will be accepted upon my altar; for my house will be called an house of prayer for all people.
Ac 10:35: But in every nation he who fears him: and works righteousness: is accepted with him.
Eph 1:6: To the praise of the glory of his grace: wherein he has made us accepted in the beloved.
Heb 12:28: For what reason we receiving a kingdom which cannot be moved: let us have grace: whereby we may serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear:

G4314πρὸςpros   (Prep)
G4314 πρός prós pros a strengthened form of πρό; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. toward (with the genitive case, the side of, i.e. pertaining to; with the dative case, by the side of, i.e. near to; usually with the accusative case, the place, time, occasion, or respect, which is the destination of the relation, i.e. whither or for which it is predicated):--about, according to , against, among, at, because of, before, between, (where-)by, for, X at thy house, in, for intent, nigh unto, of, which pertain to, that, to (the end that), X together, to (you) -ward, unto, with(-in). In the comparative case, it denotes essentially the same applications, namely, motion towards, accession to, or nearness at. 		πρὸςpros according to Prep

10 For we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ; that every one may receive the things done in His body, according to that He has done, whether it be good or bad.2 Corinthians 5:10
Stats
Rank: #717 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 177 characters, 27 words, 136 letters, 51 vowels, 85 consonants
Translation
Greek: τους γαρ παντας ημας φανερωθηναι δει εμπροσθεν του βηματος του χριστου ινα κομισηται εκαστος τα δια του σωματος προς α επραξεν ειτε αγαθον ειτε κακον

Lit: For all of us to be revealed it behooves before the judgment seat of Christ, that may receive back each the things done in the body, according to what he did, whether good or evil.

KJV: For we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ; that every one may receive the things done in [his] body, according to that he hath done, whether [it be] good or bad.

"we"

11 Knowing therefore the terror of the Lord, we persuade men; but we are made manifest'>manifest to God; and I trust also are made manifest'>manifest in your consciences.2 Corinthians 5:11
Stats
Counts: 149 characters, 24 words, 119 letters, 49 vowels, 70 consonants
Translation
Greek: ειδοτες ουν τον φοβον του κυριου ανθρωπους πειθομεν θεω δε πεφανερωμεθα ελπιζω δε και εν ταις συνειδησεσιν υμων πεφανερωσθαι

Lit: Knowing therefore the fear of the Lord, men we persuade to God and we have been made manifest; I hope now also in the consciences of you to have been made manifest.

KJV: Knowing therefore the terror of the Lord, we persuade men; but we are made manifest unto God; and I trust also are made manifest in your consciences.
References

"the terror"
Ge 35:5: They journeyed: and the terror of God was upon the cities that were round about them: and they not did pursue after the sons of Jacob.
Job 6:4: For the arrows of the Almighty are within me: the poison whereof drinks up my spirit: the terrors of God do set themselves in array against me.
Job 18:11: Terrors will make him afraid on every side: and will drive him to his feet.
Job 31:23: For destruction from God was a terror to me: and by reason of His highness I not could endure.
Ps 73:19: How are they brought into desolation: as in a moment! they are utterly consumed with terrors.
Ps 76:7: You: even you: are to be feared: and who may stand in your sight when once you are angry?
Ps 88:15: 16: I am afflicted and ready to die from my youth up: while I suffer your terrors I am distracted.
Ps 90:11: Who knows the power of your anger? even according to your fear: so is your wrath.
Isa 33:14: The sinners in Zion are afraid; fearfulness has surprised the hypocrites. Who among us will dwell with the devouring fire? who among us will dwell with everlasting burnings?
Na 1:6: Who can stand before his indignation? and who can abide in the fierceness of his anger? his fury is poured out like fire: and the rocks are thrown down by him.
Mt 10:28: not fear them which kill the body: but not are able to kill the soul: but rather fear him which is able to destroy both soul and body in hell.
Mt 25:46: These will go away into everlasting punishment: but the righteous into life eternal.
Mr 8:35-38: For whoever will save his life will lose it; but whoever will lose his life for my sake and the gospel's: the same will save it.
Mr 9:43-50: If your hand offend you: cut it off: it is better for you to enter into life maimed: than having two hands to go into hell: into the fire that never will be quenched:
Lu 12:5: But I will forewarn you whom you will fear: Fear him: which after he has killed has power to cast into hell; yes: I say to you: Fear him.
Heb 10:31: It is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God.
Jude 1:23: Others save with fear: pulling them out of the fire; hating even the garment spotted by the flesh.
Re 20:15: whoever not was found written in the book of life was cast into the lake of fire.

Ac 26:26: For the king knows of these things: before whom also I speak freely: for I am persuaded that none of these things are hidden from him; for this thing not was done in a corner.
Ac 28:23: When they had appointed Him a day: there came many to Him into His lodging; to whom He expounded and testified the kingdom of God: persuading them concerning Jesus: both out of the law of Moses: and out of the prophets: from morning till evening.
Ga 1:10: For do I now persuade men: or God? or do I seek to please men? for if I yet pleased men: I not should be the servant of Christ.

"but"
