Counts: 85 characters, 15 words, 64 letters, 26 vowels, 38 consonants
Translation
Greek: την δε αυτην αντιμισθιαν ως τεκνοις λεγω πλατυνθητε και υμεις

Lit: Now as the same recompense, as to children I speak, be expanded also you.

KJV: Now for a recompence in the same, (I speak as unto my children,) be ye also enlarged.
References

"I speak"
1Co 4:14: 15: I not write these things to shame you: but as my beloved sons I warn you.
Ga 4:19: My little children: of whom I travail in birth again until Christ be formed in you:
1Th 2:11: As you know how we exhorted and comforted and charged every one of you: as a father does his children:
Heb 12:5: 6: you have forgotten the exhortation which speaks to you as to children: My son: not despise you the chastening of the Lord: nor faint when you are rebuked of Him:
1Jo 2:1: 12-14: My little children: these things write I to you: that you not sin. And if any man sin: we have an advocate with the Father: Jesus Christ the righteous:
1Jo 3:7: 18: Little children: let no man deceive you: he who does righteousness is righteous: even as he is righteous.
3Jo 1:4: I have no greater joy than to hear that my children walk in truth.

"be"
2Ki 13:14-19: Now Elisha was fallen sick of his sickness whereof he died. And Joash the king of Israel came down to him: and wept over his face: and said: O my father: my father: the chariot of Israel: and the horsemen thereof.
Ps 81:10: I am the LORD your God: which brought you out of the land of Egypt: open your mouth wide: and I will fill it.

Mt 17:19-21: Then came the disciples to Jesus apart: and said: Why not could we cast Him out?
Mr 6:4-6: But Jesus said to them: A prophet not is without honour: but in His own country: and among His own kin: and in His own house.
Mr 11:24: Therefore I say to you: What things soever you desire: when you pray: believe that you receive them: and you will have them.
Jas 1:6: 7: But let him ask in faith: nothing wavering. For he who waves is like a wave of the sea driven with the wind and tossed.
1Jo 5:14: 15: This is the confidence that we have in him: that: if we ask any thing according to his will: he hears us:

Do Not Be Unequally Yoked with Unbelievers

μη γινεσθε ετεροζυγουντες απιστοις τις γαρ μετοχη δικαιοσυνη και ανομια τις δε κοινωνια φωτι προς σκοτος
StrongsGreekEnglishMorphology
G3361ΜὴMē   (Adv)
G3361 μή mḗ may a primary particle of qualified negation (whereas οὐ expresses an absolute denial); (adverb) not, (conjunction) lest; also (as an interrogative implying a negative answer (whereas οὐ expects an affirmative one)) whether:--any but (that), X forbear, + God forbid, + lack, lest, neither, never, no (X wise in), none, nor, (can-)not, nothing, that not, un(-taken), without. Often used in compounds in substantially the same relations. See also ἐὰν μή, ἵνα μή, οὐ μή, μῆκος, μηκύνω, μήν, μὴ οὐκ., 		ΜὴMē Not Adv
G1096γίνεσθεginesthe   (V-PMM/P-2P)

14 Be you not unequally yoked together with unbelievers: for what fellowship has righteousness with unrighteousness? and what communion has light with darkness?2 Corinthians 6:14
Stats
Rank: #301 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 158 characters, 20 words, 134 letters, 47 vowels, 87 consonants
Translation
Greek: μη γινεσθε ετεροζυγουντες απιστοις τις γαρ μετοχη δικαιοσυνη και ανομια τις δε κοινωνια φωτι προς σκοτος

Lit: Not become unequally yoked together with unbelievers; what for partnership have righteousness and lawlessness? Or what fellowship light with darkness?

KJV: Be ye not unequally yoked together with unbelievers: for what fellowship hath righteousness with unrighteousness? and what communion hath light with darkness?
References

"unequally"
Ex 34:16: you take of their daughters to your sons: and their daughters go a whoring after their gods: and make your sons go a whoring after their gods.
Le 19:19: You will keep my statutes. You will not let your cattle gender with a diverse kind: you will not sow your field with mingled seed: neither will a garment mingled of linen and woollen come upon you.
De 7:2: 3: When the LORD your God will deliver them before you; you will smite them: and utterly destroy them; you will make no covenant with them: nor show mercy to them:
De 22:9-11: You will not sow your vineyard with divers seeds: lest the fruit of your seed which you have sown: and the fruit of your vineyard: be defiled.
Ezr 9:1: 2: 11: 12: Now when these things were done: the princes came to me: saying: The people of Israel: and the priests: and the Levites: not have separated themselves from the people of the lands: doing according to their abominations: even of the Canaanites: the Hittites: the Perizzites: the Jebusites: the Ammonites: the Moabites: the Egyptians: and the Amorites.
Ezr 10:19: They gave their hands that they would put away their wives; and being guilty: they offered a ram of the flock for their trespass.
Ne 13:1-3: 23-26: On that day they read in the book of Moses in the audience of the people; and therein was found written: that the Ammonite and the Moabite not should come into the congregation of God for ever;
Ps 106:35: But were mingled among the heathen: and learned their works.
Pr 22:24: Make no friendship with an angry man; and with a furious man you will not go:
Mal 2:11: 15: Judah has dealt treacherously: and an abomination is committed in Israel and in Jerusalem; for Judah has profaned the holiness of the LORD which He loved: and has married the daughter of a strange god.
1Co 5:9: I wrote to you in an not epistle to company with fornicators:
1Co 7:39: The wife is bound by the law as long as her husband lives; but if her husband be dead: she is at liberty to be married to whom she will; only in the Lord.
1Co 15:33: not Be deceived: evil communications corrupt good manners.
Jas 4:4: You adulterers and adulteresses: know you not that the friendship of the world is enmity with God? whoever therefore will be a friend of the world is the enemy of God.

"for"
1Sa 5:2: 3: When the Philistines took the ark of God: they brought it into the house of Dagon: and set it by Dagon.
1Ki 18:21: Elijah came to all the people: and said: How long halt you between two opinions? if the LORD be God: follow Him: but if Baal: then follow Him. And the people answered Him not">not Him a word.
2Ch 19:2: Jehu the son of Hanani the seer went out to meet Him: and said to king Jehoshaphat: Should you help the ungodly: and love them that hate the LORD? therefore is wrath upon you from before the LORD.
Ps 16:3: But to the saints that are in the earth: and to the excellent: in whom is all my delight.
Ps 26:4: 5: 9: 10: I not have sat with vain persons: neither will I go in with dissemblers.
Ps 44:20: 21: If we have forgotten the name of our God: or stretched out our hands to a strange god;
Ps 101:3-5: I will set no wicked thing before my eyes: I hate the work of them that turn aside; it will not cleave to me.
Ps 119:63: I am a companion of all them that fear you: and of them that keep your precepts.
Ps 139:21: 22: not Do I hate them: O LORD: that hate you? and not am I grieved with those that rise up against you?
Pr 29:27: An unjust man is an abomination to the just: and he who is upright in the way is abomination to the wicked.
Joh 7:7: The world cannot hate you; but me it hates: because I testify of it: that the works thereof are evil.
Joh 15:18: 19: If the world hate you: you know that it hated me before it hated you.
Ac 4:23: Being let go: they went to their own company: and reported all that the chief priests and elders had said to them.
1Co 10:21: You cannot drink the cup of the Lord: and the cup of devils: you cannot be partakers of the Lord's table: and of the table of devils.
Eph 5:6-11: Let no man deceive you with vain words: for because of these things comes the wrath of God upon the children of disobedience.
1Jo 3:12-14: Not as Cain: who was of that wicked one: and killed his brother. And for what reason killed he him? Because his own works were evil: and his brother's righteous.

"and what"
Pr 8:18: 19: Riches and honour are with me; yes: durable riches and righteousness.
Ro 13:12-14: The night is far spent: the day is at hand: let us therefore cast off the works of darkness: and let us put on the armour of light.
Eph 4:17-20: This I say therefore: and testify in the Lord: that you henceforth not walk as other Gentiles walk: in the vanity of their mind:
Eph 5:8-14: For you were sometimes darkness: but now are you light in the Lord: walk as children of light:
Php 2:15: That you may be blameless and harmless: the sons of God: without rebuke: in the middle of a crooked and perverse nation: among whom you shine as lights in the world;
1Th 5:4-8: But you: brothers: not are in darkness: that that day should overtake you as a thief.
1Pe 2:9: 10: But you are a chosen generation: a royal priesthood: an holy nation: a peculiar people; that you should show forth the praises of him who has called you out of darkness into his marvellous light:
1Pe 4:2-4: That He no longer should live the rest of His time in the flesh to the lusts of men: but to the will of God.
1Jo 1:5-7: This then is the message which we have heard of Him: and declare to you: that God is light: and in Him is no darkness at all.

G3326μετὰmeta   (Prep)
G3326 μετά metá met-ah a primary preposition (often used adverbially); properly, denoting accompaniment; amid (local or causal); modified variously according to the case (genitive association, or accusative succession) with which it is joined; occupying an intermediate position between ἀπό or ἐκ and εἰς or πρός; less intimate than ἐν and less close than σύν):--after(-ward), X that he again, against, among, X and, + follow, hence, hereafter, in, of, (up-)on, + our, X and setting, since, (un-)to, + together, when, with (+ -out). 15 What concord has Christ with Belial? or what part has He that'>He who believes with an infidel?2 Corinthians 6:15
Stats
Rank: #7106 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)

Translation

Lit: What now harmony Christ with Belial? Or what part to a believer with an unbeliever?

KJV: And what concord hath Christ with Belial? or what part hath he that believeth with an infidel?
References

"what concord"

"or"

Mr 16:16: He who believes'>believes and is baptized will be saved; but he who believes'>believes not will be damned.
Ac 8:20: But Peter said to Him: Your money perish with you: because you have thought that the gift of God may be purchased with money.
1Jo 5:11-13: This is the record: that God has given to us eternal life: and this life is in His Son.

"an"
1Ti 5:8: But if any not provide for his own: and specially for those of his own house: he has denied the faith: and is worse than an infidel.

G3326μετὰmeta   (Prep)
G3326 μετά metá met-ah a primary preposition (often used adverbially); properly, denoting accompaniment; amid (local or causal); modified variously according to the case (genitive association, or accusative succession) with which it is joined; occupying an intermediate position between ἀπό or ἐκ and εἰς or πρός; less intimate than ἐν and less close than σύν):--after(-ward), X that he again, against, among, X and, + follow, hence, hereafter, in, of, (up-)on, + our, X and setting, since, (un-)to, + together, when, with (+ -out). Often used in composition, in substantially the same relations of participation or proximity, and transfer or sequence. 		μετὰmeta with Prep

16 What agreement has the temple of God with idols? for you are the temple of the living God; as God has said, I will dwell in them, and walk in them; and I will be their God, and they will be my people.2 Corinthians 6:16
Stats
Counts: 206 characters, 38 words, 156 letters, 55 vowels, 101 consonants
Translation
Greek: τις δε συγκαταθεσις ναω θεου μετα ειδωλων υμεις γαρ ναος θεου εστε ζωντος καθως ειπεν ο θεος οτι ενοικησω εν αυτοις και εμπεριπατησω και εσομαι αυτων θεος και αυτοι εσονται μοι λαος

Lit: What now agreement the temple of God with idols? We for the temple of God are, the living, as has said God - : I will dwell in them, and will walk among them; and I will be their God, and they will be to Me a people.”

KJV: And what agreement hath the temple of God with idols? for ye are the temple of the living God; as God hath said, I will dwell in them, and walk in them; and I will be their God, and they shall be my people.

De 4:23: 24: Take heed to yourselves: lest you forget the covenant of the LORD your God: which He made with you: and make you a graven image: or the likeness of any thing: which the LORD your God has forbidden you.
De 5:7: You will have none other gods before me.
De 6:14: 15: You will not go after other gods: of the gods of the people which are round about you;

2Ch 33:4: 5: Also He built altars in the house of the LORD: whereof the LORD had said: In Jerusalem will my name be for ever.
Eze 36:25: Then will I sprinkle clean water upon you: and you will be clean: from all your filthiness: and from all your idols: will I cleanse you.
Ho 14:8: Ephraim will say: What have I to do any more with idols? I have heard him: and observed him: I am like a green fir tree. From me is your fruit found.
Zep 1:5: Them that worship the host of heaven upon the housetops; and them that worship and that swear by the LORD: and that swear by Malcham;
Mt 6:24: No man can serve two masters: for either He will hate the one: and love the other; or else He will hold to the one: and despise the other. You cannot serve God and mammon.
1Jo 5:20: 21: We know that the Son of God is come: and has given us an understanding: that we may know Him that is true: and we are in Him that is true: even in His Son Jesus Christ. This is the true God: and eternal life.

Eph 2:20: Are built upon the foundation of the apostles and prophets: Jesus Christ Himself being the chief corner stone;
Heb 3:6: But Christ as a son over His own house; whose house are we: if we hold fast the confidence and the rejoicing of the hope firm to the end.
1Pe 2:5: You also: as lively stones: are built up a spiritual house: an holy priesthood: to offer up spiritual sacrifices: acceptable to God by Jesus Christ.

"I will dwell"

Le 26:12: I will walk among you: and will be your God: and you will be my people.
Ps 90:1: God.>> Lord: you have been our dwelling place in all generations.

Zec 2:10: 11: Sing and rejoice: O daughter of Zion: for: indeed: I come: and I will dwell in the middle of you: says the LORD.
Joh 6:56: He who eats my flesh: and drinks my blood: dwells in me: and I in him.
Ro 8:9: 11: But you not are in the flesh: but in the Spirit: if so be that the Spirit of God dwell in you. Now if any man not have the Spirit of Christ: He is none of His.
Eph 3:17: That Christ may dwell in your hearts by faith; that you: being rooted and grounded in love:
2Ti 1:14: That good thing which was committed to you keep by the Holy Ghost which dwells in us.
1Jo 4:12: 15: No man has seen God at any time. If we love one another: God dwells in us: and His love is perfected in us.
Re 21:3: I heard a great voice out of heaven saying: Look: the tabernacle of God is with men: and He will dwell with them: and they will be His people: and God Himself will be with them: and be their God.

Re 21:7: He who overcomes will inherit all things; and I will be His God: and He will be my son.

17 For what reason come out from among them, and be you separate, says the Lord, and not touch the unclean thing; and I will receive you,2 Corinthians 6:17
Stats
Rank: #2812 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 128 characters, 20 words, 100 letters, 41 vowels, 59 consonants
Translation
Greek: διο εξελθετε εκ μεσου αυτων και αφορισθητε λεγει κυριος και ακαθαρτου μη απτεσθε καγω εισδεξομαι υμας

Lit: Therefore come out from the midst of them and be separate, says the Lord, and unclean nothing touch, and I will receive you.”

KJV: Wherefore come out from among them, and be ye separate, saith the Lord, and touch not the unclean thing; and I will receive you,
References

"come"
2Co 7:1: Having therefore these promises: dearly beloved: let us cleanse ourselves from all filthiness of the flesh and spirit: perfecting holiness in the fear of God.
Nu 16:21: 26: 45: Separate yourselves from among this congregation: that I may consume them in a moment.
Ezr 6:21: The children of Israel: which were come again out of captivity: and all such as had separated themselves to them from the filthiness of the heathen of the land: to seek the LORD God of Israel: did eat:
Ezr 10:11: Now therefore make confession to the LORD God of your fathers: and do His pleasure: and separate yourselves from the people of the land: and from the strange wives.
Ps 1:1-3: Blessed is the man that walks not in the counsel of the ungodly: nor stands in the way of sinners: nor sits in the seat of the scornful.
Pr 9:6: Forsake the foolish: and live; and go in the way of understanding.
Isa 52:11: Depart you: depart you: go you out from there: touch no unclean thing; go you out of the middle of her; be you clean: that bear the vessels of the LORD.
Jer 51:6: Flee out of the middle of Babylon: and deliver every man His soul: not be cut off in her iniquity; for this is the time of the LORD's vengeance; He will render to her a recompence.
Ac 2:40: With many other words did he testify and exhort: saying: Save yourselves from this untoward generation.
Re 18:4: I heard another voice from heaven: saying: Come out of her: my people: that you not be partakers of her sins: and that you not receive of her plagues.

"and I"
Joh 6:37: 38: All that the Father gives me will come to me; and Him that comes to me I will in no wise cast out.
Ro 15:7: For what reason receive you one another: as Christ also received us to the glory of God.

G2532Καὶkai   (Conj)
G2532 καί kaí kahee apparently, a primary particle, having a copulative and sometimes also a cumulative force; and, also, even, so then, too, etc.; often used in connection (or composition) with other particles or small words:--and, also, both, but, even, for, if, or, so, that, then, therefore, when, yet. G1510Ἔσομαιesomai   (V-FIM-1S)
G1510 εἰμί eimí i-mee the first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist (used only when emphatic):--am, have been, X it is I, was. See also εἶ, εἴην, εἶναι, εἰσί, ἦν, ἔσομαι, ἐσμέν, ἐστέ, ἐστί, κέρδος, ἴσθι, ὦ. 		Ἔσομαιesomai I will be V-FIM-1S

G4771 σύ sý soo the personal pronoun of the second person singular; thou:-- thou. See also σέ, σοί, σοῦ; and for the plural ὑμᾶς, ὑμεῖς, ὑμῖν, ὑμῶν., 		ὑμῖνhymin to you PPro-D2P
G1519εἰςeis   (Prep)
G1519 εἰς eis ice a primary preposition; to or into (indicating the point reached or entered), of place, time, or (figuratively) purpose (result, etc.); also in adverbial phrases:--(abundant-)ly, against, among, as, at, (back-)ward, before, by, concerning, + continual, + far more exceeding, for (intent, purpose), fore, + forth, in (among, at, unto, -so much that, -to), to the intent that, + of one mind, + never, of, (up-)on, + perish, + set at one again, (so) that, therefore(-unto), throughout, til, to (be, the end, -ward), (here-)until(-to), …ward, (where-)fore, with. Often used in composition with the same general import, but only with verbs (etc.) expressing motion (literally or figuratively). 		εἰςeis for Prep

G3004λέγειlegei   (V-PIA-3S)
G3004 λέγω légō leg-o a primary verb; properly, to lay forth, i.e. (figuratively) relate (in words (usually of systematic or set discourse; whereas ἔπω and φημί generally refer to an individual expression or speech respectively; while ῥέω is properly to break silence merely, and λαλέω means an extended or random harangue)); by implication, to mean:--ask, bid, boast, call, describe, give out, name, put forth, say(-ing, on), shew, speak, tell, utter. 		λέγειlegei says V-PIA-3S

18 Will be a Father to you, and you will be my sons and daughters, says the Lord Almighty.2 Corinthians 6:18
Stats
Counts: 94 characters, 17 words, 73 letters, 25 vowels, 48 consonants
Translation
Greek: και εσομαι υμιν εις πατερα και υμεις εσεσθε μοι εις υιους και θυγατερας λεγει κυριος παντοκρατωρ

Lit: and I will be to you for a Father, and you will be to Me for sons and daughters, says the Lord Almighty.

KJV: And will be a Father unto you, and ye shall be my sons and daughters, saith the Lord Almighty.
References

"a Father"

Jer 31:1: 9: At the same time: says the LORD: will I be the God of all the families of Israel: and they will be my people.
Ho 1:9: 10: Then said God: Call His name Loammi: for you are not my people: and I not will be your God.

Ro 8:14-17: 29: For as many as are led by the Spirit of God: they are the sons of God.

"the Lord"

1 Having therefore these promises, dearly beloved, let us cleanse ourselves from all filthiness of the flesh and spirit, perfecting holiness in the fear of God.2 Corinthians 7:1
Stats
Rank: #1585 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 158 characters, 22 words, 130 letters, 48 vowels, 82 consonants
Translation
Greek: ταυτας ουν εχοντες τας επαγγελιας αγαπητοι καθαρισωμεν εαυτους απο παντος μολυσμου σαρκος και πνευματος επιτελουντες αγιωσυνην εν φοβω θεου

Lit: These therefore having promises, beloved, we should cleanse ourselves from every defilement of flesh and spirit, perfecting holiness in the fear of God.

KJV: Having therefore these promises, dearly beloved, let us cleanse ourselves from all filthiness of the flesh and spirit, perfecting holiness in the fear of God.
References

"therefore"
2Co 1:20: For all the promises of God in Him are yes: and in Him Amen: to the glory of God by us.
2Co 6:17: 18: For what reason come out from among them: and be you separate: says the Lord: and not touch the unclean thing; and I will receive you:
Ro 5:20: 21: Moreover the law entered: that the offence might abound. But where sin abounded: grace did much more abound:
Ro 6:1-11: What will we say then? Will we continue in sin: that grace may abound?
Heb 4:1: Let us therefore fear: lest: a promise being left us of entering into his rest: any of you should seem to come short of it.
2Pe 1:4-8: Whereby are given to us exceeding great and precious promises: that by these you might be partakers of the divine nature: having escaped the corruption that is in the world through lust.

"let"
Ps 51:10: Create in me a clean heart: O God; and renew a right spirit within me.
Ps 119:9: BETH. With what will a young man cleanse his way? by taking heed thereto according to your word.
Pr 20:9: Who can say: I have made my heart clean: I am pure from my sin?
Pr 30:12: There is a generation that are pure in their own eyes: and yet not is washed from their filthiness.
Isa 1:16: Wash you: make you clean; put away the evil of your doings from before my eyes; cease to do evil;
Jer 13:27: I have seen your adulteries: and your neighings: the lewdness of your whoredom: and your abominations on the hills in the fields. Woe to you: O Jerusalem! will you not be made clean? when will it once be?
Eze 18:30-32: Therefore I will judge you: O house of Israel: every one according to His ways: says the Lord GOD. Repent: and turn yourselves from all your transgressions; so iniquity will not be your ruin.
Eze 36:25: 26: Then will I sprinkle clean water upon you: and you will be clean: from all your filthiness: and from all your idols: will I cleanse you.
Mt 5:8: Blessed are the pure in heart: for they will see God.
Mt 12:33: Either make the tree good: and his fruit good; or else make the tree corrupt: and his fruit corrupt: for the tree is known by his fruit.
Mt 23:25: 26: Woe to you: scribes and Pharisees: hypocrites! for you make clean the outside of the cup and of the platter: but within they are full of extortion and excess.
Lu 11:39: 40: The Lord said to Him: Now do you Pharisees make clean the outside of the cup and the platter; but your inward part is full of ravening and wickedness.
Tit 2:11-14: For the grace of God that brings salvation has appeared to all men:
Jas 4:8: Draw nigh to God: and He will draw nigh to you. Cleanse your hands: you sinners; and purify your hearts: you double minded.
1Pe 1:22: Seeing you have purified your souls in obeying the truth through the Spirit to unfeigned love of the brothers: see that you love one another with a pure heart fervently:
1Pe 2:11: Dearly beloved: I beseech you as strangers and pilgrims: abstain from fleshly lusts: which war against the soul;
1Jo 1:7: 9: But if we walk in the light: as He is in the light: we have fellowship one with another: and the blood of Jesus Christ His Son cleanses us from all sin.
1Jo 3:3: Every man that has this hope in him purifies himself: even as he is pure.

"filthiness"
Isa 55:7: Let the wicked forsake His way: and the unrighteous man His thoughts: and let Him return to the LORD: and He will have mercy upon Him; and to our God: for He will abundantly pardon.
Jer 4:14: O Jerusalem: wash your heart from wickedness: that you may be saved. How long will your vain thoughts lodge within you?
1Co 6:20: For you are bought with a price: therefore glorify God in your body: and in your spirit: which are God's.
Eph 2:3: Among whom also we all had our conversation in times past in the lusts of our flesh: fulfilling the desires of the flesh and of the mind; and were by nature the children of wrath: even as others.
1Th 5:23: The very God of peace sanctify you wholly; and I pray God your whole spirit and soul and body be preserved blameless to the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.

"perfecting"
Mt 5:48: Be you therefore perfect: even as your Father which is in heaven is perfect.
Eph 4:12: 13: For the perfecting of the saints: for the work of the ministry: for the edifying of the body of Christ:
Php 3:12-15: Not as though I had already attained: either were already perfect: but I follow after: if that I may apprehend that for which also I am apprehended of Christ Jesus.
1Th 3:13: To the end He may stablish your hearts unblameable in holiness before God: even our Father: at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ with all His saints.
1Th 4:7: For God has not called us to uncleanness: but to holiness.
Heb 12:23: To the general assembly and church of the firstborn: which are written in heaven: and to God the Judge of all: and to the spirits of just men made perfect:
1Pe 5:10: But the God of all grace: who has called us to His eternal glory by Christ Jesus: after that you have suffered a while: make you perfect: stablish: strengthen: settle you.

"in"
2Ch 19:9: He charged them: saying: Thus will you do in the fear of the LORD: faithfully: and with a perfect heart.
Ps 19:9: The fear of the LORD is clean: enduring for ever: the judgments of the LORD are true and righteous altogether.
Pr 8:13: The fear of the LORD is to hate evil: pride: and arrogancy: and the evil way: and the froward mouth: do I hate.
Pr 16:6: By mercy and truth iniquity is purged: and by the fear of the LORD men depart from evil.
Ac 9:31: Then had the churches rest throughout all Judaea and Galilee and Samaria: and were edified; and walking in the fear of the Lord: and in the comfort of the Holy Ghost: were multiplied.
Heb 12:28: For what reason we receiving a kingdom which cannot be moved: let us have grace: whereby we may serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear:

G3762οὐδέναoudena   (Adj-AMS)
G3762 οὐδείς oudeís oo-den from οὐδέ and εἷς; not even one (man, woman or thing), i.e. none, nobody, nothing:--any (man), aught, man, neither any (thing), never (man), no (man), none (+ of these things), not (any, at all, -thing), nought., 		οὐδέναoudena no one Adj-AMS
G5351ἐφθείραμεν,ephtheiramen   (V-AIA-1P)
G5351 φθείρω phtheírō fthi-ro probably strengthened from (to pine or waste); properly, to shrivel or wither, i.e. to spoil (by any process) or (generally) to ruin (especially figuratively, by moral influences, to deprave):--corrupt (self), defile, destroy. 		ἐφθείραμεν,ephtheiramen we have corrupted, V-AIA-1P

G4122ἐπλεονεκτήσαμεν.epleonektēsamen   (V-AIA-1P)
G4122 πλεονεκτέω pleonektéō pleh-on-cek-teh-o from πλεονέκτης; to be covetous, i.e. (by implication) to over-reach:--get an advantage, defraud, make a gain. 		ἐπλεονεκτήσαμεν.epleonektēsamen we have exploited. V-AIA-1P
2 Receive us; we have wronged no man, we have corrupted no man, we have defrauded no man.2 Corinthians 7:2
Stats
Rank: #8469 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 87 characters, 14 words, 67 letters, 29 vowels, 38 consonants
Translation
Greek: χωρησατε ημας ουδενα ηδικησαμεν ουδενα εφθειραμεν ουδενα επλεονεκτησαμεν

Lit: Make room for us; no one we have wronged, no one we have corrupted, no one we have exploited.

KJV: Receive us; we have wronged no man, we have corrupted no man, we have defrauded no man.
References

"Receive"
2Co 11:16: I say again: Let no man think me a fool; if otherwise: yet as a fool receive me: that I may boast myself a little.
Mt 10:14: 40: whoever will not receive you: nor hear your words: when you depart out of that house or city: shake off the dust of your feet.
Lu 10:8: Into whatever city you enter: and they receive you: eat such things as are set before you:
Php 2:29: Receive Him therefore in the Lord with all gladness; and hold such in reputation:
Col 4:10: Aristarchus my fellowprisoner salutes you: and Marcus: sister's son to Barnabas: (touching whom you received commandments: if he come to you: receive him;)
Phm 1:12: 17: Whom I have sent again: you therefore receive him: that is: my own bowels:
2Jo 1:10: If there come any to you: and not bring this doctrine: receive Him not">not Him into your house: neither bid Him God speed:
3Jo 1:8-10: We therefore ought to receive such: that we might be fellowhelpers to the truth.

"we have wronged"
2Co 1:12: For our rejoicing is this: the testimony of our conscience: that in simplicity and godly sincerity: not with fleshly wisdom: but by the grace of God: we have had our conversation in the world: and more abundantly to you-ward.
2Co 4:2: But have renounced the hidden things of dishonesty: not walking in craftiness: nor handling the word of God deceitfully; but by manifestation of the truth commending ourselves to every man's conscience in the sight of God.
2Co 6:3-7: Giving no offence in any thing: that the ministry not be blamed:
2Co 11:9: When I was present with you: and wanted: I was chargeable to no man: for that which was lacking to me the brothers which came from Macedonia supplied: and in all things I have kept myself from being burdensome to you: and so will I keep myself.
2Co 12:14-18: Look: the third time I am ready to come to you; and I not will be burdensome to you: for I not seek yours: but you: for the children not ought to lay up for the parents: but the parents for the children.
Nu 16:15: Moses was very angry: and said to the LORD: not Respect you their offering: I not have taken one ass from them: neither have I hurt one of them.
1Sa 12:3: 4: Look: here I am: witness against me before the LORD: and before His anointed: whose ox have I taken? or whose ass have I taken? or whom have I defrauded? whom have I oppressed? or of whose hand have I received any bribe to blind my eyes therewith? and I will restore it you.
Ac 20:33: I have coveted no man's silver: or gold: or apparel.
Ro 16:18: For they that are such not serve our Lord Jesus Christ: but their own belly; and by good words and fair speeches deceive the hearts of the simple.
1Th 2:3-6: 10: For our exhortation was not of deceit: nor of uncleanness: nor in guile:
2Th 3:7-9: For yourselves know how you ought to follow us: for we not behaved ourselves disorderly among you;

G4314πρὸςpros   (Prep)
G4314 πρός prós pros a strengthened form of πρό; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. toward (with the genitive case, the side of, i.e. pertaining to; with the dative case, by the side of, i.e. near to; usually with the accusative case, the place, time, occasion, or respect, which is the destination of the relation, i.e. whither or for which it is predicated):--about, according to , against, among, at, because of, before, between, (where-)by, for, X at thy house, in, for intent, nigh unto, of, which pertain to, that, to (the end that), X together, to (you) -ward, unto, with(-in). In the comparative case, it denotes essentially the same applications, namely, motion towards, accession to, or nearness at. 		πρὸςpros For Prep

3 I not speak this to condemn you: for I have said before, that you are in our hearts to die and live with you.2 Corinthians 7:3
Stats
Counts: 112 characters, 20 words, 82 letters, 37 vowels, 45 consonants
Translation
Greek: ου προς κατακρισιν λεγω προειρηκα γαρ οτι εν ταις καρδιαις ημων εστε εις το συναποθανειν και συζην

Lit: For condemnation not I speak; I have before said for that in the hearts of us you are, for us to die together, and to live together.

KJV: I speak not this to condemn [you]: for I have said before, that ye are in our hearts to die and live with [you].
References

"to condemn"
2Co 7:12: For what reason: though I wrote to you: I did it not for His cause that had done the wrong: nor for His cause that suffered wrong: but that our care for you in the sight of God might appear to you.
2Co 2:4: 5: For out of much affliction and anguish of heart I wrote to you with many tears; not that you should be grieved: but that you might know the love which I have more abundantly to you.
2Co 13:10: Therefore I write these things being absent: lest being present I should use sharpness: according to the power which the Lord has given me to edification: not and to destruction.
1Co 4:14: 15: I not write these things to shame you: but as my beloved sons I warn you.

"for"
2Co 6:11: 12: O you Corinthians: our mouth is open to you: our heart is enlarged.

"ye"
2Co 3:2: You are our epistle written in our hearts: known and read of all men:
2Co 11:11: For what reason? because I love you not? God knows.
2Co 12:15: I will very gladly spend and be spent for you; though the more abundantly I love you: the less I be loved.
Php 1:8: 9: For God is my record: how greatly I long after you all in the bowels of Jesus Christ.

"to die"
Ru 1:16: 17: Ruth said: Intreat not me to leave you: or to return from following after you: for whither you go: I will go; and where you lodge: I will lodge: your people will be my people: and your God my God:
1Th 2:8: So being affectionately desirous of you: we were willing to have imparted to you: not the gospel of God only: but also our own souls: because you were dear to us.

4 Great is my boldness of speech toward you, great is my glorying of you: I am filled with comfort, I am exceeding joyful in all our tribulation.2 Corinthians 7:4
Stats
Rank: #9553 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 145 characters, 22 words, 113 letters, 44 vowels, 69 consonants
Translation
Greek: πολλη μοι παρρησια προς υμας πολλη μοι καυχησις υπερ υμων πεπληρωμαι τη παρακλησει υπερπερισσευομαι τη χαρα επι παση τη θλιψει ημων

Lit: Great is my boldness toward you; great my boasting on behalf of you; I have been filled with encouragement; I overabound with joy upon all the affliction of us.

KJV: Great is my boldness of speech toward you, great [is] my glorying of you: I am filled with comfort, I am exceeding joyful in all our tribulation.
References

"my boldness"
2Co 3:12: Seeing then that we have such hope: we use great plainness of speech:
2Co 6:11: O you Corinthians: our mouth is open to you: our heart is enlarged.
2Co 10:1: 2: Now I Paul myself beseech you by the meekness and gentleness of Christ: who in presence am base among you: but being absent am bold toward you:
2Co 11:21: I speak as concerning reproach: as though we had been weak. Howbeit whereinsoever any is bold: (I speak foolishly: ) I am bold also.
Eph 6:19: 20: For me: that utterance may be given to me: that I may open my mouth boldly: to make known the mystery of the gospel:
Php 1:20: According to my ear expectation and my hope: that not inhing I will be ashamed: but that with all boldness: as always: so now also Christ will be magnified in my body: whether it be by life: or by death.
1Th 2:2: But even after that we had suffered before: and were shamefully entreated: as you know: at Philippi: we were bold in our God to speak to you the gospel of God with much contention.

"great"
2Co 1:14: As also you have acknowledged us in part: that we are your rejoicing: even as you also are ours in the day of the Lord Jesus.
2Co 9:2-4: For I know the forwardness of your mind: for which I boast of you to them of Macedonia: that Achaia was ready a year ago; and your zeal has provoked very many.
1Co 1:4: I thank my God always on your behalf: for the grace of God which is given you by Jesus Christ;
1Th 2:19: For what is our hope: or joy: or crown of rejoicing? Are not even you in the presence of our Lord Jesus Christ at His coming?

"I am filled"
2Co 7:6: 7: Nevertheless God: that comforts those that are cast down: comforted us by the coming of Titus;
2Co 1:4: Who comforts us in all our tribulation: that we may be able to comfort them which are in any trouble: by the comfort wherewith we ourselves are comforted of God.
2Co 2:14: Now thanks be to God: which always causes us to triumph in Christ: and makes manifest the savour of His knowledge by us in every place.
2Co 6:10: As sorrowful: yet alway rejoicing; as poor: yet making many rich; as not havinghing: and yet possessing all things.
Ac 5:41: They departed from the presence of the council: rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer shame for his name.
Ro 5:3: not And only so: but we glory in tribulations also: knowing that tribulation works patience;
Php 2:17: Yes: and if I be offered upon the sacrifice and service of your faith: I joy: and rejoice with you all.
Col 1:24: Who now rejoice in my sufferings for you: and fill up that which is behind of the afflictions of Christ in my flesh for His body's sake: which is the church:
1Th 3:7-9: Therefore: brothers: we were comforted over you in all our affliction and distress by your faith:
Jas 1:2: My brothers: count it all joy when you fall into divers temptations;

 και γαρ ελθοντων ημων εις μακεδονιαν ουδεμιαν εσχηκεν ανεσιν η σαρξ ημων αλλ εν παντι θλιβομενοι εξωθεν μαχαι εσωθεν φοβοι
StrongsGreekEnglishMorphology
G2532ΚαὶKai   (Conj)
G2532 καί kaí kahee apparently, a primary particle, having a copulative and sometimes also a cumulative force; and, also, even, so then, too, etc.; often used in connection (or composition) with other particles or small words:--and, also, both, but, even, for, if, or, so, that, then, therefore, when, yet. 		ΚαὶKai And Conj
G1063γὰρgar   (Conj)
G1063 γάρ gár gar a primary particle; properly, assigning a reason (used in argument, explanation or intensification; often with other particles):--and, as, because (that), but, even, for, indeed, no doubt, seeing, then, therefore, verily, what, why, yet. 		γὰρgar for Conj
G2064ἐλθόντωνelthontōn   (V-APA-GMP)
G2064 ἔρχομαι érchomai el-tho middle voice of a primary verb (used only in the present and imperfect tenses, the others being supplied by a kindred (middle voice) , or (active) , which do not otherwise occur); to come or go (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively):--accompany, appear, bring, come, enter, fall out, go, grow, X light, X next, pass, resort, be set. 		ἐλθόντωνelthontōn having come V-APA-GMP

G1473 ἐγώ egṓ eg-o a primary pronoun of the first person I (only expressed when emphatic):--I, me. For the other cases and the plural see ἐμέ, ἐμοί, ἐμοῦ, ἡμᾶς, ἡμεῖς, ἡμῖν, ἡμῶν, etc., 		ἡμῶνhēmōn of us PPro-G1P
G1519εἰςeis   (Prep)
G1519 εἰς eis ice a primary preposition; to or into (indicating the point reached or entered), of place, time, or (figuratively) purpose (result, etc.); also in adverbial phrases:--(abundant-)ly, against, among, as, at, (back-)ward, before, by, concerning, + continual, + far more exceeding, for (intent, purpose), fore, + forth, in (among, at, unto, -so much that, -to), to the intent that, + of one mind, + never, of, (up-)on, + perish, + set at one again, (so) that, therefore(-unto), throughout, til, to (be, the end, -ward), (here-)until(-to), …ward, (where-)fore, with. Often used in composition with the same general import, but only with verbs (etc.) expressing motion (literally or figuratively). 		εἰςeis into Prep

G2192 ἔχω échō skheh-o a primary verb; to hold (used in very various applications, literally or figuratively, direct or remote; such as possession; ability, contiuity, relation, or condition):--be (able, X hold, possessed with), accompany, + begin to amend, can(+ -not), X conceive, count, diseased, do + eat, + enjoy, + fear, following, have, hold, keep, + lack, + go to law, lie, + must needs, + of necessity, + need, next, + recover, + reign, + rest, + return, X sick, take for, + tremble, + uncircumcised, use. 		ἔσχηκενeschēken had V-RIA-3S

G3588ἡhē   (Art-NFS)
G3588 ὁ ho to the definite article; the (sometimes to be supplied, at others omitted, in English idiom):--the, this, that, one, he, she, it, etc., 		ἡhē the Art-NFS
G4561σὰρξsarx   (N-NFS)
G4561 σάρξ sárx sarx probably from the base of σαρόω; flesh (as stripped of the skin), i.e. (strictly) the meat of an animal (as food), or (by extension) the body (as opposed to the soul (or spirit), or as the symbol of what is external, or as the means of kindred), or (by implication) human nature (with its frailties (physically or morally) and passions), or (specially), a human being (as such):--carnal(-ly, + -ly minded), flesh(-ly). 		σὰρξsarx flesh N-NFS

G3956παντὶpanti   (Adj-DNS)

G5401φόβοι.phoboi   (N-NMP)
G5401 φόβος phóbos fob-os from a primary (to be put in fear); alarm or fright:--be afraid, + exceedingly, fear, terror. 		φόβοι.phoboi fears. N-NMP
5 For, when we were come into Macedonia, our flesh had no rest, but we were troubled on every side; without were fightings, within were fears.2 Corinthians 7:5
Stats
Rank: #9416 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 142 characters, 18 words, 110 letters, 45 vowels, 65 consonants
Translation
Greek: και γαρ ελθοντων ημων εις μακεδονιαν ουδεμιαν εσχηκεν ανεσιν η σαρξ ημων αλλ εν παντι θλιβομενοι εξωθεν μαχαι εσωθεν φοβοι

Lit: And for having come of us into Macedonia, no had rest the flesh of us; but in every way we are being pressed: on the outside conflicts, within fears.

KJV: For, when we were come into Macedonia, our flesh had no rest, but we were troubled on every side; without were fightings, within [were] fears.
References

"when"
2Co 1:16: 17: To pass by you into Macedonia: and to come again out of Macedonia to you: and of you to be brought on my way toward Judaea.
2Co 2:13: I had no rest in my spirit: because I not found Titus my brother: but taking my leave of them: I went from there into Macedonia.
Ac 20:1: After the uproar was ceased: Paul called to him the disciples: and embraced them: and departed for to go into Macedonia.
1Co 16:5: Now I will come to you: when I will pass through Macedonia: for I do pass through Macedonia.

"our"
2Co 4:8-12: We are troubled on every side: not yet distressed; we are perplexed: not but in despair;
2Co 11:23-30: Are they ministers of Christ? (I speak as a fool) I am more; in labours more abundant: in stripes above measure: in prisons more frequent: in deaths often.
Ge 8:9: But the dove found no rest for the sole of her foot: and she returned to him into the ark: for the waters were on the face of the whole earth: then he put forth his hand: and took her: and pulled her in to him into the ark.
Isa 33:12: The people will be as the burnings of lime: as thorns cut up will they be burned in the fire.
Jer 8:18: When I would comfort myself against sorrow: my heart is faint in me.
Jer 45:3: You did say: Woe is me now! for the LORD has added grief to my sorrow; I fainted in my sighing: and I find no rest.
Mt 11:28-30: Come to me: all you that labour and are heavy laden: and I will give you rest.

"troubled"
2Co 4:8: We are troubled on every side: not yet distressed; we are perplexed: not but in despair;
Job 18:11: Terrors will make him afraid on every side: and will drive him to his feet.
Jer 6:25: not Go forth into the field: nor walk by the way; for the sword of the enemy and fear is on every side.
Jer 20:10: For I heard the defaming of many: fear on every side. Report: say they: and we will report it. All my familiars watched for my halting: saying: Perhaps he will be enticed: and we will prevail against him: and we will take our revenge on him.

"without"
De 32:25: The sword without: and terror within: will destroy both the young man and the virgin: the suckling also with the man of gray hairs.
1Co 15:31: I protest by your rejoicing which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord: I die daily.

"fears"
2Co 2:3: 9: I wrote this same to you: lest: when I came: I should have sorrow from them of whom I ought to rejoice; having confidence in you all: that my joy is the joy of you all.
2Co 11:29: Who is weak: and I not am weak? who is offended: and I not burn?
2Co 12:20: 21: For I fear: lest'>lest: when I come: I will not find you such as I would: and that I will be found to you such as you not would: lest'>lest there be debates: envyings: wraths: strifes: backbitings: whisperings: swellings: tumults:
Ga 4:11: 19: 20: I am afraid of you: lest I have bestowed upon you labour in vain.
1Th 3:5: For this cause: when I could no longer forbear: I sent to know your faith: lest by some means the tempter have tempted you: and our labour be in vain.

6 Nevertheless God, that comforts those that are cast down, comforted us by the coming of Titus;2 Corinthians 7:6
Stats
Counts: 96 characters, 14 words, 78 letters, 26 vowels, 52 consonants
Translation
Greek: αλλ ο παρακαλων τους ταπεινους παρεκαλεσεν ημας ο θεος εν τη παρουσια τιτου

Lit: But the One comforting the downcast comforted us, God, by the coming of Titus,

KJV: Nevertheless God, that comforteth those that are cast down, comforted us by the coming of Titus;
References

"that comforteth"
2Co 1:3: 4: Blessed be God: even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ: the Father of mercies: and the God of all comfort;
2Co 2:14: Now thanks be to God: which always causes us to triumph in Christ: and makes manifest the savour of His knowledge by us in every place.
Isa 12:1: In that day you will say: O LORD: I will praise you: though you were angry with me: your anger is turned away: and you comfortedst me.
Isa 51:12: I: even I: am he who comforts you: who are you: that you should be afraid of a man that will die: and of the son of man which will be made as grass;
Isa 57:15: 18: For thus says the high and lofty one that inhabits eternity: whose name is Holy; I dwell in the high and holy place: with Him also that is of a contrite and humble spirit: to revive the spirit of the humble: and to revive the heart of the contrite ones.
Isa 61:1: 2: The Spirit of the Lord GOD is upon me; because the LORD has anointed me to preach good tidings to the meek; He has sent me to bind up the brokenhearted: to proclaim liberty to the captives: and the opening of the prison to them that are bound;
Jer 31:13: Then will the virgin rejoice in the dance: both young men and old together: for I will turn their mourning into joy: and will comfort them: and make them rejoice from their sorrow.
Mt 5:4: Blessed are they that mourn: for they will be comforted.
Joh 14:16: I will pray the Father: and He will give you another Comforter: that He may abide with you for ever;
Ro 15:5: Now the God of patience and consolation grant you to be likeminded one toward another according to Christ Jesus:
Php 2:1: If there be therefore any consolation in Christ: if any comfort of love: if any fellowship of the Spirit: if any bowels and mercies:
2Th 2:16: 17: Now our Lord Jesus Christ Himself: and God: even our Father: which has loved us: and has given us everlasting consolation and good hope through grace:

"comforted"
2Co 2:13: I had no rest in my spirit: because I not found Titus my brother: but taking my leave of them: I went from there into Macedonia.
1Co 16:17: 18: I am glad of the coming of Stephanas and Fortunatus and Achaicus: for that which was lacking on your part they have supplied.
1Th 3:2: 6: 7: Sent Timotheus: our brother: and minister of God: and our fellowlabourer in the gospel of Christ: to establish you: and to comfort you concerning your faith:
3Jo 1:2-4: Beloved: I wish above all things that you may prosper and be in health: even as your soul prospereth.

G1909ἐφ’eph’   (Prep)
G1909 ἐπί epí ep-ee a primary preposition; properly, meaning superimposition (of time, place, order, etc.), as a relation of distribution (with the genitive case), i.e. over, upon, etc.; of rest (with the dative case) at, on, etc.; of direction (with the accusative case) towards, upon, etc.:--about (the times), above, after, against, among, as long as (touching), at, beside, X have charge of, (be-, (where-))fore, in (a place, as much as, the time of, -to), (because) of, (up-)on (behalf of), over, (by, for) the space of, through(-out), (un-)to(-ward), with. In compounds it retains essentially the same import, at, upon, etc. (literally or figuratively). 		ἐφ’eph’ as to Prep

G2205 ζῆλος zēlos dzay-los from ζέω; properly, heat, i.e. (figuratively) zeal (in a favorable sense, ardor; in an unfavorable one, jealousy, as of a husband (figuratively, of God), or an enemy, malice):--emulation, envy(-ing), fervent mind, indignation, jealousy, zeal. 		ζῆλονzēlon zeal N-AMS

G5463 χαίρω chaírō khah-ee-ro a primary verb; to be cheerful, i.e. calmly happy or well-off; impersonally, especially as salutation (on meeting or parting), be well:--farewell, be glad, God speed, greeting, hall, joy(- fully), rejoice. 		χαρῆναι.charēnai to rejoice. V-ANP
7 not And by his coming only, but by the consolation wherewith he was comforted in you, when he told us your ear desire, your mourning, your fervent mind toward me; so that I rejoiced the more.2 Corinthians 7:7
Stats
Counts: 195 characters, 31 words, 154 letters, 59 vowels, 95 consonants
Translation
Greek: ου μονον δε εν τη παρουσια αυτου αλλα και εν τη παρακλησει η παρεκληθη εφ υμιν αναγγελλων ημιν την υμων επιποθησιν τον υμων οδυρμον τον υμων ζηλον υπερ εμου ωστε με μαλλον χαρηναι

Lit: not only now by the coming of him, but also by the comfort with which he was comforted as to you; relating to us your earnest desire, your mourning, your zeal for me, so as for me the more to rejoice.

KJV: And not by his coming only, but by the consolation wherewith he was comforted in you, when he told us your earnest desire, your mourning, your fervent mind toward me; so that I rejoiced the more.
References

"but"
Ac 11:23: Who: when He came: and had seen the grace of God: was glad: and exhorted them all: that with purpose of heart they would cleave to the Lord.
Ro 1:12: That is: that I may be comforted together with you by the mutual faith both of you and me.
Col 2:5: For though I be absent in the flesh: yet am I with you in the spirit: joying and beholding your order: and the stedfastness of your faith in Christ.
1Th 3:8: For now we live: if you stand fast in the Lord.
2Jo 1:4: I rejoiced greatly that I found of your children walking in truth: as we have received a commandment from the Father.

"when"
2Co 7:11: For look this selfsame thing: that you sorrowed after a godly sort: what carefulness it wrought in you: yes: what clearing of yourselves: yes: what indignation: yes: what fear: yes: what vehement desire: yes: what zeal: yes: what revenge! In all things you have approved yourselves to be clear in this matter.
2Co 2:9: For to this end also did I write: that I might know the proof of you: whether you be obedient in all things.
Ps 141:5: Let the righteous smite me; it will be a kindness: and let him reprove me; it will be an excellent oil: which will not break my head: for yet my prayer also will be in their calamities.
Pr 9:8: 9: not Reprove a scorner: lest he hate you: rebuke a wise man: and he will love you.

"earnest"
2Co 5:2: For in this we groan: earnestly desiring to be clothed upon with our house which is from heaven:
2Co 8:16: But thanks be to God: which put the same ear care into the heart of Titus for you.
Lu 22:44: Being in an agony he prayed more earnestly: and his sweat was as it were great drops of blood falling down to the ground.
Php 1:20: According to my ear expectation and my hope: that not inhing I will be ashamed: but that with all boldness: as always: so now also Christ will be magnified in my body: whether it be by life: or by death.
Heb 2:1: Therefore we ought to give the more ear heed to the things which we have heard: lest at any time we should let them slip.
Jas 5:17: Elias was a man subject to like passions as we are: and he prayed earnestly that it not might rain: and it not rained on the earth by the space of 3 years and 6 months.
Jude 1:3: Beloved: when I gave all diligence to write to you of the common salvation: it was needful for me to write to you: and exhort you that you should earnestly contend for the faith which was once delivered to the saints.

"mourning"
2Co 7:10: For godly sorrow works'>works repentance to not salvation to be repented of: but the sorrow of the world works'>works death.
Jg 2:4: 5: It came to pass: when the angel of the LORD spoke these words to all the children of Israel: that the people lifted up their voice: and wept.
Ps 6:1-6: A Psalm of David.>> O LORD: rebuke not me in your anger: neither chasten me in your hot displeasure.
Ps 30:5: For his anger endureth but a moment; in his favour is life: weeping may endure for a night: but joy cometh in the morning.
Ps 31:9-11: Have mercy upon me: O LORD: for I am in trouble: my eye is consumed with grief: yes: my soul and my belly.
Ps 38:18: For I will declare my iniquity; I will be sorry for my sin.
Ps 51:1: A Psalm of David: when Nathan the prophet came to Him: after He had gone in to Bathsheba.>> Have mercy upon me: O God: according to your lovingkindness: according to the multitude of your tender mercies blot out my transgressions.
Ps 126:5: 6: They that sow in tears will reap in joy.
Jer 31:18-20: I have surely heard Ephraim bemoaning Himself thus; You have chastised me: and I was chastised: as a bullock unaccustomed to the yoke: turn you me: and I will be turned; for you are the LORD my God.
Mt 5:4: Blessed are they that mourn: for they will be comforted.
Mt 26:75: Peter remembered the word of Jesus: which said to Him: Before the cock crow: you will deny me thrice. And He went out: and wept bitterly.
Jas 4:9: 10: Be afflicted: and mourn: and weep: let your laughter be turned to mourning: and your joy to heaviness.

"fervent"
2Co 1:14: As also you have acknowledged us in part: that we are your rejoicing: even as you also are ours in the day of the Lord Jesus.
2Co 2:3: 4: I wrote this same to you: lest: when I came: I should have sorrow from them of whom I ought to rejoice; having confidence in you all: that my joy is the joy of you all.
1Th 3:6: But now when Timotheus came from you to us: and brought us good tidings of your faith and charity: and that you have good remembrance of us always: desiring greatly to see us: as we also to see you:

G4314πρὸςpros   (Prep)
G4314 πρός prós pros a strengthened form of πρό; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. toward (with the genitive case, the side of, i.e. pertaining to; with the dative case, by the side of, i.e. near to; usually with the accusative case, the place, time, occasion, or respect, which is the destination of the relation, i.e. whither or for which it is predicated):--about, according to , against, among, at, because of, before, between, (where-)by, for, X at thy house, in, for intent, nigh unto, of, which pertain to, that, to (the end that), X together, to (you) -ward, unto, with(-in). In the comparative case, it denotes essentially the same applications, namely, motion towards, accession to, or nearness at. 		πρὸςpros for Prep

8 For though I made you sorry with a letter, I not do repent, though I did repent: for I perceive that the same epistle has made you sorry, though it were but for a season.2 Corinthians 7:8
Stats
Rank: #1454 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 171 characters, 31 words, 132 letters, 54 vowels, 78 consonants
Translation
Greek: οτι ει και ελυπησα υμας εν τη επιστολη ου μεταμελομαι ει και μετεμελομην βλεπω γαρ οτι η επιστολη εκεινη ει και προς ωραν ελυπησεν υμας

Lit: For if also I have grieved you in the letter, not I do regret it. Though even I did regret it; I see indeed that the letter that, if even for an hour, grieved you.

KJV: For though I made you sorry with a letter, I do not repent, though I did repent: for I perceive that the same epistle hath made you sorry, though it were but for a season.
References

"though I made"
2Co 7:6: 11: Nevertheless God: that comforts those that are cast down: comforted us by the coming of Titus;
2Co 2:2-11: For if I make you sorry: who is he then that makes me glad: but the same which is made sorry by me?
La 3:32: But though he cause grief: yet will he have compassion according to the multitude of his mercies.
Mt 26:21: 22: As they did eat: he said: Truly I say to you: that one of you will betray me.
Lu 22:61: 62: The Lord turned: and looked upon Peter. And Peter remembered the word of the Lord: how He had said to Him: Before the cock crow: you will deny me thrice.
Joh 16:6: But because I have said these things to you: sorrow has filled your heart.
Joh 21:17: He says to Him the third time: Simon: son of Jonas: love'>love you me? Peter was grieved because He said to Him the third time: Love'>Love you me? And He said to Him: Lord: you know'>know all things; you know'>know that I love you. Jesus says to Him: Feed my sheep.
Heb 12:9-11: Furthermore we have had fathers of our flesh which corrected us: and we gave them reverence: will not we much rather be in subjection to the Father of spirits: and live?
Re 3:19: As many as I love: I rebuke and chasten: be zealous therefore: and repent.

"though I did"
Ex 5:22: 23: Moses returned to the LORD: and said: Lord: for what reason have you so evil entreated this people? why is it that you have sent me?
Jer 20:7-9: O LORD: you have deceived me: and I was deceived: you are stronger than I: and have prevailed: I am in derision daily: every one mocks me.

G2596κατὰkata   (Prep)
G2596 κατά katá kat-ah a primary particle; (prepositionally) down (in place or time), in varied relations (according to the case (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined):--about, according as (to), after, against, (when they were) X alone, among, and, X apart, (even, like) as (concerning, pertaining to touching), X aside, at, before, beyond, by, to the charge of, (charita-)bly, concerning, + covered, (dai-)ly, down, every, (+ far more) exceeding, X more excellent, for, from … to, godly, in(-asmuch, divers, every, -to, respect of), … by, after the manner of, + by any means, beyond (out of) measure, X mightily, more, X natural, of (up-)on (X part), out (of every), over against, (+ your) X own, + particularly, so, through(-oughout, -oughout every), thus, (un-)to(-gether, -ward), X uttermost, where(-by), with. In composition it retains many of these applications, and frequently denotes opposition, distribution, or intensity. 		κατὰkata according to Prep

G1537 ἐκ ek ex a primary preposition denoting origin (the point whence action or motion proceeds), from, out (of place, time, or cause; literal or figurative; direct or remote):--after, among, X are, at, betwixt(-yond), by (the means of), exceedingly, (+ abundantly above), for(- th), from (among, forth, up), + grudgingly, + heartily, X heavenly, X hereby, + very highly, in, …ly, (because, by reason) of, off (from), on, out among (from, of), over, since, X thenceforth, through, X unto, X vehemently, with(-out). G1473ἡμῶν.hēmōn   (PPro-G1P)
G1473 ἐγώ egṓ eg-o a primary pronoun of the first person I (only expressed when emphatic):--I, me. For the other cases and the plural see ἐμέ, ἐμοί, ἐμοῦ, ἡμᾶς, ἡμεῖς, ἡμῖν, ἡμῶν, etc., 		ἡμῶν.hēmōn us. PPro-G1P
9 Now I rejoice, not that you were made sorry, but that you sorrowed to repentance: for you were made sorry after a godly manner, that you might receive damage by us not inhing.2 Corinthians 7:9
Stats
Rank: #2959 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 171 characters, 29 words, 134 letters, 52 vowels, 82 consonants
Translation
Greek: νυν χαιρω ουχ οτι ελυπηθητε αλλ οτι ελυπηθητε εις μετανοιαν ελυπηθητε γαρ κατα θεον ινα εν μηδενι ζημιωθητε εξ ημων

Lit: Now I rejoice, not that you were grieved, but that you were grieved unto repentance; you were grieved for according to God, so that in nothing you might suffer loss through us.

KJV: Now I rejoice, not that ye were made sorry, but that ye sorrowed to repentance: for ye were made sorry after a godly manner, that ye might receive damage by us in nothing.
References

"I rejoice"
2Co 7:6: 7: 10: Nevertheless God: that comforts those that are cast down: comforted us by the coming of Titus;
Ec 7:3: Sorrow is better than laughter: for by the sadness of the face the heart is made better.
Jer 31:18-20: I have surely heard Ephraim bemoaning Himself thus; You have chastised me: and I was chastised: as a bullock unaccustomed to the yoke: turn you me: and I will be turned; for you are the LORD my God.
Zec 12:10: I will pour upon the house of David: and upon the inhabitants of Jerusalem: the spirit of grace and of supplications: and they will look upon me whom they have pierced: and they will mourn for him: as one mourns for his only son: and will be in bitterness for him: as one that is in bitterness for his firstborn.
Lu 15:7: 10: 17-24: 32: I say to you: that likewise joy will be in heaven over one sinner that repents: more than over 99 just persons: which need no repentance.
Ac 20:21: Testifying both to the Jews: and also to the Greeks: repentance toward God: and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ.

"after a godly manner"
2Co 7:10: 11: For godly sorrow works'>works repentance to not salvation to be repented of: but the sorrow of the world works'>works death.
2Co 1:12: For our rejoicing is this: the testimony of our conscience: that in simplicity and godly sincerity: not with fleshly wisdom: but by the grace of God: we have had our conversation in the world: and more abundantly to you-ward.

"that ye"
2Co 2:16: To the one we are the savour of death to death; and to the other the savour of life to life. And who is sufficient for these things?
2Co 10:8-10: For though I should boast somewhat more of our authority: which the Lord has given us for edification: not and for your destruction: I not should be ashamed:
2Co 13:8-10: For we can not dohing against the truth: but for the truth.
Isa 6:9-11: He said: Go: and tell this people: Hear you indeed: but not understand; and see you indeed: but not perceive.

G2596κατὰkata   (Prep)
G2596 κατά katá kat-ah a primary particle; (prepositionally) down (in place or time), in varied relations (according to the case (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined):--about, according as (to), after, against, (when they were) X alone, among, and, X apart, (even, like) as (concerning, pertaining to touching), X aside, at, before, beyond, by, to the charge of, (charita-)bly, concerning, + covered, (dai-)ly, down, every, (+ far more) exceeding, X more excellent, for, from … to, godly, in(-asmuch, divers, every, -to, respect of), … by, after the manner of, + by any means, beyond (out of) measure, X mightily, more, X natural, of (up-)on (X part), out (of every), over against, (+ your) X own, + particularly, so, through(-oughout, -oughout every), thus, (un-)to(-gether, -ward), X uttermost, where(-by), with. In composition it retains many of these applications, and frequently denotes opposition, distribution, or intensity. 		κατὰkata according to Prep

10 For godly sorrow works'>works repentance to not salvation to be repented of: but the sorrow of the world works'>works death.2 Corinthians 7:10
Stats
Rank: #2316 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 114 characters, 19 words, 93 letters, 33 vowels, 60 consonants
Translation
Greek: η γαρ κατα θεον λυπη μετανοιαν εις σωτηριαν αμεταμελητον κατεργαζεται η δε του κοσμου λυπη θανατον κατεργαζεται

Lit: The for, according to God grief, repentance to salvation without regret produces; and the of the world grief, death produces.

KJV: For godly sorrow worketh repentance to salvation not to be repented of: but the sorrow of the world worketh death.
References

"repentance"
2Co 12:21: And lest: when I come again: my God will humble me among you: and that I will bewail many which have sinned already: and not have repented of the uncleanness and fornication and lasciviousness which they have committed.
2Sa 12:13: David said to Nathan: I have sinned against the LORD. And Nathan said to David: The LORD also has put away your sin; you will not die.
1Ki 8:47-50: Yet if they will bethink themselves in the land whither they were carried captives: and repent: and make supplication to you in the land of them that carried them captives: saying: We have sinned: and have done perversely: we have committed wickedness;
Job 33:27: 28: He looks upon men: and if any say: I have sinned: and perverted that which was right: and it profited not me;
Jer 31:9: They will come with weeping: and with supplications will I lead them: I will cause them to walk by the rivers of waters in a straight way: wherein they will not stumble: for I am a father to Israel: and Ephraim is my firstborn.
Eze 7:16: But they that escape of them will escape: and will be on the mountains like doves of the valleys: all of them mourning: every one for his iniquity.
Eze 18:27-30: Again: when the wicked man turns away from his wickedness that he has committed: and does that which is lawful and right: he will save his soul alive.
Jon 3:8: 10: But let man and beast be covered with sackcloth: and cry mightily to God: yes: let them turn every one from His evil way: and from the violence that is in their hands.
Mt 21:28-32: But what think you? A certain man had two sons; and He came to the first: and said: Son: go work today in my vineyard.
Mt 26:75: Peter remembered the word of Jesus: which said to Him: Before the cock crow: you will deny me thrice. And He went out: and wept bitterly.
Lu 15:10: Likewise: I say to you: there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner that repenteth.
Lu 18:13: The publican: standing afar off: not would lift up so much as His eyes to heaven: but smote upon His breast: saying: God be merciful to me a sinner.
Ac 3:19: Repent you therefore: and be converted: that your sins may be blotted out: when the times of refreshing will come from the presence of the Lord;
Ac 11:18: When they heard these things: they held their peace: and glorified God: saying: Then has God also to the Gentiles granted repentance to life.
2Ti 2:25: 26: In meekness instructing those that oppose themselves; if God perhaps will give them repentance to the acknowledging of the truth;

"the sorrow"
Ge 4:13-15: Cain said to the LORD: My punishment is greater than I can bear.

2Sa 17:23: When Ahithophel saw that his counsel not was followed: he saddled his ass: and arose: and gat him home to his house: to his city: and put his household in order: and hanged himself: and died: and was buried in the sepulchre of his father.
1Ki 21:4: Ahab came into his house heavy and displeased because of the word which Naboth the Jezreelite had spoken to him: for he had said: I not will give you the inheritance of my fathers. And he laid him down upon his bed: and turned away his face: and would eat no bread.
Pr 15:13: 15: A merry heart makes a cheerful face: but by sorrow of the heart the spirit is broken.
Pr 17:22: A merry heart does good like a medicine: but a broken spirit dries the bones.
Pr 18:14: The spirit of a man will sustain his infirmity; but a wounded spirit who can bear?

Mt 27:4: 5: Saying: I have sinned in that I have betrayed the innocent blood. And they said: What is that to us? see you to that.
Heb 12:17: For you know how that afterward: when he would have inherited the blessing: he was rejected: for he found no place of repentance: though he sought it carefully with tears.

G4229πράγματι.pragmati   (N-DNS)

11 For look this selfsame thing, that you sorrowed after a godly sort, what carefulness it wrought in you, yes, what clearing of yourselves, yes, what indignation, yes, what fear, yes, what vehement desire, yes, what zeal, yes, what revenge! In all things you have approved yourselves to be clear in this matter.2 Corinthians 7:11
Stats
Rank: #4108 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 321 characters, 30 words, 242 letters, 94 vowels, 148 consonants
Translation
Greek: ιδου γαρ αυτο τουτο το κατα θεον λυπηθηναι υμας ποσην κατειργασατο υμιν σπουδην αλλα απολογιαν αλλα αγανακτησιν αλλα φοβον αλλα επιποθησιν αλλα ζηλον αλλ εκδικησιν εν παντι συνεστησατε εαυτους αγνους ειναι εν τω πραγματι

Lit: Behold for, this very same thing, according to God to have been grieved, how much has produced in you earnestness, but instead reasoned defense, but indignation, but fear, but longing, but zeal, but vindication! In everything, you have proved yourselves innocent to be in this matter.

KJV: For behold this selfsame thing, that ye sorrowed after a godly sort, what carefulness it wrought in you, yea, what clearing of yourselves, yea, [what] indignation, yea, [what] fear, yea, [what] vehement desire, yea, [what] zeal, yea, [what] revenge! In all [things] ye have approved yourselves to be clear in this matter.
References

"that"
2Co 7:9: Now I rejoice: not that you were made sorry: but that you sorrowed to repentance: for you were made sorry after a godly manner: that you might receive damage by us not inhing.
Isa 66:2: For all those things has my hand made: and all those things have been: says the LORD: but to this man will I look: even to Him that is poor and of a contrite spirit: and trembles at my word.
Zec 12:10-14: I will pour upon the house of David: and upon the inhabitants of Jerusalem: the spirit of grace and of supplications: and they will look upon me whom they have pierced: and they will mourn for him: as one mourns for his only son: and will be in bitterness for him: as one that is in bitterness for his firstborn.
1Co 5:2: you are puffed up: and not have rather mourned: that he who has done this deed might be taken away from among you.

"carefulness"
2Co 7:7: not And by his coming only: but by the consolation wherewith he was comforted in you: when he told us your ear desire: your mourning: your fervent mind toward me; so that I rejoiced the more.
1Co 12:25: That there should be no schism in the body; but that the members should have the same care one for another.
Tit 3:8: This is a faithful saying: and these things I will that you affirm constantly: that they which have believed in God might be careful to maintain good works. These things are good and profitable to men.

"clearing"
Ge 44:6: 7: He overtook them: and he spoke to them these same words.
1Co 5:13: But them that are without God judges. Therefore put away from among yourselves that wicked person.
Eph 5:11: Have no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness: but rather reprove them.
1Ti 5:21: 22: I charge you before God: and the Lord Jesus Christ: and the elect angels: that you observe these things without preferring one before another: not doinghing by partiality.

"indignation"
2Sa 12:5-7: David's anger was greatly kindled against the man; and He said to Nathan: As the LORD lives: the man that has done this thing will surely die:
Ne 5:6-13: I was very angry when I heard their cry and these words.
Ne 13:25: I contended with them: and cursed them: and smote certain of them: and plucked off their hair: and made them swear by God: saying: You will not give your daughters to their sons: nor take their daughters to your sons: or for yourselves.
Job 42:6: For what reason I abhor myself: and repent in dust and ashes.
Jer 31:18-20: I have surely heard Ephraim bemoaning Himself thus; You have chastised me: and I was chastised: as a bullock unaccustomed to the yoke: turn you me: and I will be turned; for you are the LORD my God.
Da 6:14: Then the king: when he heard these words: was sore displeased with himself: and set his heart on Daniel to deliver him: and he laboured till the going down of the sun to deliver him.
Mr 3:5: When he had looked round about on them with anger: being grieved for the hardness of their hearts: he says to the man: Stretch forth your hand. And he stretched it out: and his hand was restored whole as the other.
Eph 4:26: Be you angry: and not sin: not let the sun go down upon your wrath:

"fear"
2Co 7:1: Having therefore these promises: dearly beloved: let us cleanse ourselves from all filthiness of the flesh and spirit: perfecting holiness in the fear of God.
Ps 2:11: Serve the LORD with fear: and rejoice with trembling.
Pr 14:16: A wise man fears: and departs from evil: but the fool rages: and is confident.
Pr 28:14: Happy is the man that fears alway: but he who hardens his heart will fall into mischief.
Ro 11:20: Well; because of unbelief they were broken off: and you stand by faith. not Be highminded: but fear:
Php 2:12: For what reason: my beloved: as you have always obeyed: not as in my presence only: but now much more in my absence: work out your own salvation with fear and trembling.
Heb 4:1: Let us therefore fear: lest: a promise being left us of entering into his rest: any of you should seem to come short of it.
Heb 12:15: 16: Looking diligently lest'>lest any man fail of the grace of God; lest'>lest any root of bitterness springing up trouble you: and thereby many be defiled;
1Pe 1:17: If you call on the Father: who without respect of persons judges according to every man's work: pass the time of your sojourning here in fear:
Jude 1:23: Others save with fear: pulling them out of the fire; hating even the garment spotted by the flesh.

"vehement"
Ps 38:9: Lord: all my desire is before you; and my groaning not is hid from you.
Ps 42:1: > As the hart pants'>pants after the water brooks: so pants'>pants my soul after you: O God.
Ps 130:6: My soul waiteth for the Lord more than they that watch for the morning: I say: more than they that watch for the morning.
Ps 145:19: He will fulfil the desire of them that fear him: he also will hear their cry: and will save them.
Song 8:6: Set me as a seal upon your heart: as a seal upon your arm: for love is strong as death; jealousy is cruel as the grave: the coals thereof are coals of fire: which has a most vehement flame.
Isa 26:8: Yes: in the way of your judgments: O LORD: have we waited for you; the desire of our soul is to your name: and to the remembrance of you.
1Pe 2:2: As newborn babes: desire the sincere milk of the word: that you may grow thereby:

"zeal"

Ps 69:9: For the zeal of your house has eaten me up; and the reproaches of them that reproached you are fallen upon me.
Ps 119:139: My zeal has consumed me: because my enemies have forgotten your words.
Joh 2:17: His disciples remembered that it was written: The zeal of your house has eaten me up.
Ac 17:16: Now while Paul waited for them at Athens: his spirit was stirred in him: when he saw the city wholly given to idolatry.

"revenge"
Ps 35:13: But as for me: when they were sick: my clothing was sackcloth: I humbled my soul with fasting; and my prayer returned into my own bosom.
Mt 5:29: 30: If your right eye offend you: pluck it out: and cast it from you: for it is profitable for you that one of your members should perish: not and that your whole body should be cast into hell.
Mr 9:43-48: If your hand offend you: cut it off: it is better for you to enter into life maimed: than having two hands to go into hell: into the fire that never will be quenched:
Re 3:19: As many as I love: I rebuke and chasten: be zealous therefore: and repent.

"approved"

G686ἄραara   (Conj)
G686 ἄρα ára ar-ah probably from αἴρω (through the idea of drawing a conclusion); a particle denoting an inference more or less decisive (as follows):--haply, (what) manner (of man), no doubt, perhaps, so be, then, therefore, truly, wherefore. Often used in connection with other particles, especially γέ or οὖν (after) or εἰ (before). Compare also ἆρα., 		ἄραara So Conj
G1487εἰei   (Conj)
G1487 εἰ ei i a primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.:--forasmuch as, if, that, (al-)though, whether. Often used in connection or composition with other particles, especially as in εἴγε, εἰ δὲ μή(γε), εἰ καί, εἰ μή, εἰ μή τι, εἴ περ, εἴ πως, εἴ τις, ἐκ. See also ἐάν. 		εἰei if Conj

G5228 ὑπέρ hypér hoop-er a primary preposition; over, i.e. (with the genitive case) of place, above, beyond, across, or causal, for the sake of, instead, regarding; with the accusative case superior to, more than:--(+ exceeding, abundantly) above, in (on) behalf of, beyond, by, + very chiefest, concerning, exceeding (above, -ly), for, + very highly, more (than), of, over, on the part of, for sake of, in stead, than, to(-ward), very. G4314πρὸςpros   (Prep)
G4314 πρός prós pros a strengthened form of πρό; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. toward (with the genitive case, the side of, i.e. pertaining to; with the dative case, by the side of, i.e. near to; usually with the accusative case, the place, time, occasion, or respect, which is the destination of the relation, i.e. whither or for which it is predicated):--about, according to , against, among, at, because of, before, between, (where-)by, for, X at thy house, in, for intent, nigh unto, of, which pertain to, that, to (the end that), X together, to (you) -ward, unto, with(-in). In the comparative case, it denotes essentially the same applications, namely, motion towards, accession to, or nearness at. 		πρὸςpros to Prep

G2316Θεοῦ.Theou   (N-GMS)
G2316 θεός theós theh-os of uncertain affinity; a deity, especially (with ὁ) the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very:--X exceeding, God, god(-ly, -ward). 		Θεοῦ.Theou God. N-GMS
12 For what reason, though I wrote to you, I did it not for His cause that had done the wrong, nor for His cause that suffered wrong, but that our care for you in the sight of God might appear to you.2 Corinthians 7:12
Stats
Rank: #4457 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 195 characters, 36 words, 151 letters, 61 vowels, 90 consonants
Translation
Greek: αρα ει και εγραψα υμιν ουχ εινεκεν του αδικησαντος ουδε εινεκεν του αδικηθεντος αλλ εινεκεν του φανερωθηναι την σπουδην {VAR1: υμων } {VAR2: ημων } την υπερ {VAR1: ημων } {VAR2: υμων } προς υμας ενωπιον του θεου

Lit: So if even I wrote to you, it was not for the sake of the one having done wrong, rather nor for the sake of the one having suffered wrong, but rather for the sake of being revealed the earnestness of you, which is for us to you before God.

KJV: Wherefore, though I wrote unto you, I did it not for his cause that had done the wrong, nor for his cause that suffered wrong, but that our care for you in the sight of God might appear unto you.
References

"I did"
2Co 2:9: For to this end also did I write: that I might know the proof of you: whether you be obedient in all things.
1Co 5:1: It is reported commonly that there is fornication among you: and such fornication as not is so much as named among the Gentiles: that one should have his father's wife.

"that our"
2Co 2:4: 17: For out of much affliction and anguish of heart I wrote to you with many tears; not that you should be grieved: but that you might know the love which I have more abundantly to you.
2Co 11:11: 28: For what reason? because I love you not? God knows.
1Ti 3:5: (For if a man not know how to rule His own house: how will He take care of the church of God?)
