10 Now he who ministers seed to the sower both minister bread for your food, and multiply your seed sown, and increase the fruits of your righteousness;)2 Corinthians 9:10
Stats
Rank: #1000 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 153 characters, 24 words, 124 letters, 48 vowels, 76 consonants
Translation
Greek: ο δε επιχορηγων σπερμα τω σπειροντι και αρτον εις βρωσιν χορηγησαι και πληθυναι τον σπορον υμων και αυξησαι τα γεννηματα της δικαιοσυνης υμων

Lit: The One now supplying seed to him sowing and bread for food will supply and will multiply the seed for sowing of you and will increase the fruits of the righteousness of you,

KJV: Now he that ministereth seed to the sower both minister bread for your food, and multiply your seed sown, and increase the fruits of your righteousness;)
References

"he"
Ge 1:11: 12: God said: Let the earth bring forth grass: the herb yielding seed: and the fruit tree yielding fruit after His kind: whose seed is in itself: upon the earth: and it was so.
Ge 47:19: 23: 24: For what reason will we die before your eyes: both we and our land? buy us and our land for bread: and we and our land will be servants to Pharaoh: and give us seed: that we may live: not and die: that the land not be desolate.
Isa 55:10: For as the rain comes down: and the snow from heaven: and returns not there: but waters the earth: and makes it bring forth and bud: that it may give seed to the sower: and bread to the eater:

"multiply"
2Co 9:6: But this I say: He which sows'>sows sparingly will reap also sparingly; and he which sows'>sows bountifully will reap also bountifully.
Pr 11:18: The wicked works a deceitful work: but to him that sows righteousness will be a sure reward.
Ec 11:6: In the morning sow your seed: and in the evening not withhold your hand: for you know not whether will prosper: either this or that: or whether they both will be alike good.
Php 4:17: Not because I desire a gift: but I desire fruit that may abound to your account.

"increase"
Ho 10:12: Sow to yourselves in righteousness: reap in mercy; break up your fallow ground: for it is time to seek the LORD: till He come and rain righteousness upon you.
Mt 6:1: Take heed that you not do your alms before men: to be seen of them: otherwise you have no reward of your Father which is in heaven.
Eph 5:9: (For the fruit of the Spirit is in all goodness and righteousness and truth;)
Php 1:11: Being filled with the fruits of righteousness: which are by Jesus Christ: to the glory and praise of God.
1Th 3:12: The Lord make you to increase and abound in love one toward another: and toward all men: even as we do toward you:
1Th 4:10: Indeed you do it toward all the brothers which are in all Macedonia: but we beseech you: brothers: that you increase more and more;

G3956 πᾶς pâs pas including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole:--all (manner of, means), alway(-s), any (one), X daily, + ever, every (one, way), as many as, + no(-thing), X thoroughly, whatsoever, whole, whosoever. 		πᾶσανpasan all Adj-AFS

11 Being enriched in every thing to all bountifulness, which causes through us thanksgiving to God.2 Corinthians 9:11
Stats
Rank: #2204 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 97 characters, 14 words, 81 letters, 28 vowels, 53 consonants
Translation
Greek: εν παντι πλουτιζομενοι εις πασαν απλοτητα ητις κατεργαζεται δι ημων ευχαριστιαν τω θεω

Lit: in every way enriching you to all generosity, which produces, through us, thanksgiving to God.

KJV: Being enriched in every thing to all bountifulness, which causeth through us thanksgiving to God.
References

"enriched"
2Co 8:2: 3: How that in a great trial of affliction the abundance of their joy and their deep poverty abounded to the riches of their liberality.
1Ch 29:12-14: Both riches and honour come of you: and you reign over all; and in your hand is power and might; and in your hand it is to make great: and to give strength to all.
2Ch 31:10: Azariah the chief priest of the house of Zadok answered Him: and said: Since the people began to bring the offerings into the house of the LORD: we have had enough to eat: and have left plenty: for the LORD has blessed His people; and that which is left is this great store.
Pr 3:9: 10: Honour the LORD with your substance: and with the firstfruits of all your increase:
Mal 3:10: 11: Bring you all the tithes into the storehouse: that there may be meat in my house: and prove me now herewith: says the LORD of hosts: if I not will open you the windows of heaven: and pour you out a blessing: that there will not be room enough to receive it.
1Ti 6:17: 18: Charge them that are rich in this world: that they not be highminded: nor trust in uncertain riches: but in the living God: who gives us richly all things to enjoy;

"bountifulness"
2Co 8:2: How that in a great trial of affliction the abundance of their joy and their deep poverty abounded to the riches of their liberality.
Ro 12:8: Or he who exhorts: on exhortation: he who gives: let him do it with simplicity; he who rules: with diligence; he who shews mercy: with cheerfulness.

"which"
2Co 9:12: For the administration of this not service only supplies the want of the saints: but is abundant also by many thanksgivings to God;
2Co 1:11: You also helping together by prayer for us: that for the gift bestowed upon us by the means of many persons thanks may be given by many on our behalf.
2Co 4:15: For all things are for your sakes: that the abundant grace might through the thanksgiving of many redound to the glory of God.
2Co 8:16: 19: But thanks be to God: which put the same ear care into the heart of Titus for you.

12 For the administration of this not service only supplies the want of the saints, but is abundant also by many thanksgivings to God;2 Corinthians 9:12
Stats
Rank: #3831 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 134 characters, 22 words, 110 letters, 38 vowels, 72 consonants
Translation
Greek: οτι η διακονια της λειτουργιας ταυτης ου μονον εστιν προσαναπληρουσα τα υστερηματα των αγιων αλλα και περισσευουσα δια πολλων ευχαριστιων τω θεω

Lit: For the ministry of the service this not only is completely filling up the needs of the saints, but also is overflowing through many thanksgivings to God,

KJV: For the administration of this service not only supplieth the want of the saints, but is abundant also by many thanksgivings unto God;
References

"the administration"
2Co 9:1: For as touching the ministering to the saints: it is superfluous for me to write to you:
2Co 8:4: Praying us with much intreaty that we would receive the gift: and take upon us the fellowship of the ministering to the saints.

"only"
2Co 8:14: 15: But by an equality: that now at this time your abundance may be a supply for their want: that their abundance also may be a supply for your want: that there may be equality:
Php 2:25: Yet I supposed it necessary to send to you Epaphroditus: my brother: and companion in labour: and fellowsoldier: but your messenger: and he who ministered to my wants.
Php 4:18: 19: But I have all: and abound: I am full: having received of Epaphroditus the things which were sent from you: an odour of a sweet smell: a sacrifice acceptable: wellpleasing to God.
Phm 1:4-7: I thank my God: making mention of you always in my prayers:
Jas 2:14-16: What does it profit: my brothers: though a man say he has faith: and not have works? can faith save him?
1Jo 3:17: But whoever has this world's good: and sees His brother have need: and shuts up His bowels of compassion from Him: how dwells the love of God in Him?

G1909ἐπὶepi   (Prep)
G1909 ἐπί epí ep-ee a primary preposition; properly, meaning superimposition (of time, place, order, etc.), as a relation of distribution (with the genitive case), i.e. over, upon, etc.; of rest (with the dative case) at, on, etc.; of direction (with the accusative case) towards, upon, etc.:--about (the times), above, after, against, among, as long as (touching), at, beside, X have charge of, (be-, (where-))fore, in (a place, as much as, the time of, -to), (because) of, (up-)on (behalf of), over, (by, for) the space of, through(-out), (un-)to(-ward), with. G3956πάντας,pantas   (Adj-AMP)
G3956 πᾶς pâs pas including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole:--all (manner of, means), alway(-s), any (one), X daily, + ever, every (one, way), as many as, + no(-thing), X thoroughly, whatsoever, whole, whosoever. 		πάντας,pantas all; Adj-AMP

Stats

Translation

Lit: through the proof of the service this, they glorifying God at the submission of the of confession of you to the gospel of Christ and the generosity of the participation toward them and toward all;

KJV: Whiles by the experiment of this ministration they glorify God for your professed subjection unto the gospel of Christ, and for your liberal distribution unto them, and unto all [men];

KJV: And by their prayer for you, which long after you for the exceeding grace of God in you.

"by"

"long"

1Ti 1:14: The grace of our Lord was exceeding abundant with faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.

10
Paul’s Final Challenge

Paul’s Apostolic Authority

G1519εἰςeis   (Prep)
G1519 εἰς eis ice a primary preposition; to or into (indicating the point reached or entered), of place, time, or (figuratively) purpose (result, etc.); also in adverbial phrases:--(abundant-)ly, against, among, as, at, (back-)ward, before, by, concerning, + continual, + far more exceeding, for (intent, purpose), fore, + forth, in (among, at, unto, -so much that, -to), to the intent that, + of one mind, + never, of, (up-)on, + perish, + set at one again, (so) that, therefore(-unto), throughout, til, to (be, the end, -ward), (here-)until(-to), …ward, (where-)fore, with. Often used in composition with the same general import, but only with verbs (etc.) expressing motion (literally or figuratively). 		εἰςeis toward Prep
G4771ὑμᾶς·hymas   (PPro-A2P)
G4771 σύ sý soo the personal pronoun of the second person singular; thou:-- thou. See also σέ, σοί, σοῦ; and for the plural ὑμᾶς, ὑμεῖς, ὑμῖν, ὑμῶν., 		ὑμᾶς·hymas you. PPro-A2P
1 Now I Paul myself beseech you by the meekness and gentleness of Christ, who in presence am base among you, but being absent am bold toward you:2 Corinthians 10:1
Stats
Rank: #5774 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 143 characters, 25 words, 114 letters, 43 vowels, 71 consonants
Translation
Greek: αυτος δε εγω παυλος παρακαλω υμας δια της πραοτητος και επιεικειας του χριστου ος κατα προσωπον μεν ταπεινος εν υμιν απων δε θαρρω εις υμας

Lit: Myself now I, Paul, exhort you by the meekness and gentleness of Christ, who as to appearance indeed am humble among you, being absent however am bold toward you.

KJV: Now I Paul myself beseech you by the meekness and gentleness of Christ, who in presence am base among you, but being absent am bold toward you:
References

"I Paul"
1Co 16:21: 22: The salutation of me Paul with my own hand.
Ga 5:2: Look: I Paul say to you: that if you be circumcised: Christ will profit you nothing.
2Th 3:17: The salutation of Paul with my own hand: which is the token in every epistle: so I write.
Phm 1:9: Yet for love's sake I rather beseech you: being such an one as Paul the aged: and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ.
Re 1:9: I John: who also am your brother: and companion in tribulation: and in the kingdom and patience of Jesus Christ: was in the isle that is called Patmos: for the word of God: and for the testimony of Jesus Christ.

"beseech"
2Co 10:2: But I beseech you: that I not may be bold when I am present with that confidence: wherewith I think to be bold against some: which think of us as if we walked according to the flesh.
2Co 5:20: Now then we are ambassadors for Christ: as though God did beseech you by us: we pray you in Christ's stead: be you reconciled to God.
2Co 6:1: We then: as workers together with Him: beseech you also that you not receive the grace of God in vain.
Ro 12:1: I beseech you therefore: brothers: by the mercies of God: that you present your bodies a living sacrifice: holy: acceptable to God: which is your reasonable service.
Eph 4:1: I therefore: the prisoner of the Lord: beseech you that you walk worthy of the vocation wherewith you are called:
1Pe 2:11: Dearly beloved: I beseech you as strangers and pilgrims: abstain from fleshly lusts: which war against the soul;

"by"
Ps 45:4: In your majesty ride prosperously because of truth and meekness and righteousness; and your right hand will teach you terrible things.
Isa 42:3: 4: A bruised reed will not he break: and the smoking flax will not he quench: he will bring forth judgment to truth.
Zec 9:9: Rejoice greatly: O daughter of Zion; shout: O daughter of Jerusalem: look: your King comes to you: he is just: and having salvation; lowly: and riding upon an ass: and upon a colt the foal of an ass.
Mt 11:29: Take my yoke upon you: and learn of me; for I am meek and lowly in heart: and you will find rest to your souls.
Mt 12:19: 20: He will not strive: nor cry; neither will any man hear his voice in the streets.
Mt 21:5: Tell you the daughter of Sion: Look: your King comes to you: meek: and sitting upon an ass: and a colt the foal of an ass.
Ac 8:32: The place of the scripture which he read was this: He was led as a sheep to the slaughter; and like a lamb dumb before his shearer: so opened not he his mouth:
1Pe 2:22: 23: Who did no sin: neither was guile found in his mouth:

"presence"
2Co 10:7: 10: Do you look on things after the outward appearance? If any man trust to Himself that He is Christ's: let Him of Himself think this again: that: as He is Christ's: even so are we Christ's.

"base"
2Co 10:10: For his letters: say they: are weighty and powerful; but his bodily presence is weak: and his speech contemptible.
2Co 11:30: If I must needs glory: I will glory of the things which concern my infirmities.
2Co 12:5: 7-9: Of such an one will I glory: yet of myself I not will glory: but in my infirmities.
2Co 13:4: For though He was crucified through weakness: yet He lives by the power of God. For we also are weak in Him: but we will live with Him by the power of God toward you.
1Co 2:3: I was with you in weakness: and in fear: and in much trembling.
1Co 4:10: We are fools for Christ's sake: but you are wise in Christ; we are weak: but you are strong; you are honourable: but we are despised.
Ga 4:13: You know how through infirmity of the flesh I preached the gospel to you at the first.

"bold"
2Co 3:12: Seeing then that we have such hope: we use great plainness of speech:
2Co 7:4: Great is my boldness of speech toward you: great is my glorying of you: I am filled with comfort: I am exceeding joyful in all our tribulation.
2Co 11:21: I speak as concerning reproach: as though we had been weak. Howbeit whereinsoever any is bold: (I speak foolishly: ) I am bold also.
2Co 13:2: 3: I told you before: and foretell you: as if I were present: the second time; and being absent now I write to them which heretofore have sinned: and to all other: that: if I come again: I not will spare:
Ro 10:20: But Isaiah is very bold: and says: I was found of them that sought not me; I was made manifest to them that not asked after me.
Ro 15:15: Nevertheless: brothers: I have written the more boldly to you in some sort: as putting you in mind: because of the grace that is given to me of God:

G3361μὴmē   (Adv)
G3361 μή mḗ may a primary particle of qualified negation (whereas οὐ expresses an absolute denial); (adverb) not, (conjunction) lest; also (as an interrogative implying a negative answer (whereas οὐ expects an affirmative one)) whether:--any but (that), X forbear, + God forbid, + lack, lest, neither, never, no (X wise in), none, nor, (can-)not, nothing, that not, un(-taken), without. G1909ἐπίepi   (Prep)
G1909 ἐπί epí ep-ee a primary preposition; properly, meaning superimposition (of time, place, order, etc.), as a relation of distribution (with the genitive case), i.e. over, upon, etc.; of rest (with the dative case) at, on, etc.; of direction (with the accusative case) towards, upon, etc.:--about (the times), above, after, against, among, as long as (touching), at, beside, X have charge of, (be-, (where-))fore, in (a place, as much as, the time of, -to), (because) of, (up-)on (behalf of), over, (by, for) the space of, through(-out), (un-)to(-ward), with. In compounds it retains essentially the same import, at, upon, etc. (literally or figuratively). 		ἐπίepi toward Prep

G5613 ὡς hōs hoce probably adverb of comparative from ὅς; which how, i.e. in that manner (very variously used, as follows):--about, after (that), (according) as (it had been, it were), as soon (as), even as (like), for, how (greatly), like (as, unto), since, so (that), that, to wit, unto, when(-soever), while, X with all speed. 		ὡςhōs as Adv
G2596κατὰkata   (Prep)
G2596 κατά katá kat-ah a primary particle; (prepositionally) down (in place or time), in varied relations (according to the case (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined):--about, according as (to), after, against, (when they were) X alone, among, and, X apart, (even, like) as (concerning, pertaining to touching), X aside, at, before, beyond, by, to the charge of, (charita-)bly, concerning, + covered, (dai-)ly, down, every, (+ far more) exceeding, X more excellent, for, from … to, godly, in(-asmuch, divers, every, -to, respect of), … by, after the manner of, + by any means, beyond (out of) measure, X mightily, more, X natural, of (up-)on (X part), out (of every), over against, (+ your) X own, + particularly, so, through(-oughout, -oughout every), thus, (un-)to(-gether, -ward), X uttermost, where(-by), with. In composition it retains many of these applications, and frequently denotes opposition, distribution, or intensity. 		κατὰkata according to Prep
G4561σάρκαsarka   (N-AFS)
G4561 σάρξ sárx sarx probably from the base of σαρόω; flesh (as stripped of the skin), i.e. (strictly) the meat of an animal (as food), or (by extension) the body (as opposed to the soul (or spirit), or as the symbol of what is external, or as the means of kindred), or (by implication) human nature (with its frailties (physically or morally) and passions), or (specially), a human being (as such):--carnal(-ly, + -ly minded), flesh(-ly). 		σάρκαsarka flesh N-AFS
G4043περιπατοῦντας.peripatountas   (V-PPA-AMP)
G4043 περιπατέω peripatéō per-ee-pat-eh-o from περί and πατέω; to tread all around, i.e. walk at large (especially as proof of ability); figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow (as a companion or votary):--go, be occupied with, walk (about). 		περιπατοῦντας.peripatountas walking. V-PPA-AMP
2 But I beseech you, that I not may be bold when I am present with that confidence, wherewith I think to be bold against some, which think of us as if we walked according to the flesh.2 Corinthians 10:2
Stats
Rank: #9012 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 182 characters, 34 words, 142 letters, 52 vowels, 90 consonants
Translation
Greek: δεομαι δε το μη παρων θαρρησαι τη πεποιθησει η λογιζομαι τολμησαι επι τινας τους λογιζομενους ημας ως κατα σαρκα περιπατουντας

Lit: I implore you now that, not being present, to be bold with the confidence with which I reckon to be daring toward some reckoning us as according to flesh walking.

KJV: But I beseech you, that I may not be bold when I am present with that confidence, wherewith I think to be bold against some, which think of us as if we walked according to the flesh.
References

"that I"
2Co 12:20: For I fear: lest'>lest: when I come: I will not find you such as I would: and that I will be found to you such as you not would: lest'>lest there be debates: envyings: wraths: strifes: backbitings: whisperings: swellings: tumults:
2Co 13:2: 10: I told you before: and foretell you: as if I were present: the second time; and being absent now I write to them which heretofore have sinned: and to all other: that: if I come again: I not will spare:
1Co 4:19-21: But I will come to you shortly: if the Lord will: and will know: not the speech of them which are puffed up: but the power.

"we walked"
2Co 11:9-13: When I was present with you: and wanted: I was chargeable to no man: for that which was lacking to me the brothers which came from Macedonia supplied: and in all things I have kept myself from being burdensome to you: and so will I keep myself.
2Co 12:13-19: For what is it wherein you were inferior to other churches: except it be that I myself not was burdensome to you? forgive me this wrong.
Ro 8:1: 5: There is therefore now no condemnation to them which are in Christ Jesus: who not walk after the flesh: but after the Spirit.
Ga 5:16-25: This I say then: Walk in the Spirit: and you will not fulfil the lust of the flesh.
Eph 2:2: 3: Wherein in time past you walked according to the course of this world: according to the prince of the power of the air: the spirit that now works in the children of disobedience:

3 For though we walk in the flesh, we not do war after the flesh:2 Corinthians 10:3
Stats
Rank: #1748 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 63 characters, 13 words, 48 letters, 16 vowels, 32 consonants
Translation
Greek: εν σαρκι γαρ περιπατουντες ου κατα σαρκα στρατευομεθα

Lit: In flesh for walking, not according to flesh do we wage war.

KJV: For though we walk in the flesh, we do not war after the flesh:

"walk"

"we do"

G4314πρὸςpros   (Prep)
G4314 πρός prós pros a strengthened form of πρό; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. toward (with the genitive case, the side of, i.e. pertaining to; with the dative case, by the side of, i.e. near to; usually with the accusative case, the place, time, occasion, or respect, which is the destination of the relation, i.e. whither or for which it is predicated):--about, according to , against, among, at, because of, before, between, (where-)by, for, X at thy house, in, for intent, nigh unto, of, which pertain to, that, to (the end that), X together, to (you) -ward, unto, with(-in). In the comparative case, it denotes essentially the same applications, namely, motion towards, accession to, or nearness at. 		πρὸςpros to Prep
G2506καθαίρεσινkathairesin   (N-AFS)
G2506 καθαίρεσις kathaíresis kath-ah-ee-res-is from καθαιρέω; demolition; figuratively, extinction:--destruction, pulling down. 		καθαίρεσινkathairesin the demolition N-AFS
G3794ὀχυρωμάτων,ochyrōmatōn   (N-GNP)
G3794 ὀχύρωμα ochýrōma okh-oo-ro-mah from a remote derivative of ἔχω (meaning to fortify, through the idea of holding safely); a castle (figuratively, argument):--stronghold. 		ὀχυρωμάτων,ochyrōmatōn of strongholds, N-GNP
4 (For the weapons of our warfare are not carnal, but mighty through God to the pulling down of strong holds;)2 Corinthians 10:4
Stats
Rank: #2029 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 108 characters, 19 words, 85 letters, 29 vowels, 56 consonants
Translation
Greek: τα γαρ οπλα της στρατειας ημων ου σαρκικα αλλα δυνατα τω θεω προς καθαιρεσιν οχυρωματων

Lit: The for weapons of the warfare of us are not fleshly, but powerful divinely to the demolition of strongholds,

KJV: (For the weapons of our warfare are not carnal, but mighty through God to the pulling down of strong holds;)
References

"the weapons"
2Co 6:7: By the word of truth: by the power of God: by the armour of righteousness on the right hand and on the left:
Ro 6:13: Neither yield you your members as instruments of unrighteousness to sin: but yield yourselves to God: as those that are alive from the dead: and your members as instruments of righteousness to God.
Ro 13:12: The night is far spent: the day is at hand: let us therefore cast off the works of darkness: and let us put on the armour of light.
Eph 6:13-18: For what reason take to you the whole armour of God: that you may be able to withstand in the evil day: and having done all: to stand.
1Th 5:8: But let us: who are of the day: be sober: putting on the breastplate of faith and love; and for an helmet: the hope of salvation.

"our"
1Ti 1:18: This charge I commit to you: son Timothy: according to the prophecies which went before on you: that you by them might war a good warfare;
2Ti 2:3: You therefore endure hardness: as a good soldier of Jesus Christ.

"mighty"
2Co 3:5: Not that we are sufficient of ourselves to think any thing as of ourselves; but our sufficiency is of God;
2Co 4:7: But we have this treasure in earthen vessels: that the excellency of the power may be of God: not and of us.
2Co 13:3: 4: Since you seek a proof of Christ speaking in me: which to you-ward not is weak: but is mighty in you.
Jg 7:13-23: When Gideon was come: look: there was a man that told a dream to his fellow: and said: Look: I dreamed a dream: and: indeed: a cake of barley bread tumbled into the host of Midian: and came to a tent: and smote it that it fell: and overturned it: that the tent lay along.
Jg 15:14-16: And when He came to Lehi: the Philistines shouted against Him: and the Spirit of the LORD came mightily upon Him: and the cords that were upon His arms became as flax that was burnt with fire: and His bands loosed from off His hands.
1Sa 17:45-50: Then said David to the Philistine: You come to me with a sword: and with a spear: and with a shield: but I come to you in the name of the LORD of hosts: the God of the armies of Israel: whom you have defied.
Ps 110:2: The LORD will send the rod of your strength out of Zion: rule you in the middle of your enemies.
Isa 41:14-16: not Fear: you worm Jacob: and you men of Israel; I will help you: says the LORD: and your redeemer: the Holy one of Israel.
Zec 4:6: 7: Then He answered and spoke to me: saying: This is the word of the LORD to Zerubbabel: saying: Not by might: nor by power: but by my spirit: says the LORD of hosts.
Ac 7:22: Moses was learned in all the wisdom of the Egyptians: and was mighty in words and in deeds.
1Co 1:18-24: For the preaching of the cross is to them that perish foolishness; but to us which are saved it is the power of God.
1Co 2:5: That your faith not should stand in the wisdom of men: but in the power of God.
2Co 13:3: Since you seek a proof of Christ speaking in me: which to you-ward not is weak: but is mighty in you.
Heb 11:32: 33: What will I more say? for the time would fail me to tell of Gedeon: and of Barak: and of Samson: and of Jephthae; of David also: and Samuel: and of the prophets:

"to the"
Jos 6:20: So the people shouted when the priests blew with the trumpets: and it came to pass: when the people heard the sound of the trumpet: and the people shouted with a great shout: that the wall fell down flat: so that the people went up into the city: every man straight before him: and they took the city.
Isa 30:25: There will be upon every high mountain: and upon every high hill: rivers and streams of waters in the day of the great slaughter: when the towers fall.

Heb 11:30: By faith the walls of Jericho fell down: after they were compassed about 7 days.

5 Casting down imaginations, and every high thing that exalts itself against the knowledge of God, and bringing into captivity every thought to the obedience of Christ;2 Corinthians 10:5
Stats
Rank: #1381 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 168 characters, 24 words, 140 letters, 50 vowels, 90 consonants
Translation
Greek: λογισμους καθαιρουντες και παν υψωμα επαιρομενον κατα της γνωσεως του θεου και αιχμαλωτιζοντες παν νοημα εις την υπακοην του χριστου

Lit: arguments overthrowing, and every high thing lifting itself up against the knowledge of God, and taking captive every thought into the obedience of Christ,

KJV: Casting down imaginations, and every high thing that exalteth itself against the knowledge of God, and bringing into captivity every thought to the obedience of Christ;
References

"down"
Lu 1:51: He has showed strength with his arm; he has scattered the proud in the imagination of their hearts.
Ac 4:25: 26: Who by the mouth of your servant David have said: Why did the heathen rage: and the people imagine vain things?
Ro 1:21: Because that: when they knew God: they glorified Him not as God: neither were thankful; but became vain in their imaginations: and their foolish heart was darkened.
1Co 1:19: 27-29: For it is written: I will destroy the wisdom of the wise: and will bring not tohing the understanding of the prudent.
1Co 3:19: For the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God. For it is written: He takes the wise in their own craftiness.

"and every"
Ex 5:2: Pharaoh said: Who is the LORD: that I should obey His voice to let Israel go? I not know the LORD: neither will I let Israel go.
Ex 9:16: 17: In very deed for this cause have I raised you up: for to show in you my power; and that my name may be declared throughout all the earth.
2Ki 19:22: 28: Whom have you reproached and blasphemed? and against whom have you exalted your voice: and lifted up your eyes on high? even against the Holy one of Israel.
Job 40:11: 12: Cast abroad the rage of your wrath: and look every one that is proud: and abase him.
Job 42:6: For what reason I abhor myself: and repent in dust and ashes.
Ps 10:4: The wicked: through the pride of His face: not will seek after God: God is not in all His thoughts.
Ps 18:27: For you will save the afflicted people; but will bring down high looks.
Isa 2:11: 12: 17: The lofty looks of man will be humbled: and the haughtiness of men will be bowed down: and the LORD alone will be exalted in that day.
Isa 60:14: The sons also of them that afflicted you will come bending to you; and all they that despised you will bow themselves down at the soles of your feet; and they will call you: The city of the LORD: The Zion of the Holy one of Israel.
Eze 17:24: All the trees of the field will know that I the LORD have brought down the high tree: have exalted the low tree: have dried up the green tree: and have made the dry tree to flourish: I the LORD have spoken and have done it.
Da 4:37: Now I Nebuchadnezzar praise and extol and honour the King of heaven: all whose works are truth: and his ways judgment: and those that walk in pride he is able to abase.
Da 5:23-30: But have lifted up yourself against the Lord of heaven; and they have brought the vessels of His house before you: and you: and your lords: your wives: and your concubines: have drunk wine in them; and you have praised the gods of silver: and gold: of brass: iron: wood: and stone: which not see: nor hear: nor know: and the God in whose hand your breath is: and whose are all your ways: have you not glorified:
Ac 9:4-6: He fell to the earth: and heard a voice saying to him: Saul: Saul: why persecute you me?
Php 3:4-9: Though I might also have confidence in the flesh. If any other man thinks that he has whereof he might trust in the flesh: I more:
2Th 2:4: 8: Who opposes and exalts Himself above all that is called God: or that is worshipped; so that He as God sits in the temple of God: shewing Himself that He is God.

"bringing"
Mt 11:29: 30: Take my yoke upon you: and learn of me; for I am meek and lowly in heart: and you will find rest to your souls.
Ro 7:23: But I see another law in my members: warring against the law of my mind: and bringing me into captivity to the law of sin which is in my members.

"every thought"
Ge 8:21: The LORD smelled a sweet savour; and the LORD said in His heart: I not will again curse the ground any more for man's sake; for the imagination of man's heart is evil from His youth; neither will I again smite any more every thing living: as I have done.
De 15:9: Beware that there not be a thought in your wicked heart: saying: The seventh year: the year of release: is at hand; and your eye be evil against your poor brother: and you give Him nought; and He cry to the LORD against you: and it be sin to you.
Ps 139:2: You know my downsitting and my uprising: you understand my thought afar off.
Pr 15:26: The thoughts of the wicked are an abomination to the LORD: but the words of the pure are pleasant words.
Pr 24:9: The thought of foolishness is sin: and the scorner is an abomination to men.
Isa 55:7: Let the wicked forsake His way: and the unrighteous man His thoughts: and let Him return to the LORD: and He will have mercy upon Him; and to our God: for He will abundantly pardon.
Isa 59:7: Their feet run to evil: and they make haste to shed innocent blood: their thoughts are thoughts of iniquity; wasting and destruction are in their paths.
Jer 4:14: O Jerusalem: wash your heart from wickedness: that you may be saved. How long will your vain thoughts lodge within you?
Mt 15:19: For out of the heart proceed evil thoughts: murders: adulteries: fornications: thefts: false witness: blasphemies:
Heb 4:12: For the word of God is quick: and powerful: and sharper than any twoedged sword: piercing even to the dividing asunder of soul and spirit: and of the joints and marrow: and is a discerner of the thoughts and intents of the heart.

"the obedience"
Ps 18:44: As soon as they hear of me: they will obey me: the strangers will submit themselves to me.
Ps 110:2: 3: The LORD will send the rod of your strength out of Zion: rule you in the middle of your enemies.
Ro 1:5: By whom we have received grace and apostleship: for obedience to the faith among all nations: for his name:
Ro 16:26: But now is made manifest: and by the scriptures of the prophets: according to the commandment of the everlasting God: made known to all nations for the obedience of faith:
Heb 5:9: Being made perfect: he became the author of eternal salvation to all them that obey him;
1Pe 1:2: 14: 15: 22: Elect according to the foreknowledge of God the Father: through sanctification of the Spirit: to obedience and sprinkling of the blood of Jesus Christ: Grace to you: and peace: be multiplied.

6 Having in a readiness to revenge all disobedience, when your obedience is fulfilled.2 Corinthians 10:6
Stats
Counts: 88 characters, 13 words, 73 letters, 32 vowels, 41 consonants
Translation
Greek: και εν ετοιμω εχοντες εκδικησαι πασαν παρακοην οταν πληρωθη υμων η υπακοη

Lit: and in readiness having, to avenge all disobedience, when might have been fulfilled your obedience.

KJV: And having in a readiness to revenge all disobedience, when your obedience is fulfilled.
References

"in"
2Co 13:2: 10: I told you before: and foretell you: as if I were present: the second time; and being absent now I write to them which heretofore have sinned: and to all other: that: if I come again: I not will spare:
Nu 16:26-30: He spoke to the congregation: saying: Depart: I pray you: from the tents of these wicked men: and not touchhing of theirs: lest you be consumed in all their sins.
Ac 5:3-11: But Peter said: Ananias: why has Satan filled your heart to lie to the Holy Ghost: and to keep back part of the price of the land?
Ac 13:10: 11: Said: O full of all subtilty and all mischief: you child of the devil: you enemy of all righteousness: will you not cease to pervert the right ways of the Lord?
1Co 4:21: What will you? will I come to you with a rod: or in love: and in the spirit of meekness?
1Co 5:3-5: For I truly: as absent in body: but present in spirit: have judged already: as though I were present: concerning him that has so done this deed:
1Ti 1:20: Of whom is Hymenaeus and Alexander; whom I have delivered to Satan: that they may not learn to blaspheme.
3Jo 1:10: For what reason: if I come: I will remember his deeds which he does: prating against us with malicious words: not and content therewith: neither does he himself receive the brothers: and forbids them that would: and casts them out of the church.

"when"
2Co 2:9: For to this end also did I write: that I might know the proof of you: whether you be obedient in all things.
2Co 7:15: His inward affection is more abundant toward you: whilst he remembers the obedience of you all: how with fear and trembling you received him.

G2596 κατά katá kat-ah a primary particle; (prepositionally) down (in place or time), in varied relations (according to the case (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined):--about, according as (to), after, against, (when they were) X alone, among, and, X apart, (even, like) as (concerning, pertaining to touching), X aside, at, before, beyond, by, to the charge of, (charita-)bly, concerning, + covered, (dai-)ly, down, every, (+ far more) exceeding, X more excellent, for, from … to, godly, in(-asmuch, divers, every, -to, respect of), … by, after the manner of, + by any means, beyond (out of) measure, X mightily, more, X natural, of (up-)on (X part), out (of every), over against, (+ your) X own, + particularly, so, through(-oughout, -oughout every), thus, (un-)to(-gether, -ward), X uttermost, where(-by), with. In composition it retains many of these applications, and frequently denotes opposition, distribution, or intensity. 		κατὰkata according to Prep

G1909ἐφ’eph’   (Prep)
G1909 ἐπί epí ep-ee a primary preposition; properly, meaning superimposition (of time, place, order, etc.), as a relation of distribution (with the genitive case), i.e. over, upon, etc.; of rest (with the dative case) at, on, etc.; of direction (with the accusative case) towards, upon, etc.:--about (the times), above, after, against, among, as long as (touching), at, beside, X have charge of, (be-, (where-))fore, in (a place, as much as, the time of, -to), (because) of, (up-)on (behalf of), over, (by, for) the space of, through(-out), (un-)to(-ward), with. 7 Do you look on things after the outward appearance? If any man trust to Himself that He is Christ's, let Him of Himself think this again, that, as He is Christ's, even so are we Christ's.2 Corinthians 10:7
Stats
Counts: 188 characters, 29 words, 142 letters, 50 vowels, 92 consonants
Translation
Greek: τα κατα προσωπον βλεπετε ει τις πεποιθεν εαυτω χριστου ειναι τουτο λογιζεσθω παλιν αφ εαυτου οτι καθως αυτος χριστου ουτως και ημεις χριστου

Lit: The things according to appearance are you looking. If anyone is persuaded in himself of Christ to be, this let him reckon again within himself, that as he is of Christ, so also are we.

KJV: Do ye look on things after the outward appearance? If any man trust to himself that he is Christ's, let him of himself think this again, that, as he is Christ's, even so [are] we Christ's.
References

"ye look"
2Co 10:1: Now I Paul myself beseech you by the meekness and gentleness of Christ: who in presence am base among you: but being absent am bold toward you:
2Co 5:12: For we not commend ourselves again to you: but give you occasion to glory on our behalf: that you may have somewhat to answer them which glory in appearance: not and in heart.
1Sa 16:7: But the LORD said to Samuel: not Look on His face: or on the height of His stature; because I have refused Him: for the LORD sees not as man sees; for man looks'>looks on the outward appearance: but the LORD looks'>looks on the heart.
Mt 23:5: But all their works they do for to be seen of men: they make broad their phylacteries: and enlarge the borders of their garments:
Lu 16:15: He said to them: You are they which justify yourselves before men; but God knows your hearts: for that which is highly esteemed among men is abomination in the sight of God.
Joh 7:24: not Judge according to the appearance: but judge righteous judgment.
Ro 2:28: 29: For he not is a Jew: which is one outwardly; neither is that circumcision: which is outward in the flesh:

"If"
1Co 3:23: you are Christ's; and Christ is God's.
1Co 14:37: If any man think Himself to be a prophet: or spiritual: let Him acknowledge that the things that I write to you are the commandments of the Lord.
1Co 15:23: But every man in His own order: Christ the firstfruits; afterward they that are Christ's at His coming.
Ga 3:29: If you be Christ's: then are you Abraham's seed: and heirs according to the promise.

"even"
2Co 5:12: For we not commend ourselves again to you: but give you occasion to glory on our behalf: that you may have somewhat to answer them which glory in appearance: not and in heart.
2Co 11:4: 18: 23: For if He that'>He who comes preaches another Jesus: whom we not have preached: or if you receive another spirit: which you not have received: or another gospel: which you not have accepted: you might well bear with Him.
2Co 12:11: I am become a fool in glorying; you have compelled me: for I ought to have been commended of you: for not inhing am I behind the very chief apostles: though I not behing.
2Co 13:3: Since you seek a proof of Christ speaking in me: which to you-ward not is weak: but is mighty in you.
1Co 9:1: Am not I an apostle? am not I free? have not I seen Jesus Christ our Lord? not are you my work in the Lord?
Ga 1:11-13: But I certify you: brothers: that the gospel which was preached of me not is after man.
Ga 2:5-9: To whom we gave place by subjection: no: not for an hour; that the truth of the gospel might continue with you.
1Jo 4:6: We are of God: He that'>He who knows God hears'>hears us; He that'>He who not is of God hears'>hears not us. Hereby know we the spirit of truth: and the spirit of error.

8 For though I should boast somewhat more of our authority, which the Lord has given us for edification, not and for your destruction, I not should be ashamed:2 Corinthians 10:8
Stats
Counts: 158 characters, 25 words, 127 letters, 51 vowels, 76 consonants
Translation
Greek: εαν τε γαρ και περισσοτερον τι καυχησωμαι περι της εξουσιας ημων ης εδωκεν ο κυριος ημιν εις οικοδομην και ουκ εις καθαιρεσιν υμων ουκ αισχυνθησομαι

Lit: If even for more abundantly somewhat I should boast concerning the authority of us, which has given us the Lord for building you up and not for tearing down you, not I will be ashamed,

KJV: For though I should boast somewhat more of our authority, which the Lord hath given us for edification, and not for your destruction, I should not be ashamed:
References

"though"
2Co 1:24: Not for that we have dominion over your faith: but are helpers of your joy: for by faith you stand.
2Co 13:2: 3: 8: 10: I told you before: and foretell you: as if I were present: the second time; and being absent now I write to them which heretofore have sinned: and to all other: that: if I come again: I not will spare:
Ga 1:1: Paul: an apostle: (not of men: neither by man: but by Jesus Christ: and God the Father: who raised Him from the dead;)

"I should not"
2Co 7:14: For if I have boasted any thing to him of you: I not am ashamed; but as we spoke all things to you in truth: even so our boasting: which I made before Titus: is found a truth.
2Co 12:6: For though I would desire to glory: I will not be a fool; for I will say the truth: but now I forbear: lest any man should think of me above that which he sees me to be: or that he hears of me.
2Ti 1:12: For the which cause I also suffer these things: nevertheless I not am ashamed: for I know whom I have believed: and am persuaded that he is able to keep that which I have committed to him against that day.

 ινα μη δοξω ως αν εκφοβειν υμας δια των επιστολων
StrongsGreekEnglishMorphology
G2443ἵναhina   (Conj)
G2443 ἵνα hína hin-ah probably from the same as the former part of ἑαυτοῦ (through the demonstrative idea; compare ὁ); in order that (denoting the purpose or the result):--albeit, because, to the intent (that), lest, so as, (so) that, (for) to. Compare ἵνα μή. 		ἵναhina that Conj
G3361μὴmē   (Adv)
G3361 μή mḗ may a primary particle of qualified negation (whereas οὐ expresses an absolute denial); (adverb) not, (conjunction) lest; also (as an interrogative implying a negative answer (whereas οὐ expects an affirmative one)) whether:--any but (that), X forbear, + God forbid, + lack, lest, neither, never, no (X wise in), none, nor, (can-)not, nothing, that not, un(-taken), without. Often used in compounds in substantially the same relations. See also ἐὰν μή, ἵνα μή, οὐ μή, μῆκος, μηκύνω, μήν, μὴ οὐκ., 		μὴmē not Adv
G1380δόξωdoxō   (V-ASA-1S)
G1380 δοκέω dokéō dok-o a prolonged form of a primary verb, (used only in an alternate in certain tenses; compare the base of δεικνύω) of the same meaning; to think; by implication, to seem (truthfully or uncertainly):--be accounted, (of own) please(-ure), be of reputation, seem (good), suppose, think, trow. 		δόξωdoxō I might seem V-ASA-1S
G5613ὡςhōs   (Adv)

G1223 διά diá dee-ah a primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through (in very wide applications, local, causal, or occasional):--after, always, among, at, to avoid, because of (that), briefly, by, for (cause) … fore, from, in, by occasion of, of, by reason of, for sake, that, thereby, therefore, X though, through(-out), to, wherefore, with (-in). In composition it retains the same general importance. 		διὰdia by means of Prep

10 For his letters, say they, are weighty and powerful; but his bodily presence is weak, and his speech contemptible.2 Corinthians 10:10
Stats
Rank: #8468 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 122 characters, 8 words, 91 letters, 32 vowels, 59 consonants
Translation
Greek: οτι αι μεν επιστολαι φησιν βαρειαι και ισχυραι η δε παρουσια του σωματος ασθενης και ο λογος εξουθενημενος

Lit: For the letters, indeed they say, are weighty and strong, but the presence of the body weak, and the speech having been ignored.

KJV: For his letters, say they, [are] weighty and powerful; but [his] bodily presence [is] weak, and [his] speech contemptible.

"but"

2Co 12:5-9: Of such an one will I glory: yet of myself I not will glory: but in my infirmities.
1Co 2:3: 4: I was with you in weakness: and in fear: and in much trembling.
Ga 4:13: 14: You know how through infirmity of the flesh I preached the gospel to you at the first.

"and his"

Jer 1:6: Then said I: Ah: Lord GOD! look: I cannot speak: for I am a child.
1Co 1:17: 21: For Christ sent not me to baptize: but to preach the gospel: not with wisdom of words: lest the cross of Christ should be made of none effect.
1Co 2:1-4: I: brothers: when I came to you: not came with excellency of speech or of wisdom: declaring to you the testimony of God.

11 Let such an one think this, that, such as we are in word by letters when we are absent, such will we be also in deed when we are present.2 Corinthians 10:11
Stats
Rank: #1262 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 137 characters, 27 words, 104 letters, 38 vowels, 66 consonants
Translation
Greek: τουτο λογιζεσθω ο τοιουτος οτι οιοι εσμεν τω λογω δι επιστολων αποντες τοιουτοι και παροντες τω εργω

Lit: This let reckon such a one, that such as we are in word by letters being absent, such we are also being present in action.

KJV: Let such an one think this, that, such as we are in word by letters when we are absent, such will we be also in deed when we are present.

G1438ἑαυτοὺςheautous   (RefPro-AM3P)
G1438 ἑαυτοῦ heautoû heh-ow-too from a reflexive pronoun otherwise obsolete and the genitive case (dative case or accusative case) of αὐτός; him- (her-, it-, them-, also (in conjunction with the personal pronoun of the other persons) my-, thy-, our-, your-) self (selves), etc.:--alone, her (own, -self), (he) himself, his (own), itself, one (to) another, our (thine) own(-selves), + that she had, their (own, own selves), (of) them(-selves), they, thyself, you, your (own, own conceits, own selves, -selves)., 		ἑαυτοὺςheautous themselves RefPro-AM3P

G4920συνιᾶσιν.syniasin   (V-PIA-3P)
G4920 συνίημι syníēmi soon-ee-ay-mee from σύν and (to send); to put together, i.e. (mentally) to comprehend; by implication, to act piously:-- consider, understand, be wise. 		συνιᾶσιν.syniasin understand. V-PIA-3P
12 For we not dare make ourselves of the number, or compare ourselves with some that commend themselves: but they measuring themselves by themselves, and comparing themselves among themselves, not are wise.2 Corinthians 10:12
Stats
Rank: #1727 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 203 characters, 27 words, 168 letters, 61 vowels, 107 consonants
Translation
Greek: ου γαρ τολμωμεν εγκριναι η συγκριναι εαυτους τισιν των εαυτους συνιστανοντων αλλα αυτοι εν εαυτοις εαυτους μετρουντες και συγκρινοντες εαυτους εαυτοις ου συνιουσιν

Lit: Not for dare we to classify or to compare ourselves with some themselves commending; but these by themselves, themselves measuring, and comparing themselves with themselves, not understand.

KJV: For we dare not make ourselves of the number, or compare ourselves with some that commend themselves: but they measuring themselves by themselves, and comparing themselves among themselves, are not wise.
References

"we dare not"
2Co 3:1: Do we begin again to commend ourselves? or need we: as some others: epistles of commendation to you: or letters of commendation from you?
2Co 5:12: For we not commend ourselves again to you: but give you occasion to glory on our behalf: that you may have somewhat to answer them which glory in appearance: not and in heart.
Job 12:2: No doubt but you are the people: and wisdom will die with you.
Pr 25:27: It is not good to eat much honey: so for men to search their own glory not is glory.
Pr 27:2: Let another man praise you: not and your own mouth; a stranger: not and your own lips.
Lu 18:11: The Pharisee stood and prayed thus with Himself: God: I thank you: that I not am as other men are: extortioners: unjust: adulterers: or even as this publican.
Ro 15:18: For I not will dare to speak of any of those things which Christ has not wrought by me: to make the Gentiles obedient: by word and deed:

"are not wise"
Pr 26:12: See you a man wise in his own conceit? there is more hope of a fool than of him.

G1519εἰςeis   (Prep)
G1519 εἰς eis ice a primary preposition; to or into (indicating the point reached or entered), of place, time, or (figuratively) purpose (result, etc.); also in adverbial phrases:--(abundant-)ly, against, among, as, at, (back-)ward, before, by, concerning, + continual, + far more exceeding, for (intent, purpose), fore, + forth, in (among, at, unto, -so much that, -to), to the intent that, + of one mind, + never, of, (up-)on, + perish, + set at one again, (so) that, therefore(-unto), throughout, til, to (be, the end, -ward), (here-)until(-to), …ward, (where-)fore, with. G2596κατὰkata   (Prep)
G2596 κατά katá kat-ah a primary particle; (prepositionally) down (in place or time), in varied relations (according to the case (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined):--about, according as (to), after, against, (when they were) X alone, among, and, X apart, (even, like) as (concerning, pertaining to touching), X aside, at, before, beyond, by, to the charge of, (charita-)bly, concerning, + covered, (dai-)ly, down, every, (+ far more) exceeding, X more excellent, for, from … to, godly, in(-asmuch, divers, every, -to, respect of), … by, after the manner of, + by any means, beyond (out of) measure, X mightily, more, X natural, of (up-)on (X part), out (of every), over against, (+ your) X own, + particularly, so, through(-oughout, -oughout every), thus, (un-)to(-gether, -ward), X uttermost, where(-by), with. 13 But we not will boast of things without our measure, but according to the measure of the rule which God has distributed to us, a measure to reach even to you.2 Corinthians 10:13
Stats
Counts: 161 characters, 29 words, 128 letters, 54 vowels, 74 consonants
Translation
Greek: ημεις δε ουχι εις τα αμετρα καυχησομεθα αλλα κατα το μετρον του κανονος ου εμερισεν ημιν ο θεος μετρου εφικεσθαι αχρι και υμων

Lit: We however not into the things beyond measure will boast, but according to the measure of the area that has assigned to us God, a measure to reach as far as also you.

KJV: But we will not boast of things without our measure, but according to the measure of the rule which God hath distributed to us, a measure to reach even unto you.
References

"we will not"
2Co 10:15: Not boasting of things without our measure: that is: of other men's labours; but having hope: when your faith is increased: that we will be enlarged by you according to our rule abundantly:
Pr 25:14: Whoever boasts himself of a false gift is like clouds and wind without rain.

"according"
2Co 10:14: For we not stretch ourselves beyond our measure: as though we not reached to you: for we are come as far as to you also in preaching the gospel of Christ:
Mt 25:15: to one he gave 5 talents: to another two: and to another one; to every man according to his several ability; and straightway took his journey.
Ro 12:6: Having then gifts differing according to the grace that is given to us: whether prophecy: let us prophesy according to the proportion of faith;
Ro 15:20: Yes: so have I strived to preach the gospel: nowhere Christ was named: lest I should build upon another man's foundation:
1Co 12:11: But all these works that one and the selfsame Spirit: dividing to every man severally as He will.
Eph 4:7: But to every one of us is given grace according to the measure of the gift of Christ.
1Pe 4:10: As every man has received the gift: even so minister the same one to another: as good stewards of the manifold grace of God.

"rule"
Ps 19:4: Their line is gone out through all the earth: and their words to the end of the world. In them has he set a tabernacle for the sun:
Isa 28:17: Judgment also will I lay to the line: and righteousness to the plummet: and the hail will sweep away the refuge of lies: and the waters will overflow the hiding place.
Ro 10:18: But I say: Have not they heard? Yes truly: their sound went into all the earth: and their words to the ends of the world.

G3361μὴmē   (Adv)
G3361 μή mḗ may a primary particle of qualified negation (whereas οὐ expresses an absolute denial); (adverb) not, (conjunction) lest; also (as an interrogative implying a negative answer (whereas οὐ expects an affirmative one)) whether:--any but (that), X forbear, + God forbid, + lack, lest, neither, never, no (X wise in), none, nor, (can-)not, nothing, that not, un(-taken), without. 14 For we not stretch ourselves beyond our measure, as though we not reached to you: for we are come as far as to you also in preaching the gospel of Christ:2 Corinthians 10:14
Stats
Rank: #3548 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 158 characters, 27 words, 123 letters, 51 vowels, 72 consonants
Translation
Greek: ου γαρ ως μη εφικνουμενοι εις υμας υπερεκτεινομεν εαυτους αχρι γαρ και υμων εφθασαμεν εν τω ευαγγελιω του χριστου

Lit: Not for as not reaching to you, we are overextending ourselves; as far as for also you, we came in the gospel of Christ,

KJV: For we stretch not ourselves beyond our measure, as though we reached not unto you: for we are come as far as to you also in [preaching] the gospel of Christ:
References

"we stretch not"
2Co 3:1-3: Do we begin again to commend ourselves? or need we: as some others: epistles of commendation to you: or letters of commendation from you?
Ro 15:18: 19: For I not will dare to speak of any of those things which Christ has not wrought by me: to make the Gentiles obedient: by word and deed:
1Co 2:10: But God has revealed them to us by His Spirit: for the Spirit searches all things: yes: the deep things of God.
1Co 3:5: 10: Who then is Paul: and who is Apollos: but ministers by whom you believed: even as the Lord gave to every man?
1Co 4:15: For though you have 10000 instructors in Christ: yet have you not many fathers: for in Christ Jesus I have begotten you through the gospel.
1Co 9:1: 2: Am not I an apostle? am not I free? have not I seen Jesus Christ our Lord? not are you my work in the Lord?

"the gospel"
2Co 4:4: In whom the god of this world has blinded the minds of them which not believe: lest the light of the glorious gospel of Christ: who is the image of God: should shine to them.
Mr 1:1: The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ: the Son of God;
Ac 20:24: But none of these things move me: neither count I my life dear to myself: so that I might finish my course with joy: and the ministry: which I have received of the Lord Jesus: to testify the gospel of the grace of God.
Ro 1:16: For I not am ashamed of the gospel of Christ: for it is the power of God to salvation to every one that believes; to the Jew first: and also to the Greek.
Ro 2:16: In the day when God will judge the secrets of men by Jesus Christ according to my gospel.
Ro 16:25: Now to Him that is of power to stablish you according to my gospel: and the preaching of Jesus Christ: according to the revelation of the mystery: which was kept secret since the world began:
Ga 1:6-8: I marvel that you are so soon removed from Him that called you into the grace of Christ to another gospel:
Col 1:5: For the hope which is laid up for you in heaven: whereof you heard before in the word of the truth of the gospel;
1Ti 1:11: According to the glorious gospel of the blessed God: which was committed to my trust.

G1519 εἰς eis ice a primary preposition; to or into (indicating the point reached or entered), of place, time, or (figuratively) purpose (result, etc.); also in adverbial phrases:--(abundant-)ly, against, among, as, at, (back-)ward, before, by, concerning, + continual, + far more exceeding, for (intent, purpose), fore, + forth, in (among, at, unto, -so much that, -to), to the intent that, + of one mind, + never, of, (up-)on, + perish, + set at one again, (so) that, therefore(-unto), throughout, til, to (be, the end, -ward), (here-)until(-to), …ward, (where-)fore, with. 15 Not boasting of things without our measure, that is, of other men's labours; but having hope, when your faith is increased, that we will be enlarged by you according to our rule abundantly,2 Corinthians 10:15
Stats
Rank: #4456 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 192 characters, 28 words, 151 letters, 59 vowels, 92 consonants
Translation
Greek: ουκ εις τα αμετρα καυχωμενοι εν αλλοτριοις κοποις ελπιδα δε εχοντες αυξανομενης της πιστεως υμων εν υμιν μεγαλυνθηναι κατα τον κανονα ημων εις περισσειαν

Lit: not to the things beyond measure boasting in others’ labors, hope however having, increasing the faith of you, among you to be enlarged according to the area of us, to abundance,

KJV: Not boasting of things without our measure, [that is], of other men's labours; but having hope, when your faith is increased, that we shall be enlarged by you according to our rule abundantly,

"boasting"

Ro 15:20: Yes: so have I strived to preach the gospel: nowhere Christ was named: lest I should build upon another man's foundation:

18 not For He that'>He who commends'>commends Himself is approved, but whom the Lord commends'>commends.2 Corinthians 10:18
Stats
Rank: #3708 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 77 characters, 12 words, 63 letters, 20 vowels, 43 consonants
Translation
Greek: ου γαρ ο εαυτον συνιστων εκεινος εστιν δοκιμος αλλ ον ο κυριος συνιστησιν

Lit: Not for the one himself commending, this one is approved, but the one whom the Lord commends.

KJV: For not he that commendeth himself is approved, but whom the Lord commendeth.
References

"not"
2Co 10:12: For we not dare make ourselves of the number: or compare ourselves with some that commend themselves: but they measuring themselves by themselves: and comparing themselves among themselves: not are wise.
2Co 3:1: Do we begin again to commend ourselves? or need we: as some others: epistles of commendation to you: or letters of commendation from you?
2Co 5:12: For we not commend ourselves again to you: but give you occasion to glory on our behalf: that you may have somewhat to answer them which glory in appearance: not and in heart.
Pr 21:2: Every way of a man is right in His own eyes: but the LORD ponders the hearts.
Pr 27:2: Let another man praise you: not and your own mouth; a stranger: not and your own lips.
Lu 16:15: He said to them: You are they which justify yourselves before men; but God knows your hearts: for that which is highly esteemed among men is abomination in the sight of God.
Lu 18:10-14: two men went up into the temple to pray; the one a Pharisee: and the other a publican.

"approved"
2Co 6:4: But in all things approving ourselves as the ministers of God: in much patience: in afflictions: in necessities: in distresses:
2Co 13:7: Now I pray to God that you do no evil; not that we should appear approved: but that you should do that which is ho: though we be as reprobates.
Ac 2:22: You men of Israel: hear these words; Jesus of Nazareth: a man approved of God among you by miracles and wonders and signs: which God did by Him in the middle of you: as you yourselves also know:
Ro 14:18: For He that'>He who in these things serves Christ is acceptable to God: and approved of men.
Ro 16:10: Greet Apelles approved in Christ. Greet them which are of Aristobulus' household.
1Co 11:19: For there must be also heresies among you: that they which are approved may be made manifest among you.
2Ti 2:15: Study to show yourself approved to God: a workman that needs not to be ashamed: rightly dividing the word of truth.

"but"
Mt 25:20-23: So He that'>He who had received 5 talents came and brought other 5 talents: saying: Lord: you deliveredst to me 5 talents: look: I have gained beside them 5 talents more.
Joh 5:42-44: But I know you: that you not have the love of God in you.
Joh 12:43: For they loved the praise of men more than the praise of God.
Ro 2:29: But He is a Jew: which is one inwardly; and circumcision is that of the heart: in the spirit: and not in the letter; whose praise is not of men: but of God.
1Co 4:5: Therefore not judgehing before the time: until the Lord come: who both will bring to light the hidden things of darkness: and will make manifest the counsels of the hearts: and then will every man have praise of God.
1Pe 1:7: That the trial of your faith: being much more precious than of gold that perishes: though it be tried with fire: might be found to praise and honour and glory at the appearing of Jesus Christ:

11
Paul and the False Apostles

G5100 τὶς tìs tis an enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object:--a (kind of), any (man, thing, thing at all), certain (thing), divers, he (every) man, one (X thing), ought, + partly, some (man, -body, - thing, -what), (+ that no-)thing, what(-soever), X wherewith, whom(-soever), whose(-soever)., 		τιti a IPro-ANS

G235 ἀλλά allá al-lah neuter plural of ἄλλος; properly, other things, i.e. (adverbially) contrariwise (in many relations):--and, but (even), howbeit, indeed, nay, nevertheless, no, notwithstanding, save, therefore, yea, yet. 		ἀλλὰalla but Conj

1 Would to God you could bear with me a little in my folly: and indeed bear with me.2 Corinthians 11:1
Stats
Counts: 81 characters, 17 words, 62 letters, 24 vowels, 38 consonants
Translation
Greek: οφελον ανειχεσθε μου μικρον τη αφροσυνη αλλα και ανεχεσθε μου

Lit: I wish you were bearing with me little a in foolishness, but indeed you do bear with me.

KJV: Would to God ye could bear with me a little in my folly: and indeed bear with me.
References

"Would"
Nu 11:29: Moses said to Him: Enviest you for my sake? would God that all the LORD's people were prophets: and that the LORD would put His spirit upon them!
Jos 7:7: Joshua said: Alas: O Lord GOD: for what reason have you at all brought this people over Jordan: to deliver us into the hand of the Amorites: to destroy us? would to God we had been content: and dwelt on the other side Jordan!
2Ki 5:3: She said to her mistress: Would God my lord were with the prophet that is in Samaria! for He would recover Him of His leprosy.
Ac 26:29: Paul said: I would to God: not that only you: but also all that hear me this day: were both almost: and altogether such as I am: except these bonds.
1Co 4:8: Now you are full: now you are rich: you have reigned as kings without us: and I would to God you did reign: that we also might reign with you.

"bear with me a"
2Co 11:4: For if He that'>He who comes preaches another Jesus: whom we not have preached: or if you receive another spirit: which you not have received: or another gospel: which you not have accepted: you might well bear with Him.
Ac 18:14: When Paul was now about to open his mouth: Gallio said to the Jews: If it were a matter of wrong or wicked lewdness: O you Jews: reason would that I should bear with you:
Heb 5:2: Who can have compassion on the ignorant: and on them that are out of the way; for that he himself also is compassed with infirmity.

"in"
2Co 11:16: 17: 19: 21: I say again: Let no man think me a fool; if otherwise: yet as a fool receive me: that I may boast myself a little.
2Co 5:13: For whether we be beside ourselves: it is to God: or whether we be sober: it is for your cause.
2Co 12:11: I am become a fool in glorying; you have compelled me: for I ought to have been commended of you: for not inhing am I behind the very chief apostles: though I not behing.
1Co 1:21: For after that in the wisdom of God the world by wisdom not knew God: it pleased God by the foolishness of preaching to save them that believe.
1Co 3:18: Let no man deceive himself. If any man among you seems to be wise in this world: let him become a fool: that he may be wise.
1Co 4:10: We are fools for Christ's sake: but you are wise in Christ; we are weak: but you are strong; you are honourable: but we are despised.

2 For I am jealous over you with godly jealousy: for I have espoused you to one husband, that I may present you as a chaste virgin to Christ.2 Corinthians 11:2
Stats
Rank: #2918 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 139 characters, 26 words, 109 letters, 47 vowels, 62 consonants
Translation
Greek: ζηλω γαρ υμας θεου ζηλω ηρμοσαμην γαρ υμας ενι ανδρι παρθενον αγνην παραστησαι τω χριστω

Lit: I am jealous as to for you of God with the jealousy; I have betrothed for you to one husband, a virgin pure to present to Christ.

KJV: For I am jealous over you with godly jealousy: for I have espoused you to one husband, that I may present you as a chaste virgin to Christ.
References

"jealous"
Ga 4:11: 17-19: I am afraid of you: lest I have bestowed upon you labour in vain.
Php 1:8: For God is my record: how greatly I long after you all in the bowels of Jesus Christ.
1Th 2:11: As you know how we exhorted and comforted and charged every one of you: as a father does his children:

"I have"
Ge 24:2-5: 58-67: Abraham said to his eldest servant of his house: that ruled over all that he had: Put: I pray you: your hand under my thigh:
Ps 45:10: 11: Listen: O daughter: and consider: and incline your ear; forget also your own people: and your father's house;
Isa 54:5: For your Maker is your husband; the LORD of hosts is His name; and your Redeemer the Holy one of Israel; The God of the whole earth will He be called.
Isa 62:4: 5: You will no more be termed Forsaken; neither will your land any more be termed Desolate: but you will be called Hephzibah: and your land Beulah: for the LORD delights in you: and your land will be married.
Ho 2:19: 20: I will betroth you to me for ever; yes: I will betroth you to me in righteousness: and in judgment: and in lovingkindness: and in mercies.
Joh 3:29: He who has the bride is the groom: but the friend of the groom: which stands and hears him: rejoices greatly because of the groom's voice: this my joy therefore is fulfilled.
Ro 7:4: For what reason: my brothers: you also are become dead to the law by the body of Christ; that you should be married to another: even to Him who is raised from the dead: that we should bring forth fruit to God.
1Co 4:15: For though you have 10000 instructors in Christ: yet have you not many fathers: for in Christ Jesus I have begotten you through the gospel.

"I may"
Eph 5:27: That he might present it to himself a glorious church: not having spot: or wrinkle: or any such thing; but that it should be holy and without blemish.

"a chaste"

G3361μήmē   (Adv)
G3361 μή mḗ may a primary particle of qualified negation (whereas οὐ expresses an absolute denial); (adverb) not, (conjunction) lest; also (as an interrogative implying a negative answer (whereas οὐ expects an affirmative one)) whether:--any but (that), X forbear, + God forbid, + lack, lest, neither, never, no (X wise in), none, nor, (can-)not, nothing, that not, un(-taken), without. Often used in compounds in substantially the same relations. See also ἐὰν μή, ἵνα μή, οὐ μή, μῆκος, μηκύνω, μήν, μὴ οὐκ., 		μήmē lest Adv

3 But I fear, lest by any means, as the serpent beguiled Eve through His subtilty, so your minds should be corrupted from the simplicity that is in Christ.2 Corinthians 11:3
Stats
Rank: #1929 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 153 characters, 25 words, 122 letters, 42 vowels, 80 consonants
Translation
Greek: φοβουμαι δε μηπως ως ο οφις ευαν εξηπατησεν εν τη πανουργια αυτου ουτως φθαρη τα νοηματα υμων απο της απλοτητος της εις τον χριστον

Lit: I am afraid however, lest by any means as the serpent deceived Eve in the craftiness of him, might be corrupted the minds of you from the simplicity and the purity in Christ.

KJV: But I fear, lest by any means, as the serpent beguiled Eve through his subtilty, so your minds should be corrupted from the simplicity that is in Christ.
References

"I fear"
2Co 11:29: Who is weak: and I not am weak? who is offended: and I not burn?
2Co 12:20: 21: For I fear: lest'>lest: when I come: I will not find you such as I would: and that I will be found to you such as you not would: lest'>lest there be debates: envyings: wraths: strifes: backbitings: whisperings: swellings: tumults:
Ps 119:53: Horror has taken hold upon me because of the wicked that forsake your law.
Ga 1:6: I marvel that you are so soon removed from Him that called you into the grace of Christ to another gospel:
Ga 3:1: O foolish Galatians: who has bewitched you: that you not should obey the truth: before whose eyes Jesus Christ has been evidently set forth: crucified among you?
Ga 4:11: I am afraid of you: lest I have bestowed upon you labour in vain.
Php 3:18: 19: (For many walk: of whom I have told you often: and now tell you even weeping: that they are the enemies of the cross of Christ:

"as"
Ge 3:4: 13: The serpent said to the woman: You will not surely die:
Joh 8:44: You are of your father the devil: and the lusts of your father you will do. He was a murderer from the beginning: and not abode in the truth: because there is no truth in him. When he speaks'>speaks a lie: he speaks'>speaks of his own: for he is a liar: and the father of it.
1Ti 2:14: Adam not was deceived: but the woman being deceived was in the transgression.
Re 12:9: The great dragon was cast out: that old serpent: called the Devil: and Satan: which deceives the whole world: he was cast out into the earth: and his angels were cast out with him.
Re 20:2: He laid hold on the dragon: that old serpent: which is the Devil: and Satan: and bound him a000 years:

"so"
2Co 11:13-15: For such are false apostles: deceitful workers: transforming themselves into the apostles of Christ.
2Co 2:17: For we not are as many: which corrupt the word of God: but as of sincerity: but as of God: in the sight of God speak we in Christ.
2Co 4:2: But have renounced the hidden things of dishonesty: not walking in craftiness: nor handling the word of God deceitfully; but by manifestation of the truth commending ourselves to every man's conscience in the sight of God.
Mt 24:24: For there will arise false Christs: and false prophets: and will show great signs and wonders; insomuch that: if it were possible: they will deceive the very elect.
Ac 20:30: 31: Also of your own selves will men arise: speaking perverse things: to draw away disciples after them.
Ga 1:6: I marvel that you are so soon removed from Him that called you into the grace of Christ to another gospel:
Ga 2:4: That because of false brothers unawares brought in: who came in privily to spy out our liberty which we have in Christ Jesus: that they might bring us into bondage:
Ga 3:1: O foolish Galatians: who has bewitched you: that you not should obey the truth: before whose eyes Jesus Christ has been evidently set forth: crucified among you?
Eph 4:14: That we henceforth be no more children: tossed to and fro: and carried about with every wind of doctrine: by the sleight of men: and cunning craftiness: whereby they lie in wait to deceive;
Eph 6:24: Grace be with all them that love our Lord Jesus Christ in sincerity. Amen. Written from Rome to the Ephesians by Tychicus.>>
Col 2:4: 8: 18: This I say: lest any man should beguile you with enticing words.
2Th 2:3-11: Let no man deceive you by any means: for that day will not come: except there come a falling away first: and that man of sin be revealed: the son of perdition;
1Ti 1:3: As I besought you to abide still at Ephesus: when I went into Macedonia: that you might charge some that they teach no other doctrine:
1Ti 4:1-4: Now the Spirit speaks expressly: that in the latter times some will depart from the faith: giving heed to seducing spirits: and doctrines of devils;
2Ti 3:1-9: 13: This know also: that in the last days perilous times will come.
2Ti 4:3: 4: For the time will come when they not will endure sound doctrine; but after their own lusts will they heap to themselves teachers: having itching ears;
Tit 1:10: For there are many unruly and vain talkers and deceivers: specially they of the circumcision:
Heb 13:9: not Be carried about with divers and strange doctrines. For it is a good thing that the heart be established with grace; not with meats: which not have profited them that have been occupied therein.
2Pe 2:1-14: But there were false prophets also among the people: even as there will be false teachers among you: who privily will bring in damnable heresies: even denying the Lord that bought them: and bring upon themselves swift destruction.
2Pe 3:3: 17: Knowing this first: that there will come in the last days scoffers: walking after their own lusts:
1Jo 2:18: Little children: it is the last time: and as you have heard that antichrist will come: even now are there many antichrists; whereby we know that it is the last time.
1Jo 4:1: Beloved: not believe every spirit: but try the spirits whether they are of God: because many false prophets are gone out into the world.
Jude 1:4: For there are certain men crept in unawares: who were before of old ordained to this condemnation: ungodly men: turning the grace of our God into lasciviousness: and denying the only Lord God: and our Lord Jesus Christ.
Re 12:9: The great dragon was cast out: that old serpent: called the Devil: and Satan: which deceives the whole world: he was cast out into the earth: and his angels were cast out with him.

"the simplicity"
2Co 1:12: For our rejoicing is this: the testimony of our conscience: that in simplicity and godly sincerity: not with fleshly wisdom: but by the grace of God: we have had our conversation in the world: and more abundantly to you-ward.
Ro 12:8: Or he who exhorts: on exhortation: he who gives: let him do it with simplicity; he who rules: with diligence; he who shews mercy: with cheerfulness.
Ro 16:18: 19: For they that are such not serve our Lord Jesus Christ: but their own belly; and by good words and fair speeches deceive the hearts of the simple.

 ει μεν γαρ ο ερχομενος αλλον ιησουν κηρυσσει ον ουκ εκηρυξαμεν η πνευμα ετερον λαμβανετε ο ουκ ελαβετε η ευαγγελιον ετερον ο ουκ εδεξασθε καλως ηνειχεσθε
StrongsGreekEnglishMorphology
G1487εἰei   (Conj)
G1487 εἰ ei i a primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.:--forasmuch as, if, that, (al-)though, whether. Often used in connection or composition with other particles, especially as in εἴγε, εἰ δὲ μή(γε), εἰ καί, εἰ μή, εἰ μή τι, εἴ περ, εἴ πως, εἴ τις, ἐκ. See also ἐάν. 		εἰei If Conj
G3303μὲνmen   (Conj)
G3303 μέν mén men a primary particle; properly, indicative of affirmation or concession (in fact); usually followed by a contrasted clause with δέ (this one, the former, etc.):--even, indeed, so, some, truly, verily. Often compounded with other particles in an intensive or asseverative sense., 		μὲνmen indeed Conj
G1063γὰρgar   (Conj)
G1063 γάρ gár gar a primary particle; properly, assigning a reason (used in argument, explanation or intensification; often with other particles):--and, as, because (that), but, even, for, indeed, no doubt, seeing, then, therefore, verily, what, why, yet. 		γὰρgar for Conj

G4151πνεῦμαpneuma   (N-ANS)
G4151 πνεῦμα pneûma pnyoo-mah from πνέω; a current of air, i.e. breath (blast) or a breeze; by analogy or figuratively, a spirit, i.e. (human) the rational soul, (by implication) vital principle, mental disposition, etc., or (superhuman) an angel, demon, or (divine) God, Christs spirit, the Holy Spirit:--ghost, life, spirit(-ual, -ually), mind. Compare ψυχή. 		πνεῦμαpneuma a spirit N-ANS

4 For if He that'>He who comes preaches another Jesus, whom we not have preached, or if you receive another spirit, which you not have received, or another gospel, which you not have accepted, you might well bear with Him.2 Corinthians 11:4
Stats
Counts: 212 characters, 31 words, 166 letters, 64 vowels, 102 consonants
Translation
Greek: ει μεν γαρ ο ερχομενος αλλον ιησουν κηρυσσει ον ουκ εκηρυξαμεν η πνευμα ετερον λαμβανετε ο ουκ ελαβετε η ευαγγελιον ετερον ο ουκ εδεξασθε καλως ηνειχεσθε

Lit: If indeed for the one coming, another Jesus proclaims, whom not we did proclaim, or a spirit different you receive which not you did receive, or glad tidings different which not you did accept, well are you bearing with it.

KJV: For if he that cometh preacheth another Jesus, whom we have not preached, or if ye receive another spirit, which ye have not received, or another gospel, which ye have not accepted, ye might well bear with [him].
References

"preacheth"
Ac 4:12: Neither is there salvation in any other: for there is none other name under heaven given among men: whereby we must be saved.
1Ti 2:5: For there is one God: and one mediator between God and men: the man Christ Jesus;

"receive"
1Co 12:4-11: Now there are diversities of gifts: but the same Spirit.
Ga 3:2: This only would I learn of you: Received you the Spirit by the works of the law: or by the hearing of faith?
Eph 4:4: 5: There is one body: and one Spirit: even as you are called in one hope of your calling;

"another gospel"
Ga 1:7: 8: Which not is another; but there be some that trouble you: and would pervert the gospel of Christ.

G652ἀποστόλων.apostolōn   (N-GMP)
G652 ἀπόστολος apóstolos ap-os-tol-os from ἀποστέλλω; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ (apostle) (with miraculous powers):--apostle, messenger, he that is sent. 		ἀποστόλων.apostolōn apostles. N-GMP
5 For I suppose I not was a whit behind the very chief apostles.2 Corinthians 11:5
Stats
Counts: 65 characters, 13 words, 52 letters, 20 vowels, 32 consonants
Translation
Greek: λογιζομαι γαρ μηδεν υστερηκεναι των υπερ λιαν αποστολων

Lit: I reckon for in nothing to have been inferior to those most eminent apostles.

KJV: For I suppose I was not a whit behind the very chiefest apostles.
References

"I was not"
2Co 12:11: 12: I am become a fool in glorying; you have compelled me: for I ought to have been commended of you: for not inhing am I behind the very chief apostles: though I not behing.
1Co 15:10: But by the grace of God I am what I am: and His grace which was bestowed upon me not was in vain; but I laboured more abundantly than they all: not yet I: but the grace of God which was with me.
Ga 2:6-9: But of these who seemed to be somewhat: (whatever they were: it makes no matter to me: God accepts no man's person:) for they who seemed to be somewhat in conference not addedhing to me:

G1519εἰςeis   (Prep)
