G1473ἐμοῦemou   (PPro-G1S)
G1473 ἐγώ egṓ eg-o a primary pronoun of the first person I (only expressed when emphatic):--I, me. For the other cases and the plural see ἐμέ, ἐμοί, ἐμοῦ, ἡμᾶς, ἡμεῖς, ἡμῖν, ἡμῶν, etc., 		ἐμοῦemou me, PPro-G1S
6 For though I would desire to glory, I will not be a fool; for I will say the truth: but now I forbear, lest any man should think of me above that which he sees me to be, or that he hears of me.2 Corinthians 12:6
Stats
Counts: 201 characters, 36 words, 148 letters, 57 vowels, 91 consonants
Translation
Greek: εαν γαρ θελησω καυχησασθαι ουκ εσομαι αφρων αληθειαν γαρ ερω φειδομαι δε μη τις εις εμε λογισηται υπερ ο βλεπει με η ακουει τι εξ εμου

Lit: If for I should desire to boast, not I will be a fool; the truth for I will be speaking. I refrain however, lest anyone to me should credit more than what he sees in me, or hears anyone of me,

KJV: For though I would desire to glory, I shall not be a fool; for I will say the truth: but now I forbear, lest any man should think of me above that which he seeth me [to be], or [that] he heareth of me.
References

"I would"
2Co 10:8: For though I should boast somewhat more of our authority: which the Lord has given us for edification: not and for your destruction: I not should be ashamed:
2Co 11:16: I say again: Let no man think me a fool; if otherwise: yet as a fool receive me: that I may boast myself a little.
1Co 3:5: 9: 10: Who then is Paul: and who is Apollos: but ministers by whom you believed: even as the Lord gave to every man?

"I will"
2Co 1:18: But as God is true: our word toward you not was yes and no.
2Co 11:31: The God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ: which is blessed for evermore: knows that I not lie.
Job 24:25: If it be not so now: who will make me a liar: and make my not speechhing worth?
Ro 9:1: I say the truth in Christ: I not lie: my conscience also bearing me witness in the Holy Ghost:

"above that"
2Co 12:7: lest'>lest I should be exalted above measure through the abundance of the revelations: there was given to me a thorn in the flesh: the messenger of Satan to buffet me: lest'>lest I should be exalted above measure.
2Co 10:9: 10: That I not may seem as if I would terrify you by letters.

G2443ἵναhina   (Conj)

G3361μὴmē   (Adv)
G3361 μή mḗ may a primary particle of qualified negation (whereas οὐ expresses an absolute denial); (adverb) not, (conjunction) lest; also (as an interrogative implying a negative answer (whereas οὐ expects an affirmative one)) whether:--any but (that), X forbear, + God forbid, + lack, lest, neither, never, no (X wise in), none, nor, (can-)not, nothing, that not, un(-taken), without. Often used in compounds in substantially the same relations. See also ἐὰν μή, ἵνα μή, οὐ μή, μῆκος, μηκύνω, μήν, μὴ οὐκ., 		μὴmē not Adv

7 lest'>lest I should be exalted above measure through the abundance of the revelations, there was given to me a thorn in the flesh, the messenger of Satan to buffet me, lest'>lest I should be exalted above measure.2 Corinthians 12:7
Stats
Rank: #1530 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 205 characters, 35 words, 164 letters, 68 vowels, 96 consonants
Translation
Greek: και τη υπερβολη των αποκαλυψεων ινα μη υπεραιρωμαι εδοθη μοι σκολοψ τη σαρκι αγγελος σαταν ινα με κολαφιζη ινα μη υπεραιρωμαι

Lit: and the surpassingness of the revelations. Therefore that not I should become conceited, was given to me a thorn in my flesh, a messenger of Satan, that me he might buffet, so that not I should become conceited.

KJV: And lest I should be exalted above measure through the abundance of the revelations, there was given to me a thorn in the flesh, the messenger of Satan to buffet me, lest I should be exalted above measure.
References

"lest"
2Co 10:5: Casting down imaginations: and every high thing that exalts itself against the knowledge of God: and bringing into captivity every thought to the obedience of Christ;
2Co 11:20: For you suffer: if a man bring you into bondage: if a man devour you: if a man take of you: if a man exalt himself: if a man smite you on the face.
De 8:14: Then your heart be lifted up: and you forget the LORD your God: which brought you forth out of the land of Egypt: from the house of bondage;
De 17:20: That his heart not be lifted up above his brothers: and that he not turn aside from the commandment: to the right hand: or to the left: to the end that he may prolong his days in his kingdom: he: and his children: in the middle of Israel.
2Ch 26:16: But when He was strong: His heart was lifted up to His destruction: for He transgressed against the LORD His God: and went into the temple of the LORD to burn incense upon the altar of incense.
2Ch 32:25: 26: 31: But Hezekiah not rendered again according to the benefit done to him; for his heart was lifted up: therefore there was wrath upon him: and upon Judah and Jerusalem.
Da 5:20: But when his heart was lifted up: and his mind hardened in pride: he was deposed from his kingly throne: and they took his glory from him:
1Ti 3:6: Not a novice: lest being lifted up with pride he fall into the condemnation of the devil.

"a thorn"
Ge 32:25: 31: When he saw that he not prevailed against him: he touched the hollow of his thigh; and the hollow of Jacob's thigh was out of joint: as he wrestled with him.
Jg 2:3: For what reason I also said: I not will drive them out from before you; but they will be as thorns in your sides: and their gods will be a snare to you.
Eze 28:24: There will be no more a pricking brier to the house of Israel: nor any grieving thorn of all that are round about them: that despised them; and they will know that I am the Lord GOD.
Ga 4:13: You know how through infirmity of the flesh I preached the gospel to you at the first.

"the messenger"
Job 2:7: So went Satan forth from the presence of the LORD: and smote Job with sore boils from the sole of His foot to His crown.
Lu 13:16: not ought this woman: being a daughter of Abraham: whom Satan has bound: indeed: these 18 years: be loosed from this bond on the sabbath day?
1Co 5:5: To deliver such an one to Satan for the destruction of the flesh: that the spirit may be saved in the day of the Lord Jesus.

"to buffet"
Mt 26:67: Then did they spit in his face: and buffeted him; and others smote him with the palms of their hands:
1Co 4:11: Even to this present hour we both hunger: and thirst: and are naked: and are buffeted: and have no certain dwellingplace;

G1909ἐπ’ep’   (Prep)
G1909 ἐπί epí ep-ee a primary preposition; properly, meaning superimposition (of time, place, order, etc.), as a relation of distribution (with the genitive case), i.e. over, upon, etc.; of rest (with the dative case) at, on, etc.; of direction (with the accusative case) towards, upon, etc.:--about (the times), above, after, against, among, as long as (touching), at, beside, X have charge of, (be-, (where-))fore, in (a place, as much as, the time of, -to), (because) of, (up-)on (behalf of), over, (by, for) the space of, through(-out), (un-)to(-ward), with. 9 He said to me, My grace is sufficient for you: for my strength is made perfect in weakness. Most gladly therefore will I rather glory in my infirmities, that the power of Christ may rest upon me.2 Corinthians 12:9
Stats
Rank: #517 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 202 characters, 34 words, 160 letters, 56 vowels, 104 consonants
Translation
Greek: και ειρηκεν μοι αρκει σοι η χαρις μου η γαρ δυναμις μου εν ασθενεια τελειουται ηδιστα ουν μαλλον καυχησομαι εν ταις ασθενειαις μου ινα επισκηνωση επ εμε η δυναμις του χριστου

Lit: And He said to me, Suffices you the grace of Me; the for power in weakness is perfected. Most gladly therefore rather will I boast in the weaknesses of me, so that may rest upon me the power of Christ.

KJV: And he said unto me, My grace is sufficient for thee: for my strength is made perfect in weakness. Most gladly therefore will I rather glory in my infirmities, that the power of Christ may rest upon me.
References

"My grace"
2Co 12:10: Therefore I take pleasure in infirmities: in reproaches: in necessities: in persecutions: in distresses for Christ's sake: for when I am weak: then am I strong.
2Co 3:5: 6: Not that we are sufficient of ourselves to think any thing as of ourselves; but our sufficiency is of God;
Ex 3:11: 12: Moses said to God: Who am I: that I should go to Pharaoh: and that I should bring forth the children of Israel out of Egypt?
Ex 4:10-15: Moses said to the LORD: O my Lord: I am not eloquent: neither heretofore: nor since you have spoken to your servant: but I am slow of speech: and of a slow tongue.
De 33:25-27: Your shoes will be iron and brass; and as your days: so will your strength be.
Jos 1:9: not Have I commanded you? Be strong and of a good courage; not be afraid: neither be you dismayed: for the LORD your God is with you wherever you go.
Isa 43:2: When you pass through the waters: I will be with you; and through the rivers: they will not overflow you: when you walk through the fire: you will not be burned; neither will the flame kindle upon you.
Jer 1:6-9: Then said I: Ah: Lord GOD! look: I cannot speak: for I am a child.
Mt 10:19: 20: But when they deliver you up: take no thought how or what you will speak: for it will be given you in that same hour what you will speak.
Lu 21:15: For I will give you a mouth and wisdom: which all your adversaries will not be able to gainsay nor resist.
1Co 10:13: There has no temptation taken you but such as is common to man: but God is faithful: who not will suffer you to be tempted above that you are able; but will with the temptation also make a way to escape: that you may be able to bear it.
1Co 15:10: But by the grace of God I am what I am: and His grace which was bestowed upon me not was in vain; but I laboured more abundantly than they all: not yet I: but the grace of God which was with me.
Col 1:28: 29: Whom we preach: warning every man: and teaching every man in all wisdom; that we may present every man perfect in Christ Jesus:
1Ti 1:14: The grace of our Lord was exceeding abundant with faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.
Heb 4:16: Let us therefore come boldly to the throne of grace: that we may obtain mercy: and find grace to help in time of need.

"for"
Ps 8:2: Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings have you ordained strength because of your enemies: that you might still the enemy and the avenger.
Isa 35:3: 4: Strengthen you the weak hands: and confirm the feeble knees.
Isa 40:29-31: He gives power to the faint; and to them that have no might he increases strength.
Isa 41:13-16: For I the LORD your God will hold your right hand: saying to you: not Fear; I will help you.
Da 10:16-19: And: look: one like the similitude of the sons of men touched my lips: then I opened my mouth: and spoke: and said to him that stood before me: O my lord: by the vision my sorrows are turned upon me: and I have retained no strength.
Eph 3:16: That He would grant you: according to the riches of His glory: to be strengthened with might by His Spirit in the inner man;
Php 4:13: I can do all things through Christ which strengthens me.
Col 1:11: Strengthened with all might: according to his glorious power: to all patience and longsuffering with joyfulness;
Heb 11:34: Quenched the violence of fire: escaped the edge of the sword: out of weakness were made strong: waxed valiant in fight: turned to flight the armies of the aliens.

"Most"
2Co 12:10: 15: Therefore I take pleasure in infirmities: in reproaches: in necessities: in persecutions: in distresses for Christ's sake: for when I am weak: then am I strong.
Mt 5:11: 12: Blessed are you: when men will revile you: and persecute you: and will say all manner of evil against you falsely: for my sake.

"glory"
2Co 12:5: Of such an one will I glory: yet of myself I not will glory: but in my infirmities.
2Co 11:30: If I must needs glory: I will glory of the things which concern my infirmities.

"the power"
2Ki 2:15: When the sons of the prophets which were to view at Jericho saw him: they said: The spirit of Elijah does rest on Elisha. And they came to meet him: and bowed themselves to the ground before him.
Isa 4:5: 6: The LORD will create upon every dwelling place of mount Zion: and upon her assemblies: a cloud and smoke by day: and the shining of a flaming fire by night: for upon all the glory will be a defence.
Isa 11:2: The spirit of the LORD will rest upon Him: the spirit of wisdom and understanding: the spirit of counsel and might: the spirit of knowledge and of the fear of the LORD;
Zep 3:17: The LORD your God in the middle of you is mighty; He will save: He will rejoice over you with joy; He will rest in His love: He will joy over you with singing.
Mt 28:18: 20: Jesus came and spoke to them: saying: All power is given to me in heaven and in earth.
1Pe 4:13: 14: But rejoice: inasmuch as you are partakers of Christ's sufferings; that: when His glory will be revealed: you may be glad also with exceeding joy.

10 Therefore I take pleasure in infirmities, in reproaches, in necessities, in persecutions, in distresses for Christ's sake: for when I am weak, then am I strong.2 Corinthians 12:10
Stats
Counts: 160 characters, 20 words, 127 letters, 52 vowels, 75 consonants
Translation
Greek: διο ευδοκω εν ασθενειαις εν υβρεσιν εν αναγκαις εν διωγμοις εν στενοχωριαις υπερ χριστου οταν γαρ ασθενω τοτε δυνατος ειμι

Lit: Therefore I take pleasure in weaknesses, in insults, in hardships, in persecutions, and difficulties for Christ; when for I might be weak, then strong I am.

KJV: Therefore I take pleasure in infirmities, in reproaches, in necessities, in persecutions, in distresses for Christ's sake: for when I am weak, then am I strong.
References

"I take"
2Co 1:4: Who comforts us in all our tribulation: that we may be able to comfort them which are in any trouble: by the comfort wherewith we ourselves are comforted of God.
2Co 4:8-10: 17: We are troubled on every side: not yet distressed; we are perplexed: not but in despair;
2Co 7:4: Great is my boldness of speech toward you: great is my glorying of you: I am filled with comfort: I am exceeding joyful in all our tribulation.
Ac 5:41: They departed from the presence of the council: rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer shame for his name.
Ro 5:3: not And only so: but we glory in tribulations also: knowing that tribulation works patience;
Ro 8:35-39: Who will separate us from the love of Christ? will tribulation: or distress: or persecution: or famine: or nakedness: or peril: or sword?
Php 1:29: For to you it is given in the behalf of Christ: not only to believe on Him: but also to suffer for His sake;
Php 2:17: 18: Yes: and if I be offered upon the sacrifice and service of your faith: I joy: and rejoice with you all.
Col 1:24: Who now rejoice in my sufferings for you: and fill up that which is behind of the afflictions of Christ in my flesh for His body's sake: which is the church:
Jas 1:2: My brothers: count it all joy when you fall into divers temptations;
1Pe 1:6: 7: Wherein you greatly rejoice: though now for a season: if need be: you are in heaviness through manifold temptations:
1Pe 4:13: 14: But rejoice: inasmuch as you are partakers of Christ's sufferings; that: when His glory will be revealed: you may be glad also with exceeding joy.

"in infirmities"
2Co 11:23-30: Are they ministers of Christ? (I speak as a fool) I am more; in labours more abundant: in stripes above measure: in prisons more frequent: in deaths often.

"for Christ's"
2Co 4:5: 11: For we not preach ourselves: but Christ Jesus the Lord; and ourselves your servants for Jesus' sake.
2Co 10:18: not For He that'>He who commends'>commends Himself is approved: but whom the Lord commends'>commends.
Lu 6:22: Blessed are you: when men will hate you: and when they will separate you from their company: and will reproach you: and cast out your name as evil: for the Son of man's sake.
Joh 15:21: But all these things will they do to you for my name's sake: because they not know him that sent me.
1Co 4:10: We are fools for Christ's sake: but you are wise in Christ; we are weak: but you are strong; you are honourable: but we are despised.
Re 2:3: have borne: and have patience: and for my name's sake have laboured: and have not fainted.

"for when"
2Co 12:9: He said to me: My grace is sufficient for you: for my strength is made perfect in weakness. Most gladly therefore will I rather glory in my infirmities: that the power of Christ may rest upon me.
2Co 13:4: 9: For though He was crucified through weakness: yet He lives by the power of God. For we also are weak in Him: but we will live with Him by the power of God toward you.
Eph 6:10: Finally: my brothers: be strong in the Lord: and in the power of His might.

Concern for the Corinthians

G1096ΓέγοναGegona   (V-RIA-1S)
G1096 γίνομαι gínomai ghin-om-ahee a prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be (gen-erate), i.e. (reflexively) to become (come into being), used with great latitude (literal, figurative, intensive, etc.):--arise, be assembled, be(-come, -fall, -have self), be brought (to pass), (be) come (to pass), continue, be divided, draw, be ended, fall, be finished, follow, be found, be fulfilled, + God forbid, grow, happen, have, be kept, be made, be married, be ordained to be, partake, pass, be performed, be published, require, seem, be showed, X soon as it was, sound, be taken, be turned, use, wax, will, would, be wrought. 		ΓέγοναGegona I have become V-RIA-1S

11 I am become a fool in glorying; you have compelled me: for I ought to have been commended of you: for not inhing am I behind the very chief apostles, though I not behing.2 Corinthians 12:11
Stats
Counts: 172 characters, 30 words, 134 letters, 55 vowels, 79 consonants
Translation
Greek: γεγονα αφρων καυχωμενος υμεις με ηναγκασατε εγω γαρ ωφειλον υφ υμων συνιστασθαι ουδεν γαρ υστερησα των υπερ λιαν αποστολων ει και ουδεν ειμι

Lit: I have become a fool; you me compelled. I for ought by you to have been commended. In no way for was I inferior to those most eminent apostles, though even nothing I am.

KJV: I am become a fool in glorying; ye have compelled me: for I ought to have been commended of you: for in nothing am I behind the very chiefest apostles, though I be nothing.
References

"become"
2Co 1:6: Whether we be afflicted: it is for your consolation and salvation: which is effectual in the enduring of the same sufferings which we also suffer: or whether we be comforted: it is for your consolation and salvation.
2Co 11:1: 16: 17: Would to God you could bear with me a little in my folly: and indeed bear with me.

"for in"
2Co 12:12: Truly the signs of an apostle were wrought among you in all patience: in signs: and wonders: and mighty deeds.
2Co 11:5: For I suppose I not was a whit behind the very chief apostles.
1Co 3:4-7: 22: For while one says: I am of Paul; and another: I am of Apollos; are you not carnal?
Ga 2:6-14: But of these who seemed to be somewhat: (whatever they were: it makes no matter to me: God accepts no man's person:) for they who seemed to be somewhat in conference not addedhing to me:

"though"
Lu 17:10: So likewise you: when you will have done all those things which are commanded you: say: We are unprofitable servants: we have done that which was our duty to do.
1Co 3:7: So then neither is He that'>He who plants any thing: neither He that'>He who waters; but God that gives the increase.
1Co 15:8-10: Last of all he was seen of me also: as of one born out of due time.
Eph 3:8: To me: who am less than the least of all saints: is this grace given: that I should preach among the Gentiles the unsearchable riches of Christ;

12 Truly the signs of an apostle were wrought among you in all patience, in signs, and wonders, and mighty deeds.2 Corinthians 12:12
Stats
Counts: 110 characters, 17 words, 87 letters, 31 vowels, 56 consonants
Translation
Greek: τα μεν σημεια του αποστολου κατειργασθη εν υμιν εν παση υπομονη εν σημειοις και τερασιν και δυναμεσιν

Lit: The indeed signs of the apostle were performed among you in all perseverance, in signs both, and wonders, and miracles.

KJV: Truly the signs of an apostle were wrought among you in all patience, in signs, and wonders, and mighty deeds.

1Co 9:2: If I not be an apostle to others: yet doubtless I am to you: for the seal of my apostleship are you in the Lord.
1Co 14:18: I thank my God: I speak with tongues more than you all:

13 For what is it wherein you were inferior to other churches, except it be that I myself not was burdensome to you? forgive me this wrong.2 Corinthians 12:13
Stats
Rank: #2643 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 135 characters, 24 words, 107 letters, 41 vowels, 66 consonants
Translation
Greek: τι γαρ εστιν ο ηττηθητε υπερ τας λοιπας εκκλησιας ει μη οτι αυτος εγω ου κατεναρκησα υμων χαρισασθε μοι την αδικιαν ταυτην

Lit: In what for is it that you were inferior beyond the rest of the churches, if not that myself I not did burden you? Forgive me the wrong this!

KJV: For what is it wherein ye were inferior to other churches, except it be that I myself was not burdensome to you? forgive me this wrong.
References

"I myself"
2Co 12:14: Look: the third time I am ready to come to you; and I not will be burdensome to you: for I not seek yours: but you: for the children not ought to lay up for the parents: but the parents for the children.
2Co 11:8: 9: I robbed other churches: taking wages of them: to do you service.
1Co 9:6: 12: 15-18: Or I only and Barnabas: not have we power to forbear working?

"forgive"
2Co 11:7: Have I committed an offence in abasing myself that you might be exalted: because I have preached to you the gospel of God freely?

G4314πρὸςpros   (Prep)
G4314 πρός prós pros a strengthened form of πρό; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. toward (with the genitive case, the side of, i.e. pertaining to; with the dative case, by the side of, i.e. near to; usually with the accusative case, the place, time, occasion, or respect, which is the destination of the relation, i.e. whither or for which it is predicated):--about, according to , against, among, at, because of, before, between, (where-)by, for, X at thy house, in, for intent, nigh unto, of, which pertain to, that, to (the end that), X together, to (you) -ward, unto, with(-in). In the comparative case, it denotes essentially the same applications, namely, motion towards, accession to, or nearness at. 		πρὸςpros to Prep

14 Look, the third time I am ready to come to you; and I not will be burdensome to you: for I not seek yours, but you: for the children not ought to lay up for the parents, but the parents for the children.2 Corinthians 12:14
Stats
Rank: #3410 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 205 characters, 37 words, 156 letters, 60 vowels, 96 consonants
Translation
Greek: ιδου τριτον ετοιμως εχω ελθειν προς υμας και ου καταναρκησω υμων ου γαρ ζητω τα υμων αλλ υμας ου γαρ οφειλει τα τεκνα τοις γονευσιν θησαυριζειν αλλ οι γονεις τοις τεκνοις

Lit: Behold, third time this, ready I am to come to you, and not I will burden you; not for I seek what is yours, but you. Not for ought the children for the parents to treasure up, but the parents for the children.

KJV: Behold, the third time I am ready to come to you; and I will not be burdensome to you: for I seek not yours, but you: for the children ought not to lay up for the parents, but the parents for the children.
References

"the third"
2Co 1:15: In this confidence I was minded to come to you before: that you might have a second benefit;
2Co 13:1: This is the third time I am coming to you. In the mouth of two or 3 witnesses will every word be established.
1Co 4:19: But I will come to you shortly: if the Lord will: and will know: not the speech of them which are puffed up: but the power.
1Co 11:34: If any man hunger: let him eat at home; that you not come together to condemnation. And the rest will I set in order when I come.
1Co 16:5: Now I will come to you: when I will pass through Macedonia: for I do pass through Macedonia.

"for I"
Pr 11:30: The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life; and he who wins souls is wise.
Ac 20:33: I have coveted no man's silver: or gold: or apparel.
1Co 10:33: Even as I please all men in all things: not seeking my own profit: but the profit of many: that they may be saved.
Php 4:1: 17: Therefore: my brothers dearly beloved and longed for: my joy and crown: so stand fast in the Lord: my dearly beloved.
1Th 2:5: 6: 8: 19: 20: For neither at any time used we flattering words: as you know: nor a cloke of covetousness; God is witness:
1Pe 5:2-4: Feed the flock of God which is among you: taking the oversight thereof: not by constraint: but willingly; not for filthy lucre: but of a ready mind;

"for the"
Ge 24:35: 36: The LORD has blessed my master greatly; and He is become great: and He has given Him flocks: and herds: and silver: and gold: and menservants: and maidservants: and camels: and asses.
Ge 31:14: 15: Rachel and Leah answered and said to him: Is there yet any portion or inheritance for us in our father's house?
Pr 13:22: A good man leaves an inheritance to his children's children: and the wealth of the sinner is laid up for the just.
Pr 19:14: House and riches are the inheritance of fathers: and a prudent wife is from the LORD.
1Co 4:14: 15: I not write these things to shame you: but as my beloved sons I warn you.
1Th 2:11: As you know how we exhorted and comforted and charged every one of you: as a father does his children:

G5590ψυχῶνpsychōn   (N-GFP)
G5590 ψυχή psychḗ psoo-khay from ψύχω; breath, i.e. (by implication) spirit, abstractly or concretely (the animal sentient principle only; thus distinguished on the one hand from πνεῦμα, which is the rational and immortal soul; and on the other from ζωή, which is mere vitality, even of plants: these terms thus exactly correspond respectively to the Hebrew נֶפֶשׁ, רוּחַ and חַי):--heart (+ -ily), life, mind, soul, + us, + you. 		ψυχῶνpsychōn souls N-GFP

15 I will very gladly spend and be spent for you; though the more abundantly I love you, the less I be loved.2 Corinthians 12:15
Stats
Rank: #5292 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 110 characters, 21 words, 85 letters, 31 vowels, 54 consonants
Translation
Greek: εγω δε ηδιστα δαπανησω και εκδαπανηθησομαι υπερ των ψυχων υμων ει και περισσοτερως υμας αγαπων ηττον αγαπωμαι

Lit: I now most gladly will spend, and will be utterly spent, for the souls of you. If more abundantly you loving, less I am loved?

KJV: And I will very gladly spend and be spent for you; though the more abundantly I love you, the less I be loved.
References

"will"
2Co 12:9: He said to me: My grace is sufficient for you: for my strength is made perfect in weakness. Most gladly therefore will I rather glory in my infirmities: that the power of Christ may rest upon me.
2Co 1:6: 14: Whether we be afflicted: it is for your consolation and salvation: which is effectual in the enduring of the same sufferings which we also suffer: or whether we be comforted: it is for your consolation and salvation.
2Co 2:3: I wrote this same to you: lest: when I came: I should have sorrow from them of whom I ought to rejoice; having confidence in you all: that my joy is the joy of you all.
2Co 7:3: I not speak this to condemn you: for I have said before: that you are in our hearts to die and live with you.
Joh 10:10: 11: The thief comes not: but for to steal: and to kill: and to destroy: I am come that they might have life: and that they might have it more abundantly.
Ga 4:10: You observe days: and months: and times: and years.
Php 2:17: Yes: and if I be offered upon the sacrifice and service of your faith: I joy: and rejoice with you all.
Col 1:24: Who now rejoice in my sufferings for you: and fill up that which is behind of the afflictions of Christ in my flesh for His body's sake: which is the church:
1Th 2:8: So being affectionately desirous of you: we were willing to have imparted to you: not the gospel of God only: but also our own souls: because you were dear to us.
2Ti 2:10: Therefore I endure all things for the elect's sakes: that they may also obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory.

"you"
2Co 12:14: Look: the third time I am ready to come to you; and I not will be burdensome to you: for I not seek yours: but you: for the children not ought to lay up for the parents: but the parents for the children.
Heb 13:17: Obey them that have the rule over you: and submit yourselves: for they watch for your souls: as they that must give account: that they may do it with joy: not and with grief: for that is unprofitable for you.

"though"
2Co 6:12: 13: You not are straitened in us: but you are straitened in your own bowels.
2Sa 13:39: the soul of king David longed to go forth to Absalom: for he was comforted concerning Amnon: seeing he was dead.
2Sa 17:1-4: Moreover Ahithophel said to Absalom: Let me now choose out 12000 men: and I will arise and pursue after David this night:
2Sa 18:33: The king was much moved: and went up to the chamber over the gate: and wept: and as He went: thus He said: O my son Absalom: my son: my son Absalom! would God I had died for you: O Absalom: my son: my son!
1Co 4:8-18: Now you are full: now you are rich: you have reigned as kings without us: and I would to God you did reign: that we also might reign with you.

G2983 λαμβάνω lambánō lam-ban-o a prolonged form of a primary verb, which is use only as an alternate in certain tenses; to take (in very many applications, literally and figuratively (properly objective or active, to get hold of; whereas δέχομαι is rather subjective or passive, to have offered to one; while αἱρέομαι is more violent, to seize or remove)):--accept, + be amazed, assay, attain, bring, X when I call, catch, come on (X unto), + forget, have, hold, obtain, receive (X after), take (away, up). 		ἔλαβον.elabon I caught. 16 But be it so, I not did burden you: nevertheless, being crafty, I caught you with guile.2 Corinthians 12:16
Stats
Rank: #5341 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 88 characters, 13 words, 67 letters, 27 vowels, 40 consonants
Translation
Greek: εστω δε εγω ου κατεβαρησα υμας αλλ υπαρχων πανουργος δολω υμας ελαβον

Lit: Be it so however, I not did burden you; but being crafty, by trickery you I caught.

KJV: But be it so, I did not burden you: nevertheless, being crafty, I caught you with guile.
References

"I did not"
2Co 12:13: For what is it wherein you were inferior to other churches: except it be that I myself not was burdensome to you? forgive me this wrong.
2Co 11:9: 10: When I was present with you: and wanted: I was chargeable to no man: for that which was lacking to me the brothers which came from Macedonia supplied: and in all things I have kept myself from being burdensome to you: and so will I keep myself.

"being"
2Co 1:12: For our rejoicing is this: the testimony of our conscience: that in simplicity and godly sincerity: not with fleshly wisdom: but by the grace of God: we have had our conversation in the world: and more abundantly to you-ward.
2Co 4:2: But have renounced the hidden things of dishonesty: not walking in craftiness: nor handling the word of God deceitfully; but by manifestation of the truth commending ourselves to every man's conscience in the sight of God.
2Co 7:2: Receive us; we have wronged no man: we have corrupted no man: we have defrauded no man.
2Co 10:2: 3: But I beseech you: that I not may be bold when I am present with that confidence: wherewith I think to be bold against some: which think of us as if we walked according to the flesh.
1Th 2:3: 5: For our exhortation was not of deceit: nor of uncleanness: nor in guile:
1Pe 2:3: If so be you have tasted that the Lord is gracious.

G3361μήmē   (Adv)
G3361 μή mḗ may a primary particle of qualified negation (whereas οὐ expresses an absolute denial); (adverb) not, (conjunction) lest; also (as an interrogative implying a negative answer (whereas οὐ expects an affirmative one)) whether:--any but (that), X forbear, + God forbid, + lack, lest, neither, never, no (X wise in), none, nor, (can-)not, nothing, that not, un(-taken), without. G4314πρὸςpros   (Prep)
G4314 πρός prós pros a strengthened form of πρό; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. toward (with the genitive case, the side of, i.e. pertaining to; with the dative case, by the side of, i.e. near to; usually with the accusative case, the place, time, occasion, or respect, which is the destination of the relation, i.e. whither or for which it is predicated):--about, according to , against, among, at, because of, before, between, (where-)by, for, X at thy house, in, for intent, nigh unto, of, which pertain to, that, to (the end that), X together, to (you) -ward, unto, with(-in). In the comparative case, it denotes essentially the same applications, namely, motion towards, accession to, or nearness at. 		πρὸςpros to Prep

In composition it retains the same general importance. 		δι’di’ by Prep

18 I desired Titus, and with him I sent a brother. Did Titus make a gain of you? walked not we in the same spirit? walked we not in the same steps?2 Corinthians 12:18
Stats
Rank: #5888 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 146 characters, 26 words, 109 letters, 44 vowels, 65 consonants
Translation
Greek: παρεκαλεσα τιτον και συναπεστειλα τον αδελφον μη τι επλεονεκτησεν υμας τιτος ου τω αυτω πνευματι περιεπατησαμεν ου τοις αυτοις ιχνεσιν

Lit: I urged Titus to go, and sent with him the brother. Not did exploit you Titus? Not in the same spirit did we walk? Not in the same steps?

KJV: I desired Titus, and with him I sent a brother. Did Titus make a gain of you? walked we not in the same spirit? [walked we] not in the same steps?

"Titus"

2Co 7:2: 6: Receive us; we have wronged no man: we have corrupted no man: we have defrauded no man.

"with"
2Co 8:6: 18: Insomuch that we desired Titus: that as he had begun: so he would also finish in you the same grace also.

"walked we not in the same spirit"
2Co 8:6: 16-23: Insomuch that we desired Titus: that as he had begun: so he would also finish in you the same grace also.
Php 2:19-22: But I trust in the Lord Jesus to send Timotheus shortly to you: that I also may be of good comfort: when I know your state.

"in the same steps"
Nu 16:15: Moses was very angry: and said to the LORD: not Respect you their offering: I not have taken one ass from them: neither have I hurt one of them.
1Sa 12:3: 4: Look: here I am: witness against me before the LORD: and before His anointed: whose ox have I taken? or whose ass have I taken? or whom have I defrauded? whom have I oppressed? or of whose hand have I received any bribe to blind my eyes therewith? and I will restore it you.
Ne 5:14: Moreover from the time that I was appointed to be their governor in the land of Judah: from the twentieth year even to the two and thirtieth year of Artaxerxes the king: that is: 12 years: I and my brothers not have eaten the bread of the governor.

1Pe 2:21: For even hereunto were you called: because Christ also suffered for us: leaving us an example: that you should follow His steps:

G3619οἰκοδομῆς.oikodomēs   (N-GFS)
G3619 οἰκοδομή oikodomḗ oy-kod-om-ay feminine (abstract) of a compound of οἶκος and the base of δῶμα; architecture, i.e. (concretely) a structure; figuratively, confirmation:--building, edify(-ication, -ing). 		οἰκοδομῆς.oikodomēs edification. N-GFS
19 Again, think you that we excuse ourselves to you? we speak before God in Christ: but we do all things, dearly beloved, for your edifying.2 Corinthians 12:19
Stats
Rank: #5654 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 138 characters, 20 words, 108 letters, 43 vowels, 65 consonants
Translation
Greek: παλιν δοκειτε οτι υμιν απολογουμεθα κατενωπιον του θεου εν χριστω λαλουμεν τα δε παντα αγαπητοι υπερ της υμων οικοδομης

Lit: All along have you been thinking that to you we have been making a defense? Before God in Christ we speak, but all things, beloved, for your edification.

KJV: Again, think ye that we excuse ourselves unto you? we speak before God in Christ: but we do all things, dearly beloved, for your edifying.
References

"think"
2Co 3:1: Do we begin again to commend ourselves? or need we: as some others: epistles of commendation to you: or letters of commendation from you?
2Co 5:12: For we not commend ourselves again to you: but give you occasion to glory on our behalf: that you may have somewhat to answer them which glory in appearance: not and in heart.

"we speak"
2Co 11:10: 31: As the truth of Christ is in me: no man will stop me of this boasting in the regions of Achaia.
Ro 9:1: I say the truth in Christ: I not lie: my conscience also bearing me witness in the Holy Ghost:

"but"
2Co 5:13: For whether we be beside ourselves: it is to God: or whether we be sober: it is for your cause.
2Co 10:8: For though I should boast somewhat more of our authority: which the Lord has given us for edification: not and for your destruction: I not should be ashamed:
2Co 13:10: Therefore I write these things being absent: lest being present I should use sharpness: according to the power which the Lord has given me to edification: not and to destruction.
1Co 9:12-23: If others be partakers of this power over you: are not we rather? Nevertheless we not have used this power; but suffer all things: lest we should hinder the gospel of Christ.
1Co 10:33: Even as I please all men in all things: not seeking my own profit: but the profit of many: that they may be saved.
1Co 14:26: How is it then: brothers? when you come together: every one of you has a psalm: has a doctrine: has a tongue: has a revelation: has an interpretation. Let all things be done to edifying.

"dearly"
2Co 12:15: I will very gladly spend and be spent for you; though the more abundantly I love you: the less I be loved.
2Co 7:1: Having therefore these promises: dearly beloved: let us cleanse ourselves from all filthiness of the flesh and spirit: perfecting holiness in the fear of God.
Ro 12:19: Dearly beloved: not avenge yourselves: but rather give place to wrath: for it is written: Vengeance is my; I will repay: says the Lord.
1Co 10:14: For what reason: my dearly beloved: flee from idolatry.
Php 4:1: Therefore: my brothers dearly beloved and longed for: my joy and crown: so stand fast in the Lord: my dearly beloved.

 φοβουμαι γαρ μηπως ελθων ουχ οιους θελω ευρω υμας καγω ευρεθω υμιν οιον ου θελετε μηπως ερεις ζηλοι θυμοι εριθειαι καταλαλιαι ψιθυρισμοι φυσιωσεις ακαταστασιαι

G1063γὰρgar   (Conj)
G1063 γάρ gár gar a primary particle; properly, assigning a reason (used in argument, explanation or intensification; often with other particles):--and, as, because (that), but, even, for, indeed, no doubt, seeing, then, therefore, verily, what, why, yet. 		γὰρgar for Conj
G3361μήmē   (Adv)
G3361 μή mḗ may a primary particle of qualified negation (whereas οὐ expresses an absolute denial); (adverb) not, (conjunction) lest; also (as an interrogative implying a negative answer (whereas οὐ expects an affirmative one)) whether:--any but (that), X forbear, + God forbid, + lack, lest, neither, never, no (X wise in), none, nor, (can-)not, nothing, that not, un(-taken), without. Often used in compounds in substantially the same relations. See also ἐὰν μή, ἵνα μή, οὐ μή, μῆκος, μηκύνω, μήν, μὴ οὐκ., 		μήmē lest Adv

G2309θέλωthelō   (V-PIA-1S)
G2309 θέλω thélō eth-el-eh-o apparently strengthened from the alternate form of αἱρέομαι; to determine (as an active option from subjective impulse; whereas βούλομαι properly denotes rather a passive acquiescence in objective considerations), i.e. choose or prefer (literally or figuratively); by implication, to wish, i.e. be inclined to (sometimes adverbially, gladly); impersonally for the future tense, to be about to; by Hebraism, to delight in:--desire, be disposed (forward), intend, list, love, mean, please, have rather, (be) will (have, -ling, - ling(-ly)). 		θέλωthelō I wish V-PIA-1S

20 For I fear, lest'>lest, when I come, I will not find you such as I would, and that I will be found to you such as you not would: lest'>lest there be debates, envyings, wraths, strifes, backbitings, whisperings, swellings, tumults:2 Corinthians 12:20
Stats
Rank: #6080 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 223 characters, 26 words, 169 letters, 59 vowels, 110 consonants
Translation
Greek: φοβουμαι γαρ μηπως ελθων ουχ οιους θελω ευρω υμας καγω ευρεθω υμιν οιον ου θελετε μηπως ερεις ζηλοι θυμοι εριθειαι καταλαλιαι ψιθυρισμοι φυσιωσεις ακαταστασιαι

Lit: I fear for lest perhaps, having come, not such as I wish I may find you, and I might be found by you such as not you do wish; lest perhaps quarreling, jealousy, anger, contentions, slander, gossip, conceit, disorder;

KJV: For I fear, lest, when I come, I shall not find you such as I would, and that I shall be found unto you such as ye would not: lest [there be] debates, envyings, wraths, strifes, backbitings, whisperings, swellings, tumults:
References

"I shall not"
2Co 12:21: And lest: when I come again: my God will humble me among you: and that I will bewail many which have sinned already: and not have repented of the uncleanness and fornication and lasciviousness which they have committed.
2Co 13:9: For we are glad: when we are weak: and you are strong: and this also we wish: even your perfection.

"and that"
2Co 1:23: 24: Moreover I call God for a record upon my soul: that to spare you I not came as yet to Corinth.
2Co 2:1-3: But I determined this with myself: that I not would come again to you in heaviness.
2Co 10:2: 6: 8: 9: But I beseech you: that I not may be bold when I am present with that confidence: wherewith I think to be bold against some: which think of us as if we walked according to the flesh.
2Co 13:2: 10: I told you before: and foretell you: as if I were present: the second time; and being absent now I write to them which heretofore have sinned: and to all other: that: if I come again: I not will spare:
1Co 4:18-21: Now some are puffed up: as though I not would come to you.
1Co 5:3-5: For I truly: as absent in body: but present in spirit: have judged already: as though I were present: concerning him that has so done this deed:

"debates"
1Co 1:11: For it has been declared to me of you: my brothers: by them which are of the house of Chloe: that there are contentions among you.
1Co 3:3: 4: For you are yet carnal: for whereas there is among you envying: and strife: and divisions: are you not carnal: and walk as men?
1Co 4:6-8: 18: These things: brothers: I have in a figure transferred to myself and to Apollos for your sakes; that you might learn in not us to think of men above that which is written: that no one of you be puffed up for one against another.
1Co 6:7: 8: Now therefore there is utterly a fault among you: because you go to law one with another. Why do you not rather take wrong? why do you not rather suffer yourselves to be defrauded?
1Co 11:16-19: But if any man seem to be contentious: we have no such custom: neither the churches of God.
1Co 14:36: 37: What? came the word of God out from you? or came it to you only?
Ga 5:15: 19-21: But if you bite and devour one another: take heed that you not be consumed one of another.
Ga 5:26: Let not us be desirous of vain glory: provoking one another: envying one another.
Eph 4:31: 32: Let all bitterness: and wrath: and anger: and clamour: and evil speaking: be put away from you: with all malice:
Jas 3:14-16: But if you have bitter envying and strife in your hearts: not glory: and not lie against the truth.
Jas 4:1-5: From where come wars and fightings among you? come they not here: even of your lusts that war in your members?
1Pe 2:1: For what reason laying aside all malice: and all guile: and hypocrisies: and envies: and all evil speakings:

"whisperings"
Ps 41:7: All that hate me whisper together against me: against me do they devise my hurt.
Pr 16:28: A froward man sows strife: and a whisperer separates chief friends.
Ro 1:29: Being filled with all unrighteousness: fornication: wickedness: covetousness: maliciousness; full of envy: murder: debate: deceit: malignity; whisperers:

"swellings"
2Pe 2:18: For when they speak great swelling words of vanity: they allure through the lusts of the flesh: through much wantonness: those that were clean escaped from them who live in error.
Jude 1:16: These are murmurers: complainers: walking after their own lusts; and their mouth speaks great swelling words: having men's persons in admiration because of advantage.

G4314πρὸςpros   (Prep)
G4314 πρός prós pros a strengthened form of πρό; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. toward (with the genitive case, the side of, i.e. pertaining to; with the dative case, by the side of, i.e. near to; usually with the accusative case, the place, time, occasion, or respect, which is the destination of the relation, i.e. whither or for which it is predicated):--about, according to , against, among, at, because of, before, between, (where-)by, for, X at thy house, in, for intent, nigh unto, of, which pertain to, that, to (the end that), X together, to (you) -ward, unto, with(-in). In the comparative case, it denotes essentially the same applications, namely, motion towards, accession to, or nearness at. 		πρὸςpros as to Prep

G1909ἐπὶepi   (Prep)
G1909 ἐπί epí ep-ee a primary preposition; properly, meaning superimposition (of time, place, order, etc.), as a relation of distribution (with the genitive case), i.e. over, upon, etc.; of rest (with the dative case) at, on, etc.; of direction (with the accusative case) towards, upon, etc.:--about (the times), above, after, against, among, as long as (touching), at, beside, X have charge of, (be-, (where-))fore, in (a place, as much as, the time of, -to), (because) of, (up-)on (behalf of), over, (by, for) the space of, through(-out), (un-)to(-ward), with. 21 And lest, when I come again, my God will humble me among you, and that I will bewail many which have sinned already, and not have repented of the uncleanness and fornication and lasciviousness which they have committed.2 Corinthians 12:21
Stats
Rank: #6194 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 222 characters, 32 words, 178 letters, 67 vowels, 111 consonants
Translation
Greek: μη παλιν ελθοντα με ταπεινωση ο θεος μου προς υμας και πενθησω πολλους των προημαρτηκοτων και μη μετανοησαντων επι τη ακαθαρσια και πορνεια και ασελγεια η επραξαν

Lit: lest again having come of me, should humble me the God of me as to you, and I should mourn over many of those having before sinned and not having repented of the impurity and sexual immorality and sensuality that they have practiced.

KJV: And lest, when I come again, my God will humble me among you, and [that] I shall bewail many which have sinned already, and have not repented of the uncleanness and fornication and lasciviousness which they have committed.

G4314πρὸςpros   (Prep)
G4314 πρός prós pros a strengthened form of πρό; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. toward (with the genitive case, the side of, i.e. pertaining to; with the dative case, by the side of, i.e. near to; usually with the accusative case, the place, time, occasion, or respect, which is the destination of the relation, i.e. whither or for which it is predicated):--about, according to , against, among, at, because of, before, between, (where-)by, for, X at thy house, in, for intent, nigh unto, of, which pertain to, that, to (the end that), X together, to (you) -ward, unto, with(-in). 1 This is the third time I am coming to you. In the mouth of two or 3 witnesses will every word be established.2 Corinthians 13:1
Stats
Counts: 116 characters, 20 words, 90 letters, 34 vowels, 56 consonants
Translation
Greek: τριτον τουτο ερχομαι προς υμας επι στοματος δυο μαρτυρων και τριων σταθησεται παν ρημα

Lit: Third this time I am coming to you. In the mouth of two witnesses or three, will be established every matter.”

KJV: This is the third [time] I am coming to you. In the mouth of two or three witnesses shall every word be established.
References

"the third"
2Co 12:14: Look: the third time I am ready to come to you; and I not will be burdensome to you: for I not seek yours: but you: for the children not ought to lay up for the parents: but the parents for the children.

"In"
Nu 35:30: Whoever kills any person: the murderer will be put to death by the mouth of witnesses: but one witness will not testify against any person to cause him to die.
De 17:6: At the mouth of two witnesses: or 3 witnesses: will he who is worthy of death be put to death; but at the mouth of one witness he will not be put to death.
De 19:15: one witness will not rise up against a man for any iniquity: or for any sin: in any sin that he sins: at the mouth of two witnesses: or at the mouth of 3 witnesses: will the matter be established.
1Ki 21:10: 13: Set two men: sons of Belial: before Him: to bear witness against Him: saying: You did blaspheme God and the king. And then carry Him out: and stone Him: that He may die.
Mt 18:16: But if he not will hear you: then take with you one or two more: that in the mouth of two or 3 witnesses every word may be established.
Mt 26:60: 61: But found none: yes: though many false witnesses came: yet found they none. At the last came two false witnesses:
Joh 8:17: 18: It is also written in your law: that the testimony of two men is true.
Heb 10:28: 29: He who despised Moses' law died without mercy under two or 3 witnesses:

2 I told you before, and foretell you, as if I were present, the second time; and being absent now I write to them which heretofore have sinned, and to all other, that, if I come again, I not will spare:2 Corinthians 13:2

Counts: 201 characters, 32 words, 153 letters, 64 vowels, 89 consonants
Translation
Greek: προειρηκα και προλεγω ως παρων το δευτερον και απων νυν γραφω τοις προημαρτηκοσιν και τοις λοιποις πασιν οτι εαν ελθω εις το παλιν ου φεισομαι

Lit: I have warned and I warn, as being present the second time, and being absent now those having sinned before, and the rest all, that if I come to the same again, not I will spare anyone,

KJV: I told you before, and foretell you, as if I were present, the second time; and being absent now I write to them which heretofore have sinned, and to all other, that, if I come again, I will not spare:
References

"told"
2Co 1:23: Moreover I call God for a record upon my soul: that to spare you I not came as yet to Corinth.
2Co 10:1: 2: 8-11: Now I Paul myself beseech you by the meekness and gentleness of Christ: who in presence am base among you: but being absent am bold toward you:
2Co 12:20: For I fear: lest'>lest: when I come: I will not find you such as I would: and that I will be found to you such as you not would: lest'>lest there be debates: envyings: wraths: strifes: backbitings: whisperings: swellings: tumults:
1Co 4:19-21: But I will come to you shortly: if the Lord will: and will know: not the speech of them which are puffed up: but the power.
1Co 5:5: To deliver such an one to Satan for the destruction of the flesh: that the spirit may be saved in the day of the Lord Jesus.

"heretofore"
2Co 12:21: And lest: when I come again: my God will humble me among you: and that I will bewail many which have sinned already: and not have repented of the uncleanness and fornication and lasciviousness which they have committed.

G3739 ὅς hós ho probably a primary word (or perhaps a form of the article ὁ); the relatively (sometimes demonstrative) pronoun, who, which, what, that:--one, (an-, the) other, some, that, what, which, who(-m, -se), etc. See also οὗ., 		ὃςhos who RelPro-NMS
G1519εἰςeis   (Prep)
G1519 εἰς eis ice a primary preposition; to or into (indicating the point reached or entered), of place, time, or (figuratively) purpose (result, etc.); also in adverbial phrases:--(abundant-)ly, against, among, as, at, (back-)ward, before, by, concerning, + continual, + far more exceeding, for (intent, purpose), fore, + forth, in (among, at, unto, -so much that, -to), to the intent that, + of one mind, + never, of, (up-)on, + perish, + set at one again, (so) that, therefore(-unto), throughout, til, to (be, the end, -ward), (here-)until(-to), …ward, (where-)fore, with. Often used in composition with the same general import, but only with verbs (etc.) expressing motion (literally or figuratively). 		εἰςeis toward Prep

3 Since you seek a proof of Christ speaking in me, which to you-ward not is weak, but is mighty in you.2 Corinthians 13:3
Stats
Counts: 100 characters, 19 words, 76 letters, 30 vowels, 46 consonants
Translation
Greek: επει δοκιμην ζητειτε του εν εμοι λαλουντος χριστου ος εις υμας ουκ ασθενει αλλα δυνατει εν υμιν

Lit: since a proof you seek, in me speaking of Christ, who toward you not is weak, but is powerful among you.

KJV: Since ye seek a proof of Christ speaking in me, which to you-ward is not weak, but is mighty in you.
References

"ye seek"
2Co 10:8-10: For though I should boast somewhat more of our authority: which the Lord has given us for edification: not and for your destruction: I not should be ashamed:

"Christ"
2Co 2:10: To whom you forgive any thing: I forgive also: for if I forgave any thing: to whom I forgave it: for your sakes forgave I it in the person of Christ;
Mt 10:20: For it not is you that speak: but the Spirit of your Father which speaks in you.
Mt 18:18-20: Truly I say to you: Whatever you will bind on earth will be bound in heaven: and whatever you will loose on earth will be loosed in heaven.
Lu 21:15: For I will give you a mouth and wisdom: which all your adversaries will not be able to gainsay nor resist.
1Co 5:4: 5: In the name of our Lord Jesus Christ: when you are gathered together: and my spirit: with the power of our Lord Jesus Christ:

"which"
2Co 2:6: Sufficient to such a man is this punishment: which was inflicted of many.
2Co 3:1-3: Do we begin again to commend ourselves? or need we: as some others: epistles of commendation to you: or letters of commendation from you?
2Co 12:12: Truly the signs of an apostle were wrought among you in all patience: in signs: and wonders: and mighty deeds.
1Co 9:1-3: Am not I an apostle? am not I free? have not I seen Jesus Christ our Lord? not are you my work in the Lord?

G2532 καί kaí kahee apparently, a primary particle, having a copulative and sometimes also a cumulative force; and, also, even, so then, too, etc.; often used in connection (or composition) with other particles or small words:--and, also, both, but, even, for, if, or, so, that, then, therefore, when, yet. 		καὶkai And Conj

4 For though He was crucified through weakness, yet He lives by the power of God. For we also are weak in Him, but we will live with Him by the power of God toward you.2 Corinthians 13:4
Stats
Counts: 168 characters, 32 words, 130 letters, 49 vowels, 81 consonants
Translation
Greek: και γαρ ει εσταυρωθη εξ ασθενειας αλλα ζη εκ δυναμεως θεου και γαρ {VAR2: και } ημεις ασθενουμεν εν αυτω αλλα ζησομεθα συν αυτω εκ δυναμεως θεου εις υμας

Lit: And for He was crucified in weakness, yet He lives by power God’s. Also for we are weak in Him, but we will live with Him by power God’s toward you.

KJV: For though he was crucified through weakness, yet he liveth by the power of God. For we also are weak in him, but we shall live with him by the power of God toward you.
References

"he was"
Lu 22:43: 44: There appeared an angel to him from heaven: strengthening him.
Joh 10:18: No man takes it from me: but I lay it down of myself. I have power to lay it down: and I have power to take it again. This commandment have I received of my Father.
1Co 15:43: It is sown in dishonour; it is raised in glory: it is sown in weakness; it is raised in power:
Php 2:7: 8: But made himself of no reputation: and took upon him the form of a servant: and was made in the likeness of men:
Heb 5:7: Who in the days of his flesh: when he had offered up prayers and supplications with strong crying and tears to him that was able to save him from death: and was heard in that he feared;
1Pe 3:18: For Christ also has once suffered for sins: the just for the unjust: that He might bring us to God: being put to death in the flesh: but quickened by the Spirit:

"yet"
Ac 2:36: Therefore let all the house of Israel know assuredly: that God has made that same Jesus: whom you have crucified: both Lord and Christ.
Ac 4:10-12: Be it known to you all: and to all the people of Israel: that by the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth: whom you crucified: whom God raised from the dead: even by Him does this man stand here before you whole.
Ro 6:4: 9: 10: Therefore we are buried with Him by baptism into death: that like as Christ was raised up from the dead by the glory of the Father: even so we also should walk in newness of life.
Ro 14:9: For to this end Christ both died: and rose: and revived: that He might be Lord both of the dead and living.
Eph 1:19-23: What is the exceeding greatness of his power to us-ward who believe: according to the working of his mighty power:
Php 2:9-11: For what reason God also has highly exalted Him: and given Him a name which is above every name:
1Pe 3:18: 22: For Christ also has once suffered for sins: the just for the unjust: that He might bring us to God: being put to death in the flesh: but quickened by the Spirit:
Re 1:17: 18: When I saw him: I fell at his feet as dead. And he laid his right hand upon me: saying to me: not Fear; I am the first and the last:

"we also"
2Co 4:7-12: But we have this treasure in earthen vessels: that the excellency of the power may be of God: not and of us.
2Co 10:3: 4: 10: For though we walk in the flesh: we not do war after the flesh:
1Co 2:3: I was with you in weakness: and in fear: and in much trembling.

"in him"
Php 3:10: That I may know him: and the power of his resurrection: and the fellowship of his sufferings: being made conformable to his death;
2Ti 2:11: 12: It is a faithful saying: For if we be dead with him: we will also live with him:

"but"
Ac 3:16: His name through faith in his name has made this man strong: whom you see and know: yes: the faith which is by him has given him this perfect soundness in the presence of you all.
Ro 6:8-11: Now if we be dead with Christ: we believe that we will also live with Him:

 εαυτους πειραζετε ει εστε εν τη πιστει εαυτους δοκιμαζετε η ουκ επιγινωσκετε εαυτους οτι ιησους χριστος εν υμιν εστιν ει μη τι αδοκιμοι εστε

G1438 ἑαυτοῦ heautoû heh-ow-too from a reflexive pronoun otherwise obsolete and the genitive case (dative case or accusative case) of αὐτός; him- (her-, it-, them-, also (in conjunction with the personal pronoun of the other persons) my-, thy-, our-, your-) self (selves), etc.:--alone, her (own, -self), (he) himself, his (own), itself, one (to) another, our (thine) own(-selves), + that she had, their (own, own selves), (of) them(-selves), they, thyself, you, your (own, own conceits, own selves, -selves)., 		ἙαυτοὺςHeautous Yourselves RefPro-AM3P

G1487εἰei   (Conj)
G1487 εἰ ei i a primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.:--forasmuch as, if, that, (al-)though, whether. Often used in connection or composition with other particles, especially as in εἴγε, εἰ δὲ μή(γε), εἰ καί, εἰ μή, εἰ μή τι, εἴ περ, εἴ πως, εἴ τις, ἐκ. See also ἐάν. 		εἰei whether Conj

G4102πίστει,pistei   (N-DFS)

5 Examine yourselves, whether you be in the faith; prove your own selves. Know you not your own selves, how that Jesus Christ is in you, except you be reprobates?2 Corinthians 13:5
Stats
Rank: #1679 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 157 characters, 24 words, 123 letters, 48 vowels, 75 consonants
Translation
Greek: εαυτους πειραζετε ει εστε εν τη πιστει εαυτους δοκιμαζετε η ουκ επιγινωσκετε εαυτους οτι ιησους χριστος εν υμιν εστιν ει μη τι αδοκιμοι εστε

Lit: Yourselves examine whether you are in the faith; yourselves test. Or not do you recognize yourselves that Jesus Christ is in you, if not unapproved you are?

KJV: Examine yourselves, whether ye be in the faith; prove your own selves. Know ye not your own selves, how that Jesus Christ is in you, except ye be reprobates?
References

"Examine"
Ps 17:3: You have proved my heart; you have visited me in the night; you have tried me: and will not findhing; I am purposed that my mouth will not transgress.
Ps 26:2: Examine me: O LORD: and prove me; try my reins and my heart.
Ps 119:59: I thought on my ways: and turned my feet to your testimonies.
Ps 139:23: 24: Search me: O God: and know my heart: try me: and know my thoughts:
La 3:40: Let us search and try our ways: and turn again to the LORD.
Eze 18:28: Because he considers: and turns away from all his transgressions that he has committed: he will surely live: he will not die.
Hag 1:5: 7: Now therefore thus says the LORD of hosts; Consider your ways.
1Co 11:28: 31: But let a man examine himself: and so let him eat of that bread: and drink of that cup.
Ga 6:4: But let every man prove his own work: and then will he have rejoicing in himself alone: not and in another.
Heb 4:1: Let us therefore fear: lest: a promise being left us of entering into his rest: any of you should seem to come short of it.
Heb 12:15: Looking diligently lest'>lest any man fail of the grace of God; lest'>lest any root of bitterness springing up trouble you: and thereby many be defiled;
1Jo 3:20: 21: For if our heart condemn us: God is greater than our heart: and knows all things.
Re 2:5: Remember therefore from where you are fallen: and repent: and do the first works; or else I will come to you quickly: and will remove your candlestick out of his place: except you repent.
Re 3:2: 3: Be watchful: and strengthen the things which remain: that are ready to die: for I not have found your works perfect before God.

"in the faith"
Col 1:23: If you continue in the faith grounded and settled: and be not moved away from the hope of the gospel: which you have heard: and which was preached to every creature which is under heaven; whereof I Paul am made a minister;
Col 2:7: Rooted and built up in him: and stablished in the faith: as you have been taught: abounding therein with thanksgiving.
1Ti 2:15: Notwithstanding she will be saved in childbearing: if they continue in faith and charity and holiness with sobriety.
Tit 1:13: This witness is true. For what reason rebuke them sharply: that they may be sound in the faith;
Tit 2:2: That the aged men be sober: grave: temperate: sound in faith: in charity: in patience.
1Pe 5:9: Whom resist stedfast in the faith: knowing that the same afflictions are accomplished in your brothers that are in the world.

"Know"
1Co 3:16: Know you not that you are the temple of God: and that the Spirit of God dwells in you?
1Co 6:2: 15: 19: Do you not know that the saints will judge the world? and if the world will be judged by you: are you unworthy to judge the small matters?
1Co 9:24: Know you not that they which run in a race run all: but one receives the prize? So run: that you may obtain.
Jas 4:4: You adulterers and adulteresses: know you not that the friendship of the world is enmity with God? whoever therefore will be a friend of the world is the enemy of God.

"Jesus Christ"
2Co 6:16: What agreement has the temple of God with idols? for you are the temple of the living God; as God has said: I will dwell in them: and walk in them; and I will be their God: and they will be my people.
Joh 6:56: He who eats my flesh: and drinks my blood: dwells in me: and I in him.
Joh 14:23: Jesus answered and said to Him: If a man love me: He will keep my words: and my Father will love Him: and we will come to Him: and make our abode with Him.
Joh 15:4: Abide in me: and I in you. As the branch cannot bear fruit of itself: except it abide in the vine; no more can you: except you abide in me.
Joh 17:23: 26: I in them: and you in me: that they may be made perfect in one; and that the world may know that you have sent me: and have loved them: as you have loved me.
Ro 8:10: If Christ be in you: the body is dead because of sin; but the Spirit is life because of righteousness.
Ga 2:20: I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; not yet I: but Christ lives in me: and the life which I now live in the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God: who loved me: and gave Himself for me.
Ga 4:19: My little children: of whom I travail in birth again until Christ be formed in you:
Eph 2:20-22: Are built upon the foundation of the apostles and prophets: Jesus Christ Himself being the chief corner stone;
Eph 3:17: That Christ may dwell in your hearts by faith; that you: being rooted and grounded in love:
Col 1:27: To whom God would make known what is the riches of the glory of this mystery among the Gentiles; which is Christ in you: the hope of glory:
Col 2:19: not And holding the Head: from which all the body by joints and bands having nourishment ministered: and knit together: increases with the increase of God.
1Pe 2:4: 5: To whom coming: as to a living stone: disallowed indeed of men: but chosen of God: and precious:

"reprobates"
2Co 13:6: 7: But I trust that you will know that we not are reprobates.
Jer 6:30: Reprobate silver will men call them: because the LORD has rejected them.
Ro 1:28: Even as they not did like to retain God in their knowledge: God gave them over to a reprobate mind: to do those things which not are convenient;
2Ti 3:8: Now as Jannes and Jambres withstood Moses: so do these also resist the truth: men of corrupt minds: reprobate concerning the faith.
Tit 1:16: They profess that they know God; but in works they deny Him: being abominable: and disobedient: and to every good work reprobate.
1Co 9:27: But I keep under my body: and bring it into subjection: lest that by any means: when I have preached to others: I myself should be a castaway.
Heb 6:8: But that which bears thorns and briers is rejected: and is nigh to cursing; whose end is to be burned.

6 But I trust that you will know that we not are reprobates.2 Corinthians 13:6
Stats
Counts: 58 characters, 12 words, 46 letters, 16 vowels, 30 consonants
Translation
Greek: ελπιζω δε οτι γνωσεσθε οτι ημεις ουκ εσμεν αδοκιμοι

Lit: I hope now that you will know that we not are unapproved.

KJV: But I trust that ye shall know that we are not reprobates.
References

"But I trust that ye shall know that we are not reprobates."

G4314πρὸςpros   (Prep)
G4314 πρός prós pros a strengthened form of πρό; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. toward (with the genitive case, the side of, i.e. pertaining to; with the dative case, by the side of, i.e. near to; usually with the accusative case, the place, time, occasion, or respect, which is the destination of the relation, i.e. whither or for which it is predicated):--about, according to , against, among, at, because of, before, between, (where-)by, for, X at thy house, in, for intent, nigh unto, of, which pertain to, that, to (the end that), X together, to (you) -ward, unto, with(-in). In the comparative case, it denotes essentially the same applications, namely, motion towards, accession to, or nearness at. 		πρὸςpros to Prep

G3361μὴmē   (Adv)
G3361 μή mḗ may a primary particle of qualified negation (whereas οὐ expresses an absolute denial); (adverb) not, (conjunction) lest; also (as an interrogative implying a negative answer (whereas οὐ expects an affirmative one)) whether:--any but (that), X forbear, + God forbid, + lack, lest, neither, never, no (X wise in), none, nor, (can-)not, nothing, that not, un(-taken), without. G1161 δέ dé deh a primary particle (adversative or continuative); but, and, etc.:--also, and, but, moreover, now (often unexpressed in English). 		δὲde though Conj
G5613ὡςhōs   (Adv)
G5613 ὡς hōs hoce probably adverb of comparative from ὅς; which how, i.e. in that manner (very variously used, as follows):--about, after (that), (according) as (it had been, it were), as soon (as), even as (like), for, how (greatly), like (as, unto), since, so (that), that, to wit, unto, when(-soever), while, X with all speed. 		ὡςhōs as Adv
G96ἀδόκιμοιadokimoi   (Adj-NMP)
G96 ἀδόκιμος adókimos ad-ok-ee-mos from Α (as a negative particle) and δόκιμος; unapproved, i.e. rejected; by implication, worthless (literally or morally):--castaway, rejected, reprobate. 		ἀδόκιμοιadokimoi unapproved Adj-NMP
G1510ὦμεν.ōmen   (V-PSA-1P)

7 Now I pray to God that you do no evil; not that we should appear approved, but that you should do that which is ho, though we be as reprobates.2 Corinthians 13:7
Stats
Counts: 145 characters, 27 words, 112 letters, 42 vowels, 70 consonants
Translation
Greek: ευχομαι δε προς τον θεον μη ποιησαι υμας κακον μηδεν ουχ ινα ημεις δοκιμοι φανωμεν αλλ ινα υμεις το καλον ποιητε ημεις δε ως αδοκιμοι ωμεν

Lit: We pray now to God, not to do you wrong nothing, not that we approved might appear, but that you what is right may do; we though as unapproved might appear.

KJV: Now I pray to God that ye do no evil; not that we should appear approved, but that ye should do that which is honest, though we be as reprobates.
References

"I pray"
2Co 13:9: For we are glad: when we are weak: and you are strong: and this also we wish: even your perfection.
1Ch 4:10: Jabez called on the God of Israel: saying: Oh that you would'>would bless me indeed: and enlarge my coast: and that your hand might be with me: and that you would'>would keep me from evil: that it not may grieve me! And God granted Him that which He requested.
Mt 6:13: Lead not us into temptation: but deliver us from evil: For your is the kingdom: and the power: and the glory: for ever. Amen.
Joh 17:15: I not pray that you should'>should take them out of the world: but that you should'>should keep them from the evil.
Php 1:9-11: This I pray: that your love may abound yet more and more in knowledge and in all judgment;
1Th 5:23: The very God of peace sanctify you wholly; and I pray God your whole spirit and soul and body be preserved blameless to the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.
2Ti 4:18: The Lord will deliver me from every evil work: and will preserve me to His heavenly kingdom: to whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen.

"approved"
2Co 6:4: But in all things approving ourselves as the ministers of God: in much patience: in afflictions: in necessities: in distresses:
2Co 10:18: not For He that'>He who commends'>commends Himself is approved: but whom the Lord commends'>commends.
Ro 16:10: Greet Apelles approved in Christ. Greet them which are of Aristobulus' household.
1Co 11:19: For there must be also heresies among you: that they which are approved may be made manifest among you.
2Ti 2:15: Study to show yourself approved to God: a workman that needs not to be ashamed: rightly dividing the word of truth.
Jas 1:12: Blessed is the man that endures temptation: for when He is tried: He will receive the crown of life: which the Lord has promised to them that love Him.

"honest"
2Co 8:21: Providing for ho things: not only in the sight of the Lord: but also in the sight of men.
Ro 12:17: Recompense to no man evil for evil. Provide things ho in the sight of all men.
Ro 13:13: Let us walk honestly: as in the day; not in rioting and drunkenness: not in chambering and wantonness: not in strife and envying.
Php 4:8: Finally: brothers: whatever things are true: whatever things are ho: whatever things are just: whatever things are pure: whatever things are lovely: whatever things are of good report; if there be any virtue: and if there be any praise: think on these things.
1Ti 2:2: For kings: and for all that are in authority; that we may lead a quiet and peaceable life in all godliness and honesty.
1Pe 2:12: Having your conversation ho among the Gentiles: that: whereas they speak against you as evildoers: they may by your good works: which they will look: glorify God in the day of visitation.

"as reprobates"
2Co 6:8: 9: By honour and dishonour: by evil report and good report: as deceivers: and yet true;
2Co 10:10: For his letters: say they: are weighty and powerful; but his bodily presence is weak: and his speech contemptible.
1Co 4:9-13: For I think that God has set forth us the apostles last: as it were appointed to death: for we are made a spectacle to the world: and to angels: and to men.

8 For we can not dohing against the truth, but for the truth.2 Corinthians 13:8
Stats
Counts: 59 characters, 11 words, 46 letters, 15 vowels, 31 consonants
Translation
Greek: ου γαρ δυναμεθα τι κατα της αληθειας αλλ υπερ της αληθειας

Lit: Nothing for have we power any against the truth, but for the truth.

KJV: For we can do nothing against the truth, but for the truth.

9 For we are glad, when we are weak, and you are strong: and this also we wish, even your perfection.2 Corinthians 13:9
Stats
Counts: 98 characters, 16 words, 74 letters, 30 vowels, 44 consonants
Translation
Greek: χαιρομεν γαρ οταν ημεις ασθενωμεν υμεις δε δυνατοι ητε τουτο δε και ευχομεθα την υμων καταρτισιν

Lit: We rejoice for when we might be weak, you however strong might be. But this also: We pray for the of you perfection.

KJV: For we are glad, when we are weak, and ye are strong: and this also we wish, even your perfection.
References

"when"
2Co 13:8: For we can not dohing against the truth: but for the truth.
2Co 11:30: If I must needs glory: I will glory of the things which concern my infirmities.
2Co 12:5-10: Of such an one will I glory: yet of myself I not will glory: but in my infirmities.
1Co 4:10: We are fools for Christ's sake: but you are wise in Christ; we are weak: but you are strong; you are honourable: but we are despised.

"even"
2Co 13:7: 11: Now I pray to God that you do no evil; not that we should appear approved: but that you should do that which is ho: though we be as reprobates.
2Co 7:1: Having therefore these promises: dearly beloved: let us cleanse ourselves from all filthiness of the flesh and spirit: perfecting holiness in the fear of God.
Eph 4:13: Till we all come in the unity of the faith: and of the knowledge of the Son of God: to a perfect man: to the measure of the stature of the fulness of Christ:
Php 3:12-15: Not as though I had already attained: either were already perfect: but I follow after: if that I may apprehend that for which also I am apprehended of Christ Jesus.
Col 1:28: Whom we preach: warning every man: and teaching every man in all wisdom; that we may present every man perfect in Christ Jesus:
Col 4:12: Epaphras: who is one of you: a servant of Christ: salutes you: always labouring fervently for you in prayers: that you may stand perfect and complete in all the will of God.
1Th 3:10: Night and day praying exceedingly that we might see your face: and might perfect that which is lacking in your faith?
2Ti 3:17: That the man of God may be perfect: throughly furnished to all good works.
Heb 6:1: Therefore leaving the principles of the doctrine of Christ: let us go on to perfection; not laying again the foundation of repentance from dead works: and of faith toward God:
Heb 12:23: To the general assembly and church of the firstborn: which are written in heaven: and to God the Judge of all: and to the spirits of just men made perfect:
Heb 13:21: Make you perfect in every good work to do His will: working in you that which is wellpleasing in His sight: through Jesus Christ; to whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen.
1Pe 5:10: But the God of all grace: who has called us to His eternal glory by Christ Jesus: after that you have suffered a while: make you perfect: stablish: strengthen: settle you.

G3361μὴmē   (Adv)
G3361 μή mḗ may a primary particle of qualified negation (whereas οὐ expresses an absolute denial); (adverb) not, (conjunction) lest; also (as an interrogative implying a negative answer (whereas οὐ expects an affirmative one)) whether:--any but (that), X forbear, + God forbid, + lack, lest, neither, never, no (X wise in), none, nor, (can-)not, nothing, that not, un(-taken), without. G1849 ἐξουσία exousía ex-oo-see-ah from ἔξεστι (in the sense of ability); privilege, i.e. (subjectively) force, capacity, competency, freedom, or (objectively) mastery (concretely, magistrate, superhuman, potentate, token of control), delegated influence:--authority, jurisdiction, liberty, power, right, strength. 		ἐξουσίανexousian authority N-AFS
G3739ἣνhēn   (RelPro-AFS)
G3739 ὅς hós ho probably a primary word (or perhaps a form of the article ὁ); the relatively (sometimes demonstrative) pronoun, who, which, what, that:--one, (an-, the) other, some, that, what, which, who(-m, -se), etc. See also οὗ., 		ἣνhēn that RelPro-AFS

G3588 ὁ ho to the definite article; the (sometimes to be supplied, at others omitted, in English idiom):--the, this, that, one, he, she, it, etc., 		ὁho the Art-NMS

G2962 κύριος kýrios koo-ree-os from (supremacy); supreme in authority, i.e. (as noun) controller; by implication, Master (as a respectful title):-- God, Lord, master, Sir. 		ΚύριοςKyrios Lord N-NMS
G1325ἔδωκένedōken   (V-AIA-3S)
G1325 δίδωμι dídōmi did-o-mee a prolonged form of a primary verb (which is used as an alternative in most of the tenses); to give (used in a very wide application, properly, or by implication, literally or figuratively; greatly modified by the connection):--adventure, bestow, bring forth, commit, deliver (up), give, grant, hinder, make, minister, number, offer, have power, put, receive, set, shew, smite (+ with the hand), strike (+ with the palm of the hand), suffer, take, utter, yield. 		ἔδωκένedōken has given V-AIA-3S
G1473μοιmoi   (PPro-D1S)
G1473 ἐγώ egṓ eg-o a primary pronoun of the first person I (only expressed when emphatic):--I, me. For the other cases and the plural see ἐμέ, ἐμοί, ἐμοῦ, ἡμᾶς, ἡμεῖς, ἡμῖν, ἡμῶν, etc., 		μοιmoi me, PPro-D1S
G1519εἰςeis   (Prep)
G1519 εἰς eis ice a primary preposition; to or into (indicating the point reached or entered), of place, time, or (figuratively) purpose (result, etc.); also in adverbial phrases:--(abundant-)ly, against, among, as, at, (back-)ward, before, by, concerning, + continual, + far more exceeding, for (intent, purpose), fore, + forth, in (among, at, unto, -so much that, -to), to the intent that, + of one mind, + never, of, (up-)on, + perish, + set at one again, (so) that, therefore(-unto), throughout, til, to (be, the end, -ward), (here-)until(-to), …ward, (where-)fore, with. Often used in composition with the same general import, but only with verbs (etc.) expressing motion (literally or figuratively). 		εἰςeis for Prep
G3619οἰκοδομὴνoikodomēn   (N-AFS)
G3619 οἰκοδομή oikodomḗ oy-kod-om-ay feminine (abstract) of a compound of οἶκος and the base of δῶμα; architecture, i.e. (concretely) a structure; figuratively, confirmation:--building, edify(-ication, -ing). 		οἰκοδομὴνoikodomēn building up N-AFS
G2532καὶkai   (Conj)
G2532 καί kaí kahee apparently, a primary particle, having a copulative and sometimes also a cumulative force; and, also, even, so then, too, etc.; often used in connection (or composition) with other particles or small words:--and, also, both, but, even, for, if, or, so, that, then, therefore, when, yet. 		καὶkai and Conj
